column2: >Mindful kids will change our world. They will be our future generation of adults who understand who they are (both inside and out), their passions and talents, and use them to make positive changes on our planet.

column1: The biggest risk with the campaign is not having all of the materials ready, and online school launched by the mentioned date. However, we have been working hard to ensure that all materials are finished mindfully and beautifully and our online school is ready to launch as soon as possible.

I guarantee you will get the journals, curriculums, task cards, and access to the online courses, and I will do everything in my power to get them to you on time so you can start using them as soon as possible.
If problems do come up or you aren’t happy with your product or our courses, I promise to do everything I can to make it right.

Also, I am committed to being transparent and open during this whole process. If problems do come up, you’ll hear about them and you’ll hear how I am going to fix them. My number one goal is to have materials and online content ready as soon as possible, so we can bring this work to the world!
Share us and get a Mindful Journal and Coloring Page for free!

I truly believe in this comprehensive program and the tools we’ve created within it. I think it will add value to anyone—and I want you to have access to all of that value, whether you donate to the project or not.
And so, we have created a downloadable Coloring and Journal Page for you to enjoy!

All you have to do is share our project on social media, and then send us a note at thewholenhappy@gmail.com with a screenshot or a link of where you shared it, and we will send you a Mindful Coloring Page!
To share this project in just one easy click, use the link below to get a pre-populated Facebook share you can post directly to your account!
https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=ht...
With Love,
Kelsey Beth

","The Whole n' Happy is the first online, multi-dimensional mindfulness school in the world. It's made to empower our future generation to connect to their own truth in this world.It's an online space to learn, engage, and explore who you are, on the inside and out.  It's a comprehensive approach to learning made to empower our children and prepare them for our future world.  We do this by providing students, teachers and parents a series of engaging online courses with aligned mindfulness meditations, and a community of like-minded educators who are inspired to educate our children in new ways.  Our online courses are paired with a mindfulness app (for the classroom or home) and an easy-to-read handbook that describes each mindfulness strategy in detail and gives suggestions for simple implementation.​​ With each skill or strategy, there are aligned audio meditations and creative journal pages made specifically for self-exploration! And our immersive, on-site trainings at schools bring the techniques to real life with an interactive Mindfulness Toolkit to help teachers and students better understand how the practices relate to their own lives.
Who We Are and What We Do:
Hello. My name is Kelsey Beth. I am an international educator, designer, mindfulness activist, and citizen of the world.
I want every child to be seen and met exactly as they are.
I want our future generation to know and develop their own truth and purpose for being on this planet.
I want to transform the way we Educate our children and our future, from the inside-out.

This vision grew from my experiences working and teaching around the globe. During this time, I transformed from a young, and passionate teacher to a stressed-out and unhealthy educator, who felt the intense demands of our constantly changing Education Systems.
I was teaching a curriculum I didn’t believe in and administering standardized tests that was against what I believed was good for the children.
I spent my breaks doing administrative work instead of planning and truly being there for the kids.
My Vision of Education empowers individuals and allows their natural talents and passions to unfold, instead of placing them in a box, on a scale, or assigned to a number.
With Your Support:
With your support, we will be able to:
Launch the first-ever sustainable, online mindfulness school in the world
Provide series of engaging online mindfulness courses with aligned, audio meditations for teachers and parents, so they can bring the techniques back to their workplaces and homes

Provide for travel costs between our pilot schools ($2,000)
With your support, we will be able to bring our life-changing work to kids, teachers, and parents around the world.

When I brought this program to my own classroom in the previous years, I have  seen fundamental shifts in how the students related to themselves, others, and their environment.
Mindful kids will change our World because they:
Can breathe through difficult situations and are aware of their own behavior and emotions

Are able to think in different ways in order to solve problems on their own
Experience reduced stress, anxiety, and reactivity to difficult situations
Are able to trace their own thoughts and explain how their thoughts are related to their own  feelings, or actions
Have an improved sense of confidence and self-worth and are able to acknowledge their own strengths
Experience a greater sense of calm and inner peace, as well as improved sleep
Have a deep awareness and understanding of themselves
Are able to connect with others in meaningful ways
Experience greater mental, emotional, and physical well-being, positive emotion, and social connections

Mindful kids will change our world. They will be our future generation of adults who understand who they are (both inside and out), their passions and talents, and use them to make positive changes on our planet.

Hello! My name is Nigel Brown, CEO/Founder of Lyncme, Inc. As a software engineer, I decided to build Lyncme, a social networking app to give social networking control back to the user with two concepts. Private &
column2:
Public Networks.
This means anyone can create his/her own private social networks by adding invited guests and excluding others. No more worrying about “catfishing”, or employers scanning your profiles because all posts, photos, and videos are private within your networks. Also, anyone you allow to join your networks will not be able to download anything they do not actually post. Put your friends in tiers! Separate friends from acquaintances! 

Public networks are available to keep you updated with content you care about such as:
• Nightlife – Never ask what to do anymore!
• Vacations – Plan your activities such as concerts, events and parties from the public nightlife network before your arrival.
• Searching for a Home to Buy or Rent – Join the public real estate network. You can find a home in your area, search another area, talk to a property agent, etc. Agents will now always know where the market base is when they need them. 
I have provided a multi-tiered platform that caters to your personal interests. See a party you like in the nightlife network? Interested in buying tickets to an event? Want to be the first to view a home? Well you have access directly within Lyncme!
Now you have a direct connection to everything you need to have a great social experience in one place! Best of all, you can separate your private networks from your public ones. You will now have control over your social networks feeds and the people within!



How Your Donation Will Help

column1: <li>

30% of your donations will be used to fund operational cost of the mobile build to stay on track for a android and ios launch this summer. This includes editing, research, design, marketing to grow our member recommendations, api maintenance, and development to make sure each public network is an customized experience to remember.
<li>

70% of your donations will be used to build a team that will significantly improve the user experience of finding and recommending business partner while also building the user base with a appealing UI. The goal is to launch by summer 2016.

If we don't meet our entire funding goals, this could delay launching on both Android or iPhone platforms. We would consider launching on one platform, for example on Android only.

The Founder

Lyncme  was founded by Nigel Brown. Most recently he serves as a Online Manager and Developer for the Dr Phillips Center for the Performing Arts. Nigel graduated from The University at Buffalo , with a B.A. Mathematics. He started his career in software development at a startup company in Buffalo, NY where he became seasoned and highly skilled at the trade very fast. He eventually transitioned to mobile development and full backend api server development.

column5: >The School in the Cloud is an educational initiative in which memorization takes a backseat to curiosity. The heart of this approach is the SOLE, or self-organized learning environment. In SOLEs, children work in groups, using the Internet to explore the kind of big questions that spark imagination. Rather than being tested on knowing the answers, students help each other discover answers or are encouraged by e-mediators in the ""Granny Cloud.""

column9: >SOLEs take place in locations as diverse as Greenland, where they are being used in a school with a large Inuit population, to the Indian jungle, where children walk to physical learning labs for the opportunity to experiment with SOLE.  Launched by Sugata Mitra with the 2013 TED Prize, the School in the Cloud is now a global phenomenon. Join us as we fundraise to spread SOLEs to classrooms around the world, and to places with limited access to traditional educators.

column2: >We aim to inspire students to ask and solve Big Questions while teaching each other the intricate paths of knowledge. After more than 400 SOLEs, we have seen students from 3 to 12 years of age collaborate, discuss information, think of creative ways to explain this information and then discuss findings to arrive to a diversity of answers. SOLE also seeks to understand how students self-organize for learning. More precisely, we are investigating how SOLE impacts students' reading comprehension, critical thinking and social skills.

>The Granny Cloud consists of 100+ dedicated volunteers from around the world who Skype into remote locations to chat with children. By encouraging kids rather than giving outright instruction, they guide students on their SOLE adventures. Don't be fooled by the name — you don't need to be an actual granny to be a part of the Granny Cloud. Grannies range in age from 24 to 78, and are both male and female. What they all share: a universal ""grandmother approach"" to education. By providing unconditional encouragement, Grannies create an environment where children can thrive.

>The whole concept started with putting computers in the slums of India, and now it’s become a global movement. Having seen the impact first-hand, I’m confident self-organized learning and School in the Cloud will play a large role in shaping the future of education. Please consider donating to help support the next chapter of School in the Cloud.

column13: >Your donations will help to support this movement and scale up School in the Cloud initiatives
column19: >1. Create new SOLE (Cost $1000 per SOLE)
column25: >2. Support each SOLE (Cost $10 per month per SOLE)

column2: >School in the Cloud has physical learning labs in India to experiment with all things SOLE. Dotted with computers and decorated with care, these labs create an environment that stimulates curiosity, and inspires kids to explore the world at their fingertips. From the School in the Cloud hub near Calcutta to remote labs in the jungle of West Bengal, these labs provide educational opportunities for children living there and give a sense of pride to communities that want to offer much more.

column5: >The Granny Cloud -Educators on call, via Skype

column2: >The Granny Cloud consists of 100+ dedicated volunteers from around the world who Skype into remote locations to chat with children. By encouraging kids rather than giving outright instruction, they guide students on their SOLE adventures. Don't be fooled by the name — you don't need to be an actual granny to be a part of the Granny Cloud. Grannies range in age from 24 to 78, and are both male and female. What they all share: a universal ""grandmother approach"" to education. By providing unconditional encouragement, Grannies create an environment where children can thrive.

>SOLEs are shaking up education in and out of the classroom. The School in the Cloud community has developed clustered, global SOLE networks around the world, from after school programs in Europe, to classrooms in South America. Research partners of Newcastle University's SOLE Central, these networks work with School in the Cloud to increase digital literacy, confidence and problem solving skills for their communities.

column1: ","Fundraising Campaign for the Future of Learning -
SOLE (Self Organised Learning Environment)

The School in the Cloud is an educational initiative in which memorization takes a backseat to curiosity. The heart of this approach is the SOLE, or self-organized learning environment. In SOLEs, children work in groups, using the Internet to explore the kind of big questions that spark imagination. Rather than being tested on knowing the answers, students help each other discover answers or are encouraged by e-mediators in the ""Granny Cloud.""

SOLEs take place in locations as diverse as Greenland, where they are being used in a school with a large Inuit population, to the Indian jungle, where children walk to physical learning labs for the opportunity to experiment with SOLE.  Launched by Sugata Mitra with the 2013 TED Prize, the School in the Cloud is now a global phenomenon. Join us as we fundraise to spread SOLEs to classrooms around the world, and to places with limited access to traditional educators.

We aim to inspire students to ask and solve Big Questions while teaching each other the intricate paths of knowledge. After more than 400 SOLEs, we have seen students from 3 to 12 years of age collaborate, discuss information, think of creative ways to explain this information and then discuss findings to arrive to a diversity of answers. SOLE also seeks to understand how students self-organize for learning. More precisely, we are investigating how SOLE impacts students' reading comprehension, critical thinking and social skills.

The Granny Cloud consists of 100+ dedicated volunteers from around the world who Skype into remote locations to chat with children. By encouraging kids rather than giving outright instruction, they guide students on their SOLE adventures. Don't be fooled by the name — you don't need to be an actual granny to be a part of the Granny Cloud. Grannies range in age from 24 to 78, and are both male and female. What they all share: a universal ""grandmother approach"" to education. By providing unconditional encouragement, Grannies create an environment where children can thrive.

The whole concept started with putting computers in the slums of India, and now it’s become a global movement. Having seen the impact first-hand, I’m confident self-organized learning and School in the Cloud will play a large role in shaping the future of education. Please consider donating to help support the next chapter of School in the Cloud.

Your Impact:Your donations will help to support this movement and scale up School in the Cloud initiatives1. Create new SOLE (Cost $1000 per SOLE)2. Support each SOLE (Cost $10 per month per SOLE)Learning Labs -Where kids guide the lesson

School in the Cloud has physical learning labs in India to experiment with all things SOLE. Dotted with computers and decorated with care, these labs create an environment that stimulates curiosity, and inspires kids to explore the world at their fingertips. From the School in the Cloud hub near Calcutta to remote labs in the jungle of West Bengal, these labs provide educational opportunities for children living there and give a sense of pride to communities that want to offer much more.
The Granny Cloud -Educators on call, via Skype

The Granny Cloud consists of 100+ dedicated volunteers from around the world who Skype into remote locations to chat with children. By encouraging kids rather than giving outright instruction, they guide students on their SOLE adventures. Don't be fooled by the name — you don't need to be an actual granny to be a part of the Granny Cloud. Grannies range in age from 24 to 78, and are both male and female. What they all share: a universal ""grandmother approach"" to education. By providing unconditional encouragement, Grannies create an environment where children can thrive.
Global SOLES - A global education community

SOLEs are shaking up education in and out of the classroom. The School in the Cloud community has developed clustered, global SOLE networks around the world, from after school programs in Europe, to classrooms in South America. Research partners of Newcastle University's SOLE Central, these networks work with School in the Cloud to increase digital literacy, confidence and problem solving skills for their communities.
Incentives
We appreciate your support! Check out the rewards you can receive while supporting our mission:
$5 : Thank you email
$10: Thank you email and Thank You note on Facebook page
$25: School in the Cloud website mention - Donate $25 and we'll add your name to the School in the Cloud website.
$75: Thank you note from the children -You will receive a Thank You card from the children at the School in the Cloud labs in India, in addition to their name on the website.
$150: Engraved plaque : Donate $150 and your name will be engraved on a plaque at one of the Indian School in the Cloud labs, and added to the website.

$500 SOLE session with Sugata Mitra for a classroom of your choice : Individuals who donate $500 will have the opportunity to have a Skype SOLE session with TED Prize winner Sugata Mitra, in addition to their name on the website.

$1000: Name a SOLE, may be name after your family name or dedicate to someone beloved You will enjoy naming rights of one SOLE, along with a phone/skype call from TED Prize winner Sugata Mitra, in addition to their name on the website.

Para la población peruana es muy importante conocer sobre arquitectura, debido a la multiplicidad de posibilidades de desarrollo y de reflexión de nuestro entorno que ofrece esta carrera.

En la mayoría de universidades se enseña cómo diseñar y construir para solucionar los problemas más urgentes. También es importante enseñar a pensar sobre la arquitectura.

Sin un pensamiento de fondo, estamos condenados a repetir los mismos errores.

Un grupo de jóvenes arquitectos de EALIMA y estudiantes de arquitectura de la Pontificia Universidad Católica del Perú hemos decidido realizar el workshop SOURCING ARCHITECTURE.

La importancia de este workshop, que se desarrollará en Lima, consiste en tomarse un tiempo para pensar sobre arquitectura y urbanismo en una realidad donde ni siquiera el alcalde de la ciudad lo hace.

Además, hemos decidido ofrecer el workshop sin ningún costo para los estudiantes. De esta manera, los 60 estudiantes que participen del workshop no serán solamente aquellos que puedan pagarlo, sino los que demuestren mayor interés e ingenio en su carta de motivación. Así podríamos tener participantes de distintas realidades de nuestro país.

El único costo que tendrá el taller serán las horas trabajadas por los estudiantes para desarrollar sus proyectos. Deseamos que los participantes se esfuercen al máximo para obtener proyectos interesantes que serán publicados en un libro digital.

Sin embargo, en realidad la organización de un workshop gratuito para los estudiantes de pocos recursos económicos en el Perú sí tiene un costo y nosotros, arquitectos de EALIMA y estudiantes del Centro Federado FAU-PUCP, hemos decidido recurrir al público en general para solicitar su apoyo que nos permita solventar todos los gastos.

Esperamos que los conocimientos adquiridos en este evento puedan ser usados para comprender a mayor profundidad la arquitectura y el urbanismo en las ciudades latinoamericanas y así mejorar la calidad de vida en ellas.

También deseamos que este tipo de eventos se repliquen en diferentes ciudades del Perú y Latinoamérica. Con tu contribución económica o publicando este evento en tus redes sociales, podremos llegar a conseguir el éxito de la campaña en todos sus alcances.

El financiamiento

Para que este evento sea financiado al 100% se necesitan un total de $7,500.00. Este dinero está divido en 3 rubros:

1. Profesores del workshop.-

2. Profesores expositores.-

3. Gastos generales: La organización, el diseño gráfico y publicidad, la edición del libro y filmación del evento tienen una cifra importante en el presupuesto total que es necesario cubrir para el éxito del workshop.

Recompensas 

Para las personas que deseen colaborar con donaciones, tenemos una serie de recompensas que pueden interesarles. Desde afiches y gráficas de arquitectura, hasta los videos de las conferencias editadas y enviadas en DVD. Así también, el libro digital del workshop, el diseño de anteproyectos arquitectónicos, de interiores o de mobiliario, exclusivos, por parte del arquitecto peruano Arturo Gutiérrez y la ingeniera arquitecta de República Checa, Eva Bortelová.

Workshop EALIMA 2017: SOURCING ARCHITECTURE

Para mayores detalles del workshop pueden revisar el siguiente enlace:

http://workshopealima2017.strikingly.com/

En el workshop nos pondremos a analizar 21 obras de arquitectura de Lima. SOURCING ARCHITECTURE es un concepto difícil de traducir pues significa al mismo tiempo: ‘buscando el origen’, o ‘la fuente de la arquitectura’, o ‘el abastecimiento de la arquitectura’. Por ello decidimos dejar el título en inglés, abierto a más interpretaciones.

Riesgos y desafíos

El trabajo para mejorar Lima y las ciudades latinoamericanas es muy complejo y requerirá de muchos años, pero nosotros pensamos que no es bueno quedarnos sin hacer nada. Lo primero que podemos hacer, desde nuestra carrera de arquitectura, es alentar a los futuros arquitectos para que la entiendan cada vez mejor. Es un granito de arena en un amplio desierto. Pero nosotros, EALIMA y el Centro Federado de la FAU - PUCP hemos decidido contribuir con algo que podrá ser replicado y alcanzar mayor notoriedad.

Es posible el error, pero a diferencia de muchas instituciones educativas que castigan el error, nosotros creemos que este nos vuelve más experimentados y fuertes.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Si no te es posible realizar una donación económica, puedes ayudarnos difundiendo la campaña entre tus amigos y familiares. De esta forma podremos hacer una red más amplia para que el conocimiento sobre la arquitectura y la ciudad involucre a más personas.

Comparte la campaña y la web del evento a través de tu Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest, Instagram, WhatsApp u otro medio a tu alcance.

¡Todos podemos ayudar a hacer realidad este curso, para demostrar que es posible tener una educación arquitectónica de calidad y de libre acceso en el Perú!

Comité Organizador

EALIMA

Arq. Arturo Gutiérrez, Mg. Arq. Boris Lefevre y Dis. Fernando Gutiérrez.

Mesa Directiva CEFAU – PUCP

Karen Magnolia Tapia Gil, Mario André De Los Santos, Claudia Fabiana Narvasta Soto, Daniela Elízabeth Díaz Tenorio, Karla Susan Berna Peña Medrano, Alex Joao Michuy Sánchez, Moisés Junior Díaz García, Francis Alejandro Bustamante Figueroa, Naysha Rashell Rojas Canchaya, Diego Antonio Vivas Huaccho, Boris Alberto Sanchez Guvara, Arturo Alexander Cochatoma Serrano, Francis Wiliam Vigo Díaz, Emmanuel Andrés Marcelo Moreyra, Lidia Mercedes Espinoza Mendoza, Laura Marcela Durand Saavedra.

También es importante enseñar a pensar sobre la arquitectura.Sin un pensamiento de fondo, estamos condenados a repetir los mismos errores.Un grupo de jóvenes arquitectos de EALIMA y estudiantes de arquitectura de la Pontificia Universidad Católica del Perú hemos decidido realizar el workshop SOURCING ARCHITECTURE.La importancia de este workshop, que se desarrollará en Lima, consiste en tomarse un tiempo para pensar sobre arquitectura y urbanismo en una realidad donde ni siquiera el alcalde de la ciudad lo hace.Además, hemos decidido ofrecer el workshop sin ningún costo para los estudiantes. [ENG]

Namaste our friend!

We write to you from the land of the Himalayas in order to ask for your collaboration in a task we find truly important. Let us tell you more about us and about what we do.

Kathmandu Jazz Conservatory is the most recognised music school in Nepal. We opened our doors 10 years ago and since then and, since then, we did not stop putting together a great team who fosters music culture in this country.

At KJC we try our best to improve people's life through music. We truly enjoy teaching our students while offering them a means of expression. To do so, we mix Nepal's rich music tradition with the Western one in order to preserve the country's cultural heritage and add a quality training on top.

On this video you will be able to see some of the social projects we are involved in since 2007: from free music lessons to work in orphanages and activities in schools throughout the whole country after the 2015 earhquake.

One of our main goals is to empower society through music. That is why we work alongside local NGOs, orphanages and schools, so everyone can have access to education, no matter their economic status. The 2015 earthquake could not stop us, so will not stop now!

On top of this, we organize musical events that foster appreciation and learning through art in all ages: concerts, festivals and camps so kids and adults alike can enjoy music the same way we do.

We need your support now to keep on offering more lessons, acquire instruments and books, offer jobs and training to local musicians and educators and organize free events. The whole point is to facilitate access to culture and education to all levels in Nepal, exactly the same way it happens in your country.

Our labor is not easy. No one said it would be. Though we have been working hard in the past years, getting support from marvelous people from all over the globe that, same as you, believes in the ability music has to heal and improve people's lives.

We invite you to collaborate and become part of the KJC family.

Dhanyabhad!

[ESP]

Namaste amigo/a

Te escribimos desde la tierra de los Himalayas para pedir tu colaboración en una labor que creemos realmente importante. Déjanos que te contemos un poco más sobre nosotros y lo que hacemos.

Kathmandu Jazz Conservatory es la escuela de música moderna más reconocida de Nepal. Abrimos nuestras puertas hace 10 años y desde entonces no hemos parado de trabajar formando un gran equipo y fomentando la cultura musical en este país.

En KJC intentamo dar una mejor vida a las personas a través de la música. En cada una de nuestras clases disfrutamos con nuestros estudiantes y les ofrecemos una plataforma de expresión. Para ello juntamos la tradición musical de Nepal con la occidental para preservar la herencia cultural del país y enriquecerla aportando una formación de calidad.

Uno de nuestros principales objetivos es el mejorar la sociedad a través de la música. Para ello colaboramos con ONGs, casas de acogida y distintas escuelas, de manera que todo el mundo pueda tener acceso a la educación, sea cual sea su nivel económico.

En este vídeo podrás ver algunos de los proyectos sociales en los que trabajamos desde 2007: desde clases gratuitas a estudiantes pasando por música en orfanatos hasta actividades en escuelas de todo el país afectadas por el terremoto en 2015.

Además de todo esto, organizamos eventos musicales que fomentan la apreciación y el aprendizaje a través del arte en todas las edades: conciertos, festivales y campamentos para que tanto niños como adultos disfruten de la música como lo hacemos nosotros.

Necesitamos de tu colaboración para seguir ofreciendo más clases y adquirir instrumentos y libros, así como ofrecer trabajo a músicos y educadores locales, además de organizar eventos gratuitos y dar acceso a cultura y educación a todos los niveles en Nepal, exactamente al igual que en tu país.

Nuestra labor no es fácil, pero llevamos años trabajando duro y recibiendo ayuda de gente maravillosa de todo el planeta que, al igual que tú, cree en el poder de la música para sanar y mejorar la vida de las personas.

Te invitamos a colaborar y a formar parte de la familia del KJC. Dhanyabhad!

Did you know?

A quarter of five-year-olds have experienced tooth decay, having on average three or four teeth affected.

Twelve per cent of three-year-olds have decay, with on average three teeth affected.

In Blackburn and Darwen, 56% of children aged five have tooth decay compared to just 4% in south Gloucester.

The areas with poorer dental health tend to be in the north and in the more deprived local authority areas.

The vast majority of tooth decay was untreated.

Tooth extraction is the sixth most common procedure in hospital for children under five years of age, and it was the most common reason for hospital admission for children aged five to nine years old.

The cost being £50.5 million for hospital extractions for under 19-year-olds.

For under five-year-olds there were 9,306 admissions for tooth extractions, at a cost of approximately £7.8 million.

About me

My name is Katie Dullaghan. Having 12 years in experience in this area I have seen first hand the great need to dental health prevention we have in the UK. I set up Happy Teeth to start a positive change in providing education to both children and parents and move forward to improve oral health as a whole.

Prevention in the past has just not been a priority and this needs to change. With recent changes to funding provided to schools I want to be able to give this vital information for free so that children are not penalised due to tight government spending.

How you can help

Contributions to this campaign with enable us at Happy Teeth to
column2:
Provide fun resources to engage children in workshops

Develop embedded learning to provide holistic sessions with other core subjects ie History, Geography, English, Mathematics (eg the history of sugar cane production, creating information leaflets around dental health, calculating the amount of sugar and the amount of sugar attacks each day)

Provide giveaway bags with gifts and informative information sheets for both the child and the parent at home as well as to give away cleaning aids so that lower economic areas have the right resources to enable adequate cleaning.

I want to provide this campaign far and wide and if we are able to meet our goal of £500,000 this will enable us to fund all resources required and recruit to start free education in schools in the North- the areas most in need of this vital education and work our way down the country so that every area can be helped. If full funds are not reached we will still use all funds raised into developing and starting free education in communities it is most required

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

I would make an impact on a national scale if we could get the word out about this so that we can together contribute to a positive change in children's oral health. In turn reducing disease, pain and suffering, as well as reducing the cost to health services. Please share my campaign far and wide to help promote my message.

Over fifteen years of action research has led to the development of an early childhood learning model in Bangladesh. It is aimed at preparing children from disadvantaged families in the country to enroll in local primary schools at the end of a year's stay at a preschool center. The model is based on a no-cost/low-cost approach to run a center by the local community based on voluntary support. Around 30 children from the local community attend the centers for 3 to 4 hours a day for learning through fun and game. No books, paper or pencil are used. Pocket boards, pocket cards and blackboards are used instead to impart learning. Children learn to read and write in Bengali and English as well as to count and do ordinary math. The centers are called Kajoli Centers, based on the origin of the model in a village named Kajoli in Magura District of Bangladesh.

Research Initiatives, Bangladesh (RIB), a Bangladeshi NGO, which helped to promote the research, has spread the Kajoli model throughout the country. It helped communities with ideas on how to go about finding a place for the children of the centers to meet every weekday at someone’s unused space, find children aged between 4 to 5, identify teachers from within the community, train the teachers to learn to use the model, provide the learning materials mentioned above and identify local animators/champions to mobilize and sustain community support.

Parents of Kajoli children contribute to teacher’s monthly remuneration, based on their ability. Mothers provide midday meals to the children, each taking turn to feed the children at least once a month . In short, the whole approach is based on community participation. All over Bangladesh there are over 150 Kajoli centers established over the last fifteen years. While most of them are doing well with varying community support, there is a felt need for support in some of the centres to make them more attractive to children. Hence this effort to raise fund to help the centres with infrastructure building, including building/repairing class rooms, toilets and tubes-wells, providing playground equipment etc.

Who we are

The Vancouver Learnary Society (VLS) is dedicated to building community, supporting intergenerational learning and generating curiosity. We offer a community space with on-going opportunities to drop in and make stuff, socialize with your neighbours, and become part of a creative, intergenerational village in the city!

We run workshops and discussion groups for folks who love to learn and teach, led by people who are passionate about their subject. We've offered workshops on forging, painting, the habits of bats, and more. And as new people walk in the door with new skills, new workshops will develop.

We also run a non-profit shop in East Vancouver selling resources for learners of all ages, including interactive, intergenerational books, games, D.I.Y. kits and maker supplies.

We are a membership based organization. This means that you, as a community member, help shape what we are and what we become.  You can volunteer, help us create workshops, participate in discussion groups, and lots more.

How you can help (even more)

We know we are needed now more than ever. Vancouver craves a place that connects us to each other and encourages our creativity and curiosity.

You can help us stay curious and get curiouser! We're seeking to raise $10,000. This money will cover the costs of the building and development permit applications needed to offer workshops  and help us build this new community learning space. Let's make The Learnary a true force for good in our city.

And if 10K feels ambitious, rest assured that any and all funds raised will be put into our work as a society. We don’t need to make our goal to make your donations count.

 

Perks

Our perks range from gratitude to gift certificates to products from our store that will impress your friends. Some of our generous community have also offered perks and those will be posted throughout the campaign...so be sure to check back often! Please note that all our perks include a donation to the society. Get ahead on your Christmas list, shop local, and support The Learnary, all with a click of a button!

If you chose a ""Gift Basket"" as your perk, these will be ready in time for Christmas (by approximately December 21st). We will be in touch as soon as they are ready.

Once you’ve donated, we have one more ask. Can you help us build our crowd? The more folks who know about us and this campaign, the more successful it will be. Please help us sharing this campaign on your Facebook and on Instagram, as well as by emailing the link to your friends.

 

Our story so far

For years, Surya and her mother-in-law (educator extraordinaire) Helen Hughes had shared sparks of ideas they’d both had about how to create fun and accessible learning for adults and families. In September 2017, they found themselves out of excuses, and realized it was time to make a start. How hard could it be, anyway?

By October 2017, they were offering workshops out of borrowed spaces, inviting people to come and try out a class or two. They hosted a teensy-tiny book making class (the books, not the class), an acrylic pouring class that was stunning to watch, an improvisation class with Alison Kelly of Mom's the Word, a forging class (with vegan marshmallows for snacks), and learned how to play a new game made by some local guys.

Folks were excited by the idea that they could learn as a family. Adults loved the idea that they could learn while children played close by. Young people loved being included. Everyone liked gathering and learning new things with people of all ages. The Learnary was becoming a thing.

But without a space to call our own, it was hard to build momentum. In April, we started talking with Sam Mills about applying for a grant that would let us create some events in local parks. On her way to one of those meetings with Sam and Helen, Surya got a message from her friend Alix, of Green Room Yoga…”there’s a space available in our building...any chance you want to rent it?

Surya waited until the soup was poured before she popped the question: “So, you wanna jump in with both feet, without knowing how deep it is or which way the tide is going?”. Okay, maybe she didn’t frame it just like that. But anyway, Sam said yes.

Four days later, on May 2nd, 2018, we met the landlord, paid some rent, and took ownership of a set of keys. The Learnary was starting to look like a reality. 

Next we gathered a willing crew for our Board, started our society, and did lots and lots of paperwork. And leg work too! After almost four months of washing walls, moving out old cupboards, mending walls, moving out garbage, painting walls, moving in new furniture - all with the incredible help of many, many volunteers, and many, many donations, we were ready to open our doors. By September, The Learnary Shop was officially open for business!

Of course, nothing's that simple. There are lots of hoops involved with trying something new in a city like Vancouver. And hoops cost time and money. But every time someone new comes in to The Learnary and their face lights up when they see what we're doing, we know we're just gonna hula our way through. W
column3:
'>e're so excited to make this happen...especially with your help!

","Who we areThe Vancouver Learnary Society (VLS) is dedicated to building community, supporting intergenerational learning and generating curiosity. We offer a community space with on-going opportunities to drop in and make stuff, socialize with your neighbours, and become part of a creative, intergenerational village in the city!We run workshops and discussion groups for folks who love to learn and teach, led by people who are passionate about their subject. We've offered workshops on forging, painting, the habits of bats, and more. And as new people walk in the door with new skills, new workshops will develop.We also run a non-profit shop in East Vancouver selling resources for learners of all ages, including interactive, intergenerational books, games, D.I.Y. kits and maker supplies.We are a membership based organization. This means that you, as a community member, help shape what we are and what we become.  You can volunteer, help us create workshops, participate in discussion groups, and lots more.How you can help (even more)We know we are needed now more than ever. Vancouver craves a place that connects us to each other and encourages our creativity and curiosity.You can help us stay curious and get curiouser! We're seeking to raise $10,000. This money will cover the costs of the building and development permit applications needed to offer workshops  and help us build this new community learning space. Let's make The Learnary a true force for good in our city.And if 10K feels ambitious, rest assured that any and all funds raised will be put into our work as a society. We don’t need to make our goal to make your donations count. PerksOur perks range from gratitude to gift certificates to products from our store that will impress your friends. Some of our generous community have also offered perks and those will be posted throughout the campaign...so be sure to check back often! Please note that all our perks include a donation to the society. “I took this picture with the photography teacher. It is my favorite. Thank you, teacher, for helping me to take photos.” – Rawan, 13, from Syria

_____ T H E   P H O T O  B O O K  _____

This Is My World: A Photo Book by Refugee Youth will serve as a powerful resource for people of all ages to draw connections between photographs and engage in a meaningful story, linking and sharing perspectives. It will be an arrangement of thirty photographs captured by the young participants in Istanbul and Berlin.

Layout: Each photo will have a duplicate and be paired with two different images to create a visual game. The images express the genuine perspectives of the participants in their new surroundings. The book will also include a selection of written stories documented in their photo journals and in interviews, several bios, photos of the project in action, and of course, the names and ages of the participants.

Inspiration: This book is inspired by Jason Fulford and Tamara Shopsin’s playful photo book, This Equals That. It has been a useful resource throughout Frame Your Story’s development and has inspired participants to use their imaginations to think creatively and make observations.

The creation of this photo book will serve as a powerful tool to
• share the refugee youth’s photographs in Istanbul and Berlin
• create relationships between people and places, linking imagery and stories
<li>guide viewers to develop critical thinking skills &amp
• be used as a teaching tool in future workshops led by Frame Your Story and others

_____ T H E  C A M P A I G N _____

This Is My World: A Photo Book by Refugee Youth will come to life with the funds from this campaign and every bit counts. With this campaign, seventy-five photo books with meaningful visual stories will be created and shared with communities around the world and distributed on online platforms like Create Space and Amazon in the USA and internationally. A number of participants will also receive a copy of the book.

But first, by May 2019 the mock book will be designed (pages, cover, and text), printed twice using the platform BLURB, and shared with a select people for editing and critique before the final print in July-August 2019.

_____ F U N D I N G  B R E A K D O W N _____

Below is a chart of the funds needed to make this vision possible. With these funds achieved, the photo book can pursue the 2019 goals.

_____ Y O U R  S U P P O R T  _____

If this is a vision that you feel called to support there are several ways that you can make a difference and every bit counts. Whether you share this campaign with friends on social media platforms, via email, or by word of mouth, and/or make a contribution to help meet the funding goal –you are part of the process to share the perspectives of refugee youth and your support matters.

The Perks?

Contributions of any amount will have their full name in the Acknowledgement Pages of the book.

Contributions of $150 or more will receive a copy of This Is My World: A Photo Book by Refugee Youth and will find their full name in the Acknowledgement Pages of the book.

Contributions of $500 or more will receive all of the above with a signed copy of This Is My World: A Photo Book by Refugee Youth and a print of a photograph (of your choosing) that is featured in the book.

Other ways to support this photo book vision:
• Use the Indiegogo share tools to share this campaign page and tag @frameyourstoryproject
• Copy the link and share it on the Web: http://igg.me/at/thisismyword/x/11481341
• Talk about Frame Your Story’s photo book project with friends, family, and colleagues

_____ T H E   P R O J E C T  _____

Frame Your Story came into existence in 2015 when Beatrice, organization creator and founder, launched a photography program to empower refugee youth to heal and grow through visual storytelling and journaling. Beatrice began the project with ten digital Canon point-and-shoot cameras that she offered youth, blank journals, and lots of support from family and friends.
<li>Projects 1 &amp
column2: 2 were launched in Istanbul, Turkey in 2015-16 with the support of 100cameras and the Association for Solidarity with Asylum-Seekers and Migrants. The forty participants, 4-15 years old, came from Syria.

column1: <li>Beatrice then took Frame Your Story to Berlin, Germany in 2017-18 and pursued projects 3 &amp
column2: 4 in refugee shelters with the support of the Berliner Stadtmission. The participants, 8-15 years old, as well as young adults, ages 17-25, came from Afghanistan, Iran, Iraq, Armenia, Syria, Egypt, Eritrea, and Ghana.

column1: <li>

The project successes: facilitating a safe space, regular project workshops, hands-on activities like photography and journaling, city explorations with the cameras, and youth photography exhibitions (at the completion of each project) that celebrate the meaningful perspectives and stories of these young people.

The successful projects have connected people from many parts of the world: Afghanistan, Iran, Iraq, Armenia, Syria, Egypt, Eritrea, and Ghana using photography as a creative tool for growth, and now it's time to share their stories!

________________________________________________________________________________________

Follow the project on Facebook @frameyourstoryproject, Instagram at #frameyourstoryproject, and online at www.frameyourstory.org.

Thank you, kindly, for your support and I hope you'll find This Is My World: A Photo Book by Refugee Youth in your hands later this year!  :-)

Consent has been given to use participants' photos and work.

This project is sponsored fiscally by Arts on Call, a federally registered not-for-profit, 501 (c) 3 organization based in Keene Valley, New York.

Kids connect to teachers App

I am designing an app where kids can connect with teachers willing to give a service/lesson for free. There are millions of  parents that cannot afford to to pay for extra curricular activity  for their kids. This app will connect underprivileged kids with teachers that donate their expertise and teach kids  how to play an instrument, coding, web design, graphic design, languages, and even get tutoring. 

Every year, over 1.2 million students drop out of high school in the United States alone. That’s a student every 26 seconds – or 7,000 a day. About 25% of high school freshmen fail to graduate from high school on time. The U.S., which had some of the highest graduation rates of any developed country, now ranks 22nd out of 27 developed countries.

 The dropout rate has fallen 3% from 1990 to 2010 (12.1% to 7.4%). The percentage of graduating Latino students has significantly increased. In 2010, 71.4% received their diploma vs. 61.4% in 2006. However, Asian-American and white students are still far more likely to graduate than Latino &
column2:
African-American students.

However, Asian-American and white students are still far more likely to graduate than Latino & African-American students.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

About the Directors

Arianna Pelullo, also known as LadyBEAST,was an artist in residence at Sanctuary. Arianna, herself, is a circus artist and a producer in New Orleans, Louisiana. Coming from a performance arts background and holding a BFA, Arianna was lead to the circus arts five years ago where she developed a repertoire of work blending all three styles together into unique performance experiences for a variety of audiences.  She has highlighted her performance skills in her own shows including: Cirque Du Gras, Vaude D’ Gras, Cirque Copine, LadyBEAST Cabaret and The YardBaret. She now plans to make her home at Sanctuary which will give her the opportunity and space to produce three new projects as an Artist in Residence. Arianna considers herself a leader and an advocate for Circus Arts New Movement of New Orleans and hopes to encourage more artists from all over the country to participate in Sanctuary through collaborative projects involving workshops, classes, and productions.

Cameron Eaton is the Founder/ Director of Sanctuary Cultural Arts Center and has opened and been a fundamental member of centers across the country including: SPACE, in Oakland,  The A.R.K. In New Orleans, The New Orleans of Circus Arts and more.  She has worked as an educator and consultant for countless non-profit organizations across the US and has spent the last 23 years learning all she can about community organization, non-profits, marketing and cultivating creative communities. Cameron also comes from a performance background and is a multi-media performance artist, writer, educator, and creative collaborator with over 25 years of professional experience within the arts and entertainment industries.

Cameron and Arianna’s intention is to fuse their performance backgrounds into unique, interactive, performance art experiences for a multitude of audiences. They are currently working hard to establish classes, community events, workshops and fundraising events for the NEW Circus Arts Movement of New Orleans. Their vision is inclusion, collaboration and cultivating new work at a higher caliber at Sanctuary!
What is Sanctuary?
Sanctuary is a place to cross pollinate the performing arts with classes in a variety of disciplines. From health and wellness to performing and visual arts
column2: classes include yoga, pilates, theater, dance, art, craft, burlesque, and of course circus arts! Our mission is to provide educational opportunities in a variety of disciplines, to incubate collaborative, multi-media ideas and to curate / produce new work. We are inviting performers, artists and educators from all over the world to come to our center to teach, exhibit and produce a wide range of performances in our space. We have already had guest artists come perform, exhibit and teach from Barcelona, Indonesia, Canada, San Francisco and Portland Oregon.

column1: The Campaign

This Campaign is to fund the additional equipment needed , to help fund our artist in residence program and will help us cover operating and production costs for the first year at Sanctuary. We need equipment for circus classes, productions, aerial rigging, crash mats, and numerous other things needed to cultivate the art of circus. We as Artists feel the need to share our work and spread the art form to the community, in order to do so we would like to teach community classes and have a safe space to train and rehearse, perform in. Our intent is to empower people to become more connected with their bodies as tools for creating engaging works of art for fun and enjoyment! By donating to this campaign, you will become an integral part of supporting artists in our community and will help us not only share circus throughout New Orleans, but will also allow us to hone our craft as we continue to develop new work in hopes of touring our work nationally and internationally.  It is our goal to keep our beautiful artistic city vibrant in the Circus Arts as it once was years ago. The New Circus movement of New Orleans has been on the rise in the past few years and the next step is occupying and creating a home space so we may continue to grow and develop. Sanctuary will offer open training time, circus community events, classes, workshops, kids' programs, an artists in residence program, production support and a wide range of performances to the community.
Where your money will go:

Aerial Rigging: This is no small feat, we want to make sure it is safe for everyone who chooses to participate in an aerial performances or class. We are working with very qualified rigging team who are donating their time and skills to get the space rigged for Aerial. Even with their affordable rates for helping the space, it is going to cost at least $17,000 for rigging safely and the additional construction fees to finish the space!

Education on Safety and Standards for our Teachers and Staff: It is truly important to have the whole Staff be on the same page regarding use of the space and equipment regardless discipline. Our plan is to develop a standardized set of operating procedures for our fully functioning New Orleans circus space. We will of course also want all of our instructors to have first aid training and certifications as well and be sure that we create a safe space for our artists and the community at large. We also want to send our Director of Circus programming to the National Circus Educators Conference this fall (http://www.americancircuseducators.org) The program for all of our teachers and staff  will cost approximately $2,000.

Equipment: We wish to have classes is a wide range of circus skills: juggling, aerial, Cyr wheel, German wheel, object manipulation, fire props, stilt walking, walking globe, hand balancing, acrobatics, tit wire, pole and hooping. All these classes need support equipment to facilitate them. Unfortunately proper circus equipment is not cheap, but we are doing our best to be savvy with the funds in order to accommodate all of these circus art forms as well as equipment wear and tear over the first year. We will, of course, need crash mats as well to make sure that we are safely learning our new skills. $11,000
First Year Operating Costs: Our location is everything
column2: our space is everything. The high ceilings, rigging capabilities and large room allows us to have two classes at once in a neighborhood where many people can bike over and participate. All of these amazing benefits come with a cost. Just heating and cooling the building alone is pricey. Funding for staff salaries, day to day operational costs and marketing promotions over our first year would allow us to focus on cultivating future student populations and audiences for our productions originating at Sanctuary.  $36,000

column1: The Impact

Circus at Sanctuary is a valuable asset to New Orleans and nationally. It provides a space where students, performers, artists and collaborators of all kinds can participate and grow in their art forms! This type of creative hub doesn't exist in New Orleans and by its existence: the magic of Circus, Multimedia Theater, and performance art can add to the beautiful culture of our wonderful city, New Orleans!
<h3><u>Risks &amp

We are taking a great leap of faith based on years of the growing New Circus movement of New Orleans in order to have an inclusive space and home for the Performing Arts. Our bills are already stacking up and we need to have revenue to start. There are currently circus classes and workshops available in the space that can be facilitated with the minimal personal equipment on loan by teachers and through donation, but this is not sustainable. Personal equipment is neccessary for teachers' and artists' own work. This campaign, should it be successful, will provide the tools needed to facilitate all activities Sanctuary dreams to have.
Other Ways You Can Help

There are plenty of other ways you can help our campaign! Sharing the campaign with friends and people who are interested in investing in the Arts. Like our page on Facebook and ask people to like our page on Facebook to generate more exposure to the campaign. Connect Sanctuary with your media friends who might be able to help gain more community support nationally. Sign up for the classes currently offered at Sanctuary
column2: there are class packages available as well.  Thank you for all your help in advance! It takes a circus of people to put on a circus.

Cameron also comes from a performance background and is a multi-media performance artist, writer, educator, and creative collaborator with over 25 years of professional experience within the arts and entertainment industries.

Cameron and Arianna’s intention is to fuse their performance backgrounds into unique, interactive, performance art experiences for a multitude of audiences. They are currently working hard to establish classes, community events, workshops and fundraising events for the NEW Circus Arts Movement of New Orleans. Their vision is inclusion, collaboration and cultivating new work at a higher caliber at Sanctuary!
What is Sanctuary?
Sanctuary is a place to cross pollinate the performing arts with classes in a variety of disciplines. From health and wellness to performing and visual arts
column2: classes include yoga, pilates, theater, dance, art, craft, burlesque, and of course circus arts! Our mission is to provide educational opportunities in a variety of disciplines, to incubate collaborative, multi-media ideas and to curate / produce new work. We are inviting performers, artists and educators from all over the world to come to our center to teach, exhibit and produce a wide range of performances in our space. We have already had guest artists come perform, exhibit and teach from Barcelona, Indonesia, Canada, San Francisco and Portland Oregon.

column1: The Campaign

This Campaign is to fund the additional equipment needed , to help fund our artist in residence program and will help us cover operating and production costs for the first year at Sanctuary. We need equipment for circus classes, productions, aerial rigging, crash mats, and numerous other things needed to cultivate the art of circus. We as Artists feel the need to share our work and spread the art form to the community, in order to do so we would like to teach community classes and have a safe space to train and rehearse, perform in. Our intent is to empower people to become more connected with their bodies as tools for creating engaging works of art for fun and enjoyment! By donating to this campaign, you will become an integral part of supporting artists in our community and will help us not only share circus throughout New Orleans, but will also allow us to hone our craft as we continue to develop new work in hopes of touring our work nationally and internationally.  It is our goal to keep our beautiful artistic city vibrant in the Circus Arts as it once was years ago. The New Circus movement of New Orleans has been on the rise in the past few years and the next step is occupying and creating a home space so we may continue to grow and develop. Sanctuary will offer open training time, circus community events, classes, workshops, kids' programs, an artists in residence program, production support and a wide range of performances to the community.
Where your money will go:

Aerial Rigging: This is no small feat, we want to make sure it is safe for everyone who chooses to participate in an aerial performances or class. We are working with very qualified rigging team who are donating their time and skills to get the space rigged for Aerial. Even with their affordable rates for helping the space, it is going to cost at least $17,000 for rigging safely and the additional construction fees to finish the space!

Education on Safety and Standards for our Teachers and Staff: It is truly important to have the whole Staff be on the same page regarding use of the space and equipment regardless discipline. Our plan is to develop a standardized set of operating procedures for our fully functioning New Orleans circus space. We will of course also want all of our instructors to have first aid training and certifications as well and be sure that we create a safe space for our artists and the community at large. We also want to send our Director of Circus programming to the National Circus Educators Conference this fall (http://www.americancircuseducators.org) The program for all of our teachers and staff  will cost approximately $2,000.

Equipment: We wish to have classes is a wide range of circus skills: juggling, aerial, Cyr wheel, German wheel, object manipulation, fire props, stilt walking, walking globe, hand balancing, acrobatics, tit wire, pole and hooping. All these classes need support equipment to facilitate them. Unfortunately proper circus equipment is not cheap, but we are doing our best to be savvy with the funds in order to accommodate all of these circus art forms as well as equipment wear and tear over the first year. We will, of course, need crash mats as well to make sure that we are safely learning our new skills. $11,000
First Year Operating Costs: Our location is everything
column2: our space is everything. The high ceilings, rigging capabilities and large room allows us to have two classes at once in a neighborhood where many people can bike over and participate. All of these amazing benefits come with a cost. Just heating and cooling the building alone is pricey. Funding for staff salaries, day to day operational costs and marketing promotions over our first year would allow us to focus on cultivating future student populations and audiences for our productions originating at Sanctuary.  $36,000

column1: The Impact

Circus at Sanctuary is a valuable asset to New Orleans and nationally. It provides a space where students, performers, artists and collaborators of all kinds can participate and grow in their art forms! This type of creative hub doesn't exist in New Orleans and by its existence: the magic of Circus, Multimedia Theater, and performance art can add to the beautiful culture of our wonderful city, New Orleans!
Risks & Challenges

We are taking a great leap of faith based on years of the growing New Circus movement of New Orleans in order to have an inclusive space and home for the Performing Arts. Our bills are already stacking up and we need to have revenue to start. There are currently circus classes and workshops available in the space that can be facilitated with the minimal personal equipment on loan by teachers and through donation, but this is not sustainable. Personal equipment is neccessary for teachers' and artists' own work. This campaign, should it be successful, will provide the tools needed to facilitate all activities Sanctuary dreams to have.
Other Ways You Can Help

There are plenty of other ways you can help our campaign! Sharing the campaign with friends and people who are interested in investing in the Arts. Like our page on Facebook and ask people to like our page on Facebook to generate more exposure to the campaign. Connect Sanctuary with your media friends who might be able to help gain more community support nationally. Sign up for the classes currently offered at Sanctuary
column2: there are class packages available as well.  Thank you for all your help in advance! It takes a circus of people to put on a circus.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column1: |","New Orleans, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/circus-at-sanctuary/pica
0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>
Short Summary
<ul>

• My name is Marco Antonio Gonzales and I come from a small town in deep south Texas. As a kid my mind drifted in the fields always looking up at the clouds and having a deep yearning to be something else. In my  early to mid-20 a series events set me on a path that would change me forever and as I struggled in this time period I fell back on the constructs of my Youth, but my connection to these personas was stronger than I had imagined. As I would find out more than a decade later.

• My campaign is about helping individuals who are on a self destructive path, understand and accept the inner self, the one that we hide. It is important to me on a humanitarian level to see people get the most out of their lives and not feel cornered by societal pressures to be something they don't want to be. Sadly some people don't figure this out until they are too old to do anything about it and they struggle as they realize most of their life was wasted trying to live up to the unspoken expectations of those in our everyday lives. This documentary will be entered into the 2017 SXSW Film Festival as full length feature film.

• Truly the world is changing. So much light has been shed on many other topics and yet there are many individuals still out there who still feel marginalized and without a voice. I can't reach them all, but I can reach those like myself who are goodhearted people and generally want to do good things and help people. The problem with individuals like myself is that we held onto an idea of what was expected out of us whether it be the virtues we wanted to see in ourselves or striving for Altruism, because we did not feel there was any other real purpose for our lives. As the years go by, we find that real life is nothing like this, and this is when our schema of the world around us begins to unravel as mine did over a year ago. Suicide prevention through education, and helping people avoid destructive behavior patterns, I would have to say is what I am trying to accomplish here. I want to encourage healthy ways of dealing with dissociation, for me it is not so important that it looks normal but that it helps with suffering and is a positive form of therapy for an individual to see where all these ailments of the mind are coming from. For instance I took up modern abstract dancing again after a decade and designed masks to symbolize my childhood constructs as a form of exposure therapy to address my false beliefs about myself. This has been therapeutic and helpful and as the weeks go by I feel more and more distance growing between me and these personas. My example is only one of many in this documentary.
<h3>What We Need &amp
<ul>

• I am requiring $5500 dollars to complete this documentary, roughly 3500 of this will be for a better camera  and accessories that records at a higher quality meaning a better quality film (4K). $2000 of this is for traveling expenses for interviews, production of the film after complete, film  and a few other things such as video clips from adobe archives, film permits (only some have fees) and printing legal forms (consent forms, data collection), producing of DVD and Memorabilia (Perks).

• For those who contribute $5 will get a digital copy of the film for download and if you contribute more than $15 they will get both a digital copy of this movie and the physical DVD which will have bonus footage and the backstory and a more in depth look at the research revolving around these topics today. For those who donate more than $25 they will get the both copies of the movie and a Movie Poster!
• If I don't reach my goal I will used the funds that I do receive to put towards the camera.
• I have pretty much used every paycheck that comes my way to put into this, but it is not enough to have this ready in the time span that needs to be met.
The Impact
<ul>

• I think the best way I can describe the impact of all of this, is to point out that sometimes because of our ambiguity and even hindered personalities, individuals like myself constantly go misunderstood throughout the decades. Furthermore sometimes our personality types are closely related to that of a narcissistic nature and therefore require larger amounts of compassion to have empathy for. Again I point out that so much positive impact has come to other groups who have been oppressed and mistreated, but when it comes to the mentally ill or people with cognitive disorders or even personality disorders, these are still issues that people distance themselves from, because of hard set stigma. It is a hard dilemma to deal with as a society mostly due to the fact that as a society there is still so much we do not understand about the human mind and variations in personality. My hope is that this documentary can help with that.

• Mental illness has always been something I have been around since my youth. Coming from a border town where there is great social stratification our MHMR facilities are overwhelmed and under budgeted. When I moved to Austin I immediately noticed the correlation between the homeless and mental illness. This is why I have launched the Dancer in the Dark Project which is still falling into place, Dancer in the Dark is an even larger project in which the ""Be My Eyes"" Documentary has branched off from.
<h3>Risks &amp

• I will be honest with you this has been extremely hard for me to put forth. It was started when I was in between jobs and doing very labor intensive work out in the Texas heat. The nature of what I am doing has brought into questioned my sexuality, my masculinity and sanity. This has been an uncomfortable experience to say the least. However I do my best to remain confident and enthused about what I am doing because the truth is I am having a really great time doing it. It does hurt to see that some people in this world that I care for and respect very much, don't look at me the same and give off a sense that they are embarrassed of me, but again I will not stop until its enough and its no where near enough. My hopes are that one day something like this documentary could come out and relate this topic to more people in a way that would remove stereotypes and stigmas and bring people closer together.
Other Ways You Can Help
<ul>

• If you are unable to contribute money there are other ways you can help, I am still looking for people who have had identity issues or maybe not, basically anyone who just wants to speak their mind on camera and perhaps it could be a story on the documentary that helps someone out there struggling with the same situation.
• Please share this Documentary Film Campaign with others on social media, thank you everyone, be safe, be happy, be yourselves!

My hope is that this documentary can help with that.

Mental illness has always been something I have been around since my youth. Coming from a border town where there is great social stratification our MHMR facilities are overwhelmed and under budgeted. When I moved to Austin I immediately noticed the correlation between the homeless and mental illness. This is why I have launched the Dancer in the Dark Project which is still falling into place, Dancer in the Dark is an even larger project in which the ""Be My Eyes"" Documentary has branched off from.
Risks & Challenges

I will be honest with you this has been extremely hard for me to put forth. It was started when I was in between jobs and doing very labor intensive work out in the Texas heat. The nature of what I am doing has brought into questioned my sexuality, my masculinity and sanity. This has been an uncomfortable experience to say the least. However I do my best to remain confident and enthused about what I am doing because the truth is I am having a really great time doing it. It does hurt to see that some people in this world that I care for and respect very much, don't look at me the same and give off a sense that they are embarrassed of me, but again I will not stop until its enough and its no where near enough. The chances and opportunities we give to the children of the neighborhood day by day are rewarding for the entire community. Not only are the children provided education, more significantly, they are  given a space where they are allowed to be children in a world where this isnt always the reality. Aside from running programs for the kids, Caras Alegres has also been a key figure in empowering the entire neighborhood, including the training of mothers through the program CALI - Camino a la Independencia. Today we are in fear of Caras Alegres's existence, since our main founder left. Let us help them together to keep these faces smiling.

Caras Alegres is a non-profit organization established in 2004 by Dutch founders passionate about helping in some of the poorest communities in Xela. Sara was once a kid who could not see the opportunites for her life ahead of her. Thanks to Caras Alegres, she got far in life. Take a look at the video to see what she is doing now. 

Please let this positive movement never stop. To keep continuing the project needs help and with every little donation WE are able to keep this going.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><h2 style=""text-align: center
column2:
>Meet Pello

More than 3 billion photos are produced in the world every day, taking photo is the best choice for us to record our experience in the daily life.

When we recall some memories from the photos, we usually forget a group of people-- our children. What does the world look like in the eyes of our child?

Certain children like to take photo by parents' smartphone, but the smart phone has too many functions and its operation is too complicated for children to handle. Interactive camera Pello is the first camera that designed specifically for children, it can make children record their childhood by themselves easily.

We know that each children maybe like different colors. Therefore, we produce various apperances with different colors which children can easy to change.
column4:
>What Can Pello Do?

 

Recoding tool in childhood

We believe that even very little children have their own world, pello is the best tool for children to record their own world.

Children have a strong curiosity and interest in heart, and they can always be attracted by interesting things. Pello camera can help them to record something interesting or wonderful moments.

 

Making childhood more interesting

The camera itself brings with special photo effects, including many beautiful picture frames. Using Pello camera to take photos, children can easily take a picture with various cartoon characters and can add some special custom like wearing a sorting hat or the glasses of Harry Potter. These founctions can make children more happy than before when they are taking a photo.

 

Developing Artistic Talent

Photography is an art, paying attention to the integration of light and color, which develops the children's camera skills, And then lay the artistic foundation for them.. You may find your child was an excellent little photographer.

 

Communication Bridge Between Parents and Their Children

Pello can bind parents’ smart phone APP, all the photos taken by children can be uploaded to the parents' APP.  Through the photo taken by their kids, parents can understand what their children see and get interested in . it is primary goal for parents to understand what their kids interested in.

 

Children's social networking platform

Pello set up a social platform for the children. children can share photos with each other and interact with their friends.
column7:
>Designed Specifically for Children

 

Light and Small

Children can easily manipulated with one hand. It's only 102g weight, very suitable for children to carry.

Replaceable Cover

The front decorative panel can be changed freely to meet the different needs of children.

Anti Fall Protective Sleeve

The probability of getting broken will be reduced by about 50%, through the use of specially designed silicon sleeve.

Each feature is designed for kids, and every design pursues excellence.
column9:
>Why We Need You

We believe that even very little children have their own world
column10: We believe that children can record their childhood by themselves
column11:
We hope that every child has an artistic seed in their heart.

We hope that parents can better understand their children's inner world

So we need you, Your support can make our products better, and make it has more interesting features.  Your support will help us mass produce pello, selling this interesting product to the world, so that our children have more interesting memories of their childhood. You can also support us by sharing the campaign on social media. Thank you very much for your support.

For all inquiries, please contact us through email : pellokid@gmail.com.

We will report the latest developments of the pello project to you every week.
column14: >Time Line
column17: >We are a young team. Our R&amp
column18: D and design team has vast and varied experience in innovative technology development. Everyone in the team have their own dreams: Designers hope to become a master designer of the design of children's products
column19: Hardware designers is expect to develop more intelligent products
column20: Software designers is expect to produce a well-known software. Although the technology we hold is not perfect, we have the greatest wealth-youth and the advantage-courage. I believe that we will realize our dream, on a basis of a talented team, and we also expect young people with dreams to join us. Thank you!
column23:
>Risk

 

Pello interactive camera technology is entirely researched by our team, which include the development of technology and the information of product, and we have stable production manufacturers and assembly manufacturers. We will pledge the quality and quantity of the PELLO camera. Although there are some unpredictable the problem may occur, we will solve these problems as soon as possible perfect, please rest assured and we will report the latest developments of the pello project to you every week.
column25:
A

 

Q: Why do I buy PELLO  instead of other camera for my children?

A: Pello interactive camera is a camera designed specifically for children. It not only lets the children have their own circle of friends, but also provides a bridge of communication between the children and their parents, in addition, the Pello camera has top hardware support, Super high pixel, and super powerful operating system, which is unmatched by other toy cameras.

Q: Can I select the color of camera?
A: Of course, after the success of the project, we will provide a different color appearance of the product to meet your preference. So far, the choice of colors includes red, blue, yellow violet and green.

Q: Can the camera support the external storage device?

A: Of course, if you feel that the memory is not enough, you can purchase an external memory card to expand the storage space.

Q: Will the photos be uploaded to my phone ? 
A: Yes, each photo taken by children will be uploaded to the parents of the mobile phone APP in the case of WiFi connection.

Q: When I can receive the Pello？

A: Pello have been put into production, it's expected to be completed in December 2016 and can be sent to everyone in January 2017.
