Who doesn't want a little more good karma floating around the world, right? :)
column33:
>Perks 
Check out the large selection of ""Perks"" we have put together with the school community! From handmade cards made by the students to blessed prayer flags coming at you in the mail, to local monastery tours and traditional Ladakhi cooking courses...  If you plan a trip to Ladakh we will  even help to personally tailor your trip to your needs and desires!
column35: >This is Mutop who is in Kindergarten at SDPS. Martin and Kate sponsor his annual education for the equivalent cost of three nice restaurant meals in Canada.
column36: >What happens if we don't reach our goal?
column37: >If we do not reach our entire fundraising goal this year, we will keep your generous donations safe until next year, and will source other funding in the meantime, so we can start the foundations and main structure at the beginning of next year's building season.

column62:
>Our approach

In 2010 Martin spent two months travelling around Ladakh learning about the culture and traditions and researching local resources, education,  architecture and building methods. In 2011, with members of the SDPS Management Team, Kate and Martin spearheaded a collaborative design process through extensive community-based, mixed methods research to learn what the community (students, parents, teachers, management, directors, alumni, community groups, etc.) envisioned for their new school.
column63: >From there, intensive designing and planning led to the construction of a prototype building in 2012, followed by the student hostel (2013) and first classroom block (2014).
column64: >Introducing the new school campus design
column65: >The new campus design uses passive solar, rammed earth technologies and follows the requirements of the State Department of Education (Jammu and Kashmir, India).
column67: >Passive-solar technologies ensure the warming of buildings during the night and their cooling during the day.

","New SDPS passive solar, rammed earth campus in progress (phases 1-2). Classroom block in foreground with hostel block in background. We are fundraising to build the third building: computer/science labs.

column1: “Our vision is to make Spring Dales Public School one of the finest so our children can receive quality education right at their doorstep, without facing emotional separation from their parents and their village.""
Tsewang Norboo, Principal of SDPS
Where is Spring Dales Public School?

Spring Dales Public School (SDPS) is located in the village of Mulbekh which is located in the Himalayan area of Ladakh (""land of high passes"")- in the state of Jammu and Kashmir in northwestern India. Mulbekh is a treacherous seven hour drive from the state capital of Leh.

What are the challenges to education in Ladakh?In 2010, we (Martin and Kate) were fortunate to establish a close relationship and collaboration with Mr. Tsewang Norboo, the Principal of Spring Dales Public School (SDPS). In his small village of Mulbekh we heard him speak passionately about the unique culture, language and identities of a traditional Tibetan Buddhist society that is struggling to educate their children in this harshly remote Himalayan region.The more Principal Norboo explained his community's deep concern that the exodus of young people being educated elsewhere is threatening the future of their community, the more we felt compelled to lend our skills to the community in any way they needed.Please take a few moments to watch these brief clips that effectively highlight the significant challenges to remote traditional Tibetan Buddhist societies, like Mulbekh, and the effects of children being educated so far away from their families and communities (Zanskar valley is close to the Mulbekh valley):  Mountains: The most dangerous school run in the world (Human Planet, BBC, 2011).
Original trailer for a film called Journey from Zanskar (Warrior Films, 2010)

What is the community's solution?The Mulbekh community has an ambitious and bold solution to lower the exodus of young people from their remote region.Providing equal access to quality, local education means the region's children and youth don't have to leave their parents, siblings, grandparents, families and communities for larger centres elsewhere in India. By slowing this mass exodus, and by providing a school curriculum that emphasizes a blend of traditional and modern education, the sharing of knowledge between generations is able to flourish.  All of this directly supports the revitalization and vitality of the unique Ladakhi culture, traditions, language, Buddhist faith, local economies, and identities.Building a quality school campus (including student accommodation) for the region will attract more students to be educated locally. This will dramatically slow the region's exodus of young people to larger centres, and will also attract quality, permanent teachers, thus lowering the high teacher turnover, while increasing stability for the students.Given the harsh climate - where temperatures can rise to 30+ degrees celsius in the summer and drop to -30 in the winter with no heating system - passive solar and rammed earth technologies were chosen as they use local materials and provide unprecedented year-round comfort. Students will no longer have to take their classes sitting outside on the ground in the winter (inside is too frigid to hold a pencil)! The old classrooms are so cold and dark that classes are often taught outside in the colder months.SDPS Class 10 student being recognized for academic achievement with her classmates looking on. Assemblies are held outside in the colder months as indoors is too cold. What we have accomplished
Secured funding from His Holiness the  14th Dalai Lama and The Dalai Lama Trust
New classroom block (eight classrooms) opened and inaugurated by the 14th Dalai Lama's brother Tenzin Choegyal in 2015
New student accommodation block finished in 2014
Solar plant built in 2011 - (the only building in the region with 24h electricity!)
Internet connection since 2011 (first building in the region with internet!)
Infrastructure Development Plan created between 2010-2013
Long and Short-term School Development and Action Plan formulated in 2011
SDPS Management Team formed between 2011-2012
International Scholarship Program implementation started in 2012
SDPS Constitution revised between 2012-2013
Student and teacher exchange with Literacy India in Delhi in 2012
Prototype building built in 2011

Generous support from the 14th Dalai LamaSince 2011 this project has been officially supported by His Holiness the  14th Dalai Lama and The Dalai Lama Trust. With the school Principal and Secretary, we had the honour to present our project in a private audience to His Holiness at his residence in McLeod Ganj, India. It was a highlight of our lives! Other generous supporters have included Hnuti Brontosaurus (Czech Republic), Himalayan Dialect (France), and Omprakash (USA), and dozens of individual international sponsors.Presentation of the project to His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama in his residence at Mcleod Ganj, India (June 2011). From L-R: Principal Norboo, Secretary Eshey, His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama, Kate Kittredge, Martin Knap (June 2011).South entrance to the student hostel (in progress), highlighting traditional Ladakhi design (2012).South entrance to the classroom block (2014).Typical classroom on the ground floor of the new classroom block (2014). What we needThis summer we would like to start construction - foundations only - of the next building!  Once completed the new Computer and Science Laboratory building will accommodate four classrooms - Computers, Biology, Chemistry, Physics. As with the previous two buildings, this new building is entirely based on the use of passive-solar energy and uses primarily local resources.  Enhanced traditional techniques - such as rammed-earth walls, clay roofing, wooden window decorations in the ancient Ladakhi style - are used.In order for the school to comply with regulations of the State Department of Education of Jammu and Kashmir, to maintain the school's status, and to be able to continue operations in the future we need to build this Science Laboratory and Computer building by Spring 2019.Foundations estimate:Construction material                               $20,000Construction tools and equipment       $3,500Labour                                                             $1,650Local management                                     $1,350Excavation                                                      $500Contingency                                                  $3,000​____________________________________________________________________TOTAL                                                      $30,000** Any funds raised over $30,000 will be carefully utilized on the main structure (phase 2) in 2018, with on-going full reporting to you, our backers. What does your support mean to the community?Providing quality, local education means the region's children and youth don't have to leave their parents, grandparents, families and communities for larger centres elsewhere in India. Slowing this mass exodus of children encourages the sharing of knowledge between the generations, directly supporting the revitalization of the unique Ladakhi culture, traditions, language, Buddhist faith, local economies, and identities. Spring Dales Public School emphasizes all these important pieces in their curriculum and daily activities. Your support will mean that the Computer and Science Laboratory building is the next step in the completion of the region's premier school campus. Improved scientific and technological knowledge and skills means the students won't have to leave their communities for quality education, and will have more options for their personal and professional development in the future.Importantly, a quality and well-equipped computer and science lab building will also help the school to stay in operations after Spring 2019, when the next government inspection is scheduled for permitting.It is difficult to explain how much each action of support means to this community. Their gratitude is immense, expressive and so heartwarming!  What do you get for your generous support?Satisfaction You will get the satisfaction of directly supporting a meaningful project in one of the most unique areas of the world. Good Karma (or whatever you want to call it!)Who doesn't want a little more good karma floating around the world, right? :)Perks Check out the large selection of ""Perks"" we have put together with the school community! From handmade cards made by the students to blessed prayer flags coming at you in the mail, to local monastery tours and traditional Ladakhi cooking courses...  If you plan a trip to Ladakh we will  even help to personally tailor your trip to your needs and desires!This is Mutop who is in Kindergarten at SDPS. Martin and Kate sponsor his annual education for the equivalent cost of three nice restaurant meals in Canada.      What happens if we don't reach our goal?If we do not reach our entire fundraising goal this year, we will keep your generous donations safe until next year, and will source other funding in the meantime, so we can start the foundations and main structure at the beginning of next year's building season. SDPS Kindergarten students taking their classes outside, as inside is too frigid in the colder months (October, 2013).Our commitment to you!We commit to staying in communications with you, our generous supporters, until the full building is completed.                               An auspicious double rainbow over the Mulbekh Valley (2012).Who we areAs established professionals, in the fields of community planning, architecture and engineering, we feel very fortunate to have been volunteering for SDPS since 2010. We invite you to read the ""Team Profiles"" section to learn more about us, Principal Norboo, and the rest of our stellar fundraising campaign team!Kate and Martin in Martin's hometown of Pardubice, Czech Republic (2015).Kate and Martin at Spring Dales Public School, Mulbekh, India (2012).SDPS Management Team (L-R: Construction Manager, Tsering Samphel
column2: Teacher and Scholarship Program Manager, Stanzin Lhamo
column5: and Project Estimator, Tsering Morup). “Let’s join hands for a wonderful cause of educating our children for a peaceful and happy tomorrow because today’s children are tomorrow’s citizens. Let’s help them now, so that they can help others tomorrow.”  Tsewang Norboo, Principal of SDPS JULLEY!(Thank you!) _______________________________________ Project Details Our approachIn 2010 Martin spent two months travelling around Ladakh learning about the culture and traditions and researching local resources, education,  architecture and building methods. In 2011, with members of the SDPS Management Team, Kate and Martin spearheaded a collaborative design process through extensive community-based, mixed methods research to learn what the community (students, parents, teachers, management, directors, alumni, community groups, etc.) envisioned for their new school.  From there, intensive designing and planning led to the construction of a prototype building in 2012, followed by the student hostel (2013) and first classroom block (2014).Introducing the new school campus designThe new campus design uses passive solar, rammed earth technologies and follows the requirements of the State Department of Education (Jammu and Kashmir, India). Passive-solar technologies ensure the warming of buildings during the night and their cooling during the day. The campus in progressNew SDPS passive solar, rammed earth campus (phases 1-2). Classroom block at left with hostel block at right (2014).                              _________________________________________________________Additional information

column5: >I had no idea how to combine my work as a

column1: psychologist and holistic healer with a supportive lifestyle AND all my
passions: traveling, dancing, writing and creating. I could not even picture
how that would look like.
I went on a world journey on my own and studied with enlightened
masters in Asia, went to silent retreats,
read books and talked with inspiring people.
What initially started as a 6 month break became my new life!
Now, I can truly say that I am living my dream life.
A life in which lifestyle, work, spirituality and sustaining my income are no
longer separated. I travel to places that inspire me, start my day with yoga
and dance and create online courses about subjects that I am super passionate
about. This also makes me very flexible to travel and work according to my own
flow and I reach people all over the world.
The road that lead me there was not always easy.
There were many obstacles on the way and people around me did not always
understand my 'off the beaten track' choices. A chronic disease that I had made it impossible to do anything and my clouded head
made my brain slow down in such a way that even organizing something small was
challenging. So although I could earn money, it was not always working out that
way. Nevertheless, I did not want to limit myself by those factors.
So I had to think very much outside of the box. I
learned strategies about having my business online in a way that would give
income, even when I could not work. And I dived fully into ‘creating the life
that you want’ while connecting with a deeper source. A source that is much
more powerful than you can possibly imagine. While connecting with this
powerful force of creation, things started to flow and to fall into place. Magical
things started to happen in my life and step by step my mission became clear.
Now I am helping others to live the most blissful version
of their life, a life that lights up that inner spark.
The more people sustain
their living in a way that is connected to who they really are, the more this will help the world on a global level. And
this is what this crowdfunding campaign is eventually all about.

column1: EXPERIENCES FROM OTHERS:
~ Anna, Sweden
""I have received private sessions from Anjali and participated in her emotional freedom workshops and mystical dance classes.
""Anjali guides me every time to the core of myself. She helps me to listen to my own inner voice, which is very important to me.""
With her programs, she supports my journey into my own core, in a loving field of acceptance. Anjali please keep on doing your great work supporting people to listen to their own inner voice!""
~ Katerina, Russia:
""Anjali is a highly qualified professional and at the same time a passionate and inspiring woman and teacher.""

She’s got lots of varieties of different techniques and methods and knows how to combine them to achieve the best results. Anjali’s style is a very feminine way to create a relaxed atmosphere for deep transformation.”

    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MORE ABOUT ME....
<div>

column2: >I am a holistic working psychologist, healer, health coach, yogini, and mystical dance teacher. For many years I have been working with clients, developing myself extensively, and traveling and studying in various places in the world.
column3:
>
I started my career in psychology, where I quickly realized that the mental approach does not describe the full picture. I worked with people who came from very difficult backgrounds, were unemployed for many years, and had severe financial problems and multiple traumas. It was impossible to help them with the traditional therapies. The problems had anchored too deep in their bodies and they had too many resistances to heal. My drive to go to the core and find out what actually could help these people, and my interest in Eastern ways of living and healing, led me to various innovative healing methods.
column4:
>
I practiced Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT), naturopathy, kinesiology, hypnotherapy, mindfulness, mystical dance and EMDR (a method for effective trauma release). Those methods work on deeper layers and release emotions, physical blockages, and long-held beliefs in a very effective and gentle way. This showed itself in better and faster healing results.
column5: >While I traveled through South-East Asia, I dived deep into Tibetan and Indian Tantric yoga, different forms of meditation and healing dance. Seeing the devotional Asian culture inspired me deeply and made me realize how much Western society has drifted away from simplicity and connection with nature. It became clearer to me that it is mostly the connection between the Eastern and Western approach that is lacking in the world. Both approaches to life have their own value, but it seems that often they are not integrated very well.

","www.liveyourowndreamlife.com                                   info@liveyourowndreamlife.comDear friend, This campaign is designed to give you the opportunity to enter my very first online programs before they are launched officially, for amazingly low pre-launch prices. The online programs support you to fulfill your deepest desires while going back to your own nature. You will learn to create a life with more purpose and inner spark. Imagine...You wake up in the morning and you feel excited about your life. Your daily activities are inspiring and you feel energized. You enjoy free time with family and friends.The work you do lights up your heart and soul and is connected to who you are. Your activities support your health, well-being and happiness. You have enough time to do what you want to do in your own rhythm and you feel a deep sense of purpose. A weight is lifted from your shoulders because you have more than enough money to spend and you can afford exactly what you need for your deepest fulfillment. The programs will guide you step by step towards the most uplifting version of your life and will help you to get more in touch with your OWN answers about what is right for you and what not, which is eventually the only thing you need.-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                              FOR WHO?                If you want to think outside the box
and want to live your life                              in complete freedom, you are in the right place.              Whether you have children, a
steady job and house or are a traveler,           if you want to create more
has always been one of my highest values

column1: world, to do the things that I am passionate about and to really make a
difference in the world.Nevertheless, a few years ago, my life did not really support this vision. I
had a regular job as a psychologist, worked in an office from 9 to 17 and had
not much time left in my busy schedule to travel over the world, follow my
other passions and to sustain the healthy and conscious lifestyle that I wanted.
Every morning I rushed to my work together with
thousands of others to stand in the same traffic jam for the same traffic
light, to go to a job, that was 'ok-ish', but not truly inspiring, even eating
my lunch in front of my computer. The time came when I ended up having a burnout and
bore-out. My body literally told me to stop and to take a different road in
life. A period of constant fatigue made me aware that something big needed to
happen.  “You’ll never know the outcome unless you just go out there and just do it”                                                   ~Jonathan Anthony Burkett
I had no idea how to combine my work as a
psychologist and holistic healer with a supportive lifestyle AND all my
passions: traveling, dancing, writing and creating. I could not even picture
how that would look like.                                                      So I took a break…
I went on a world journey on my own and studied with enlightened
masters in Asia, went to silent retreats,
read books and talked with inspiring people.
What initially started as a 6 month break became my new life!
Now, I can truly say that I am living my dream life.
A life in which lifestyle, work, spirituality and sustaining my income are no
longer separated. I travel to places that inspire me, start my day with yoga
and dance and create online courses about subjects that I am super passionate
about. This also makes me very flexible to travel and work according to my own
flow and I reach people all over the world.
The road that lead me there was not always easy.
There were many obstacles on the way and people around me did not always
understand my 'off the beaten track' choices. A chronic disease that I had made it impossible to do anything and my clouded head
made my brain slow down in such a way that even organizing something small was
challenging. So although I could earn money, it was not always working out that
way. Nevertheless, I did not want to limit myself by those factors.
So I had to think very much outside of the box. I
learned strategies about having my business online in a way that would give
income, even when I could not work. And I dived fully into ‘creating the life
that you want’ while connecting with a deeper source. A source that is much
more powerful than you can possibly imagine. While connecting with this
powerful force of creation, things started to flow and to fall into place. Magical
things started to happen in my life and step by step my mission became clear.
Now I am helping others to live the most blissful version
of their life, a life that lights up that inner spark.
The more people sustain
their living in a way that is connected to who they really are, the more this will help the world on a global level. And
this is what this crowdfunding campaign is eventually all about.

EXPERIENCES FROM OTHERS:
~ Anna, Sweden
I have received private sessions from Anjali and participated in her emotional freedom workshops and mystical dance classes.
Anjali guides me every time to the core of myself. She helps me to listen to my own inner voice, which is very important to me.""
With her programs, she supports my journey into my own core, in a loving field of acceptance. Anjali please keep on doing your great work supporting people to listen to their own inner voice!""
~ Katerina, Russia:
Anjali is a highly qualified professional and at the same time a passionate and inspiring woman and teacher.""

She’s got lots of varieties of different techniques and methods and knows how to combine them to achieve the best results. Anjali’s style is a very feminine way to create a relaxed atmosphere for deep transformation.”    ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MORE ABOUT ME....

I am a holistic working psychologist, healer, health coach, yogini, and mystical dance teacher. For many years I have been working with clients, developing myself extensively, and traveling and studying in various places in the world. I started my career in psychology, where I quickly realized that the mental approach does not describe the full picture. I worked with people who came from very difficult backgrounds, were unemployed for many years, and had severe financial problems and multiple traumas. It was impossible to help them with the traditional therapies. The problems had anchored too deep in their bodies and they had too many resistances to heal. My drive to go to the core and find out what actually could help these people, and my interest in Eastern ways of living and healing, led me to various innovative healing methods. I practiced Emotional Freedom Technique (EFT), naturopathy, kinesiology, hypnotherapy, mindfulness, mystical dance and EMDR (a method for effective trauma release). Those methods work on deeper layers and release emotions, physical blockages, and long-held beliefs in a very effective and gentle way. This showed itself in better and faster healing results.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     While I traveled through South-East Asia, I dived deep into Tibetan and Indian Tantric yoga, different forms of meditation and healing dance. Seeing the devotional Asian culture inspired me deeply and made me realize how much Western society has drifted away from simplicity and connection with nature. It became clearer to me that it is mostly the connection between the Eastern and Western approach that is lacking in the world. Both approaches to life have their own value, but it seems that often they are not integrated very well.
With my work, I aim to bring opposites together, increase awareness and to make health, wealth and happiness available to people who want to liberate themselves.
Anjali Ananda

0,"
I'm emma, and I founded the Charis Center for the Arts in 2009 to address the lack of arts enrichment being offered in our schools. I know how important my music and theatre training were to me and I want to offer the same opportunities to students in my community.

Our campaign will allow us to reach more students with our amazing classes in art, dance, drama, and music by helping to provide funds for equipment purchases and offer financial aid for those who are in need of assistance through scholarships.

Over the past years I have seen the impact our programs have on young artists. Individual students have found their voices through their work in the visual and performing arts, have  grown in confidence,  and improved their academic achievement.  Many are students who would never have had the opportunity to explore the arts if we hadn't helped.

The visual and performing arts are an important way for us to tell our
stories,  preserve our cultures and history, build confidence, or
appreciate the beauty of it all.  Through the arts we can teach
cooperation, leadership and civility.  If we can give children the
opportunity to experience the power of the arts we are successful. Be

part of the success story.

Your donation does make a difference and will provide small class instruction for a diverse student body in art, dance, drama, vocal music or instrumental music as well as experiences in musical theatre, set and costume design and performance.

Our mission is to provide arts instruction to all who seek it. Currently 100% of our funding is through tuition, however over 70% of our students receive some level of need based tuition reduction in order to participate. About 15% of our students attend Charis programs for free.  The challenge is to build sustainability and stay true to our mission. This is why we need your help. A donation of $25 makes a memorable difference in the life of a child who never knew she could sing, or never had the opportunity to paint a water color picture. $15 buys a student a pair of tap shoes or a dance leotard. $50 would provide an entire costume for a young artist performing in his first musical production.  $100 provides a student with her first guitar. If we can reach our goal of $11,000 we will be ensuring our future and giving a lifetime worth of experiences to students who would otherwise not have the opportunities.

We understand that not everyone has the financial means to donate. We ask that you share our needs with your friends, family and co-workers through indiegogo share, and other social media.

Currently 100% of our funding is through tuition, however over 70% of our students receive some level of need based tuition reduction in order to participate. About 15% of our students attend Charis programs for free.  The challenge is to build sustainability and stay true to our mission. This is why we need your help. A donation of $25 makes a memorable difference in the life of a child who never knew she could sing, or never had the opportunity to paint a water color picture. $15 buys a student a pair of tap shoes or a dance leotard. $50 would provide an entire costume for a young artist performing in his first musical production.  $100 provides a student with her first guitar. If we can reach our goal of $11,000 we will be ensuring our future and giving a lifetime worth of experiences to students who would otherwise not have the opportunities. We understand that not everyone has the financial means to donate. We ask that you share our needs with your friends, family and co-workers through indiegogo share, and other social media.",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns
|","Lanham, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/kaleidoscope-dreams/pica
0,"

column1: World Youth Hall of Fame

We need your help in finding the youth that should be nominated for induction into the World Youth Hall of Fame.
Send your suggested nominees, with all information, illustrations or pictures to the Youth Hall of Fame.
​PLEASE RESEARCH YOUR CHOICE FOR A NOMINEE, WRITE A BRIEF STORY AS TO WHY THEY SHOULD BE CONSIDERED.
ALL SUGGESTIONS WILL BE CONSIDERED BY THE NOMINATION COMMITTEE.
THE NOMINATION COMMITTEE WILL BE MADE UP OF 10 YOUTH AND 2 ADULTS.
REMEMBER THAT EACH NOMINEE WILL BE PLACED INTO THE VOTING BINDERS LOCATED IN THE WORLD YOUTH HALL OF FAME.
EACH NOMINEE MUST RECEIVE 1000 VOTES FROM THE GENERAL PUBLIC TO BE INDUCTED INTO THE WORLD YOUTH HALL OF FAME.
SEND YOUR SELECTION TO THE CONTACT PAGE IN THIS WEB SITE TO:
www.worldyouthhalloffame.org

THANK YOU VERY MUCH FOR YOUR HELP AND THANKS TO ALL OUR YOUTH FOR THEIR PAST ACHIEVEMENTS.

ATTENTION:WITH YOUR PARENTS WRITTEN PERMISSION, WE WILL GIVE YOU CREDIT FOR YOUR RESEARCH ASSISTANCE.

MAX STEVENS -- FOUNDER OF THE YOUTH HALL OF FAME.

​
<ul>
<li>
STEVIE WONDER, recorded ""Finger Tips"" when he was 12.  It sold more than 1,000,000 copies making it a gold record.
<li>
MICHAEL JACKSON was the lead singer of the ""Jackson Five"", a very successful group, when he was only 8.
<li>
JULIAN LAGE was only 12 years old when he won an Emmy for his Jazz compositions.
<li>
LANG LANG at
17 has become famous in the musical world after filling in for
top-billed soloist Andre Watts in Tchaikovsky's First Piano Concerto
when Watts fell ill.. He has been playing the piano since he was only 3.
<ul>
<li>
MARGO FEIDEN was a Broadway producer at the age of 16.
<li>
STEVEN PAUL at
the age of 20 wrote, produced, directed, and appeared in the romantic
comedy ""Falling in Love"" (1980) other stars
Your, and Michelle Pfeiffer.  This made him the youngest Hollywood
producer.
<li>
SYDNEY LING at the age of 13 directed, produced, and wrote the thriller ""Lex the Wonderdog"" (1972).
<li>
NIKKI TAYLOR while
13 received a $500,000 super model contract. This was in a contest
called Fresh Faces. This made her the youngest girl to win a major
cosmetics contract.
<li>
THE QUIZ KIDS appeared
on T.V. in the 50's they were 4 to 17 years old, and were pitted against
the smartest of their time in math, science, history, and English.  The
Quiz Kids beat most, even including a Nobel prize winner.
<ul>
<li>
BILL GATES at
the age of 20 was the co-founder of Microsoft, and became the youngest
of 101 billionaires reported in the United States in 1992.
<li>
SHANE MACK -
Youngest Mayor- at the age of 18, he became the mayor of Castlewood
S.D.  This was May 3, 1988, and he held this office until May 6, 1996.
<li>
CARL WITTE at
the age of 12 received his doctorate from the University of Giessen,
Germany.  This was in the field of mathematics, and he was made a doctor
of Philosophy.
<li>
JACKIE COOGANT AND SHIRLEY TEMPLE, were
two of the youngest self made millionaires. This was in the thirty's,
when one million dollars would be like 20 million dollars today.
<li>
LOUIS BRAILLE,
when he was 15 years old discovered a simple way to make a raised-dot
alphabet. To this day it is still the best, and used world wide by the
blind
<li>
MATTHEW NONNEMACHER was quite an
organizer.  At the age of 10, he organized a huge Penny drive that
collected 1,819,691 pennies.  We would love to have Matthew help us with
the World's Largest coin collection drive for the lobby of the ""World
Youth"" Hall of Fame.
<li>
J.C.JULIUS LANGBEIN AND GEORGE HOLLAT, were among the hundreds of Congressional ""Medal of Honor"" winners who were in their youth, and they were only 15.
<li>
JULIUS ROSENBERG of
Winnipeg, Canada, when he was only five years old, stopped a black bear
that was attacking his three year old sister.  He was awarded the
Medal of Bravery"" in March 1994.
<li>
LUIS ALVES DELIMAE SILVA, a Brazilian military hero and statesman, enrolled in the military (infantry regiment) at the age of five. This was in 1808.
<li>
GEORGIN THOMPSON was
only 15 when she made her first parachute jump from a balloon. She
became the first woman to ever make a parachute jump from an airplane.

J.C.JULIUS LANGBEIN AND GEORGE HOLLAT, were among the hundreds of Congressional ""Medal of Honor"" winners who were in their youth, and they were only 15.
JULIUS ROSENBERG of
Winnipeg, Canada, when he was only five years old, stopped a black bear
that was attacking his three year old sister.  He was awarded the
Medal of Bravery"" in March 1994.
LUIS ALVES DELIMAE SILVA, a Brazilian military hero and statesman, enrolled in the military (infantry regiment) at the age of five. This was in 1808.
GEORGIN THOMPSON was
only 15 when she made her first parachute jump from a balloon. She
became the first woman to ever make a parachute jump from an airplane.

Short Summary

Hello, my name is Mia Chin. I am currently a junior in high school and I need your help!

column2: >   Recently, I received a nomination to attend NYLF Medicine.
>I am struggling to find a way to pay for this amazing summer intensive program.

column1: Ever since I can remember I have always dreamed of a career in medicine. Medicine combines a love for sciences and humanitarianism. I hope to one day give back to the global community. I aspire to travel to 3rd world countries in the future to help those in need. It is a rigorous path of persistence, diligence, proficiency, and above all else cooperation.
That is why I am asking you to help me attend National Youth Leadership Forum Medicine.
<ul> <li>

NYLF Medicine : is a 9 day program in which selected high school students are able to get first-hand experience and knowledge concerning the medical field. It is held in 10 cities across the U.S., each chosen for their world-class medical universities, hospitals, facilities and research centers. Attendees get to experience hands-on medical and health care activities, true-to-life medical simulations and unique and stimulating role-playing exercises with peers and medical experts, as to explore and match their interests and passions for a future in medicine and health care.
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Through this opportunity I can become acquainted with the inner-workings of the medical profession. <b style=""font-style: italic
column3: >I believe in the power of cooperation and that every effort can make a huge difference. My greatest dream is to one day help others at there most vulnerable times.

column1: <span style=""background-color: initial
column4:

What We Need &
column5:
What You Get
  • Tuition for this program is 2,700 USD. Not including food expenses, insurance or travel expenses. I want to do my best to be able to afford this amazing opportunity and not burden my family with this costly expense. 
  • Even if the goal of 2,000 USD is not reached all the money still will go toward the program's expenses. (In the unfortunate circumstance that I will not be able to attend, the donated expenses will go toward a college fund.)

column1: Perks!

• If you donate 10, 20, 30, 50, or 100 USD you can receive hand made art! I will personally make a 3-D book letter or inspirational quote art depending on what amount you donate. I will put great care into these art works as a way to show my thanks.

The Impact
<ul>

• This program will have a huge impact of my life. This is not a materialistic gain. Being able to go to this program will help me better decide what path in life I wish to take and strengthen my focus and motivation in the medical career. Through this opportunity I can give back to the world community with the knowledge I will have gained.
<li><span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >I will probably never receive another opportunity like this in my high school career. I want to do my best to capitalize on the opportunities that life gives me.

column2: >I take my studies very seriously in school, I take various AP and honors courses and maintain straight A's on my report card. I am also a member of the National Honor Society, and I have made honor roll every quarter since sixth grade. I can assure you that I will get every thing possible out of this educational experience.

column1: • I will be forever grateful for every contribution that is made (through donation or through exposure), and you can be certain that you have positively impacted my life. :)

•  I do not want to forfeit this opportunity, and I desperately want to go.    My family needs to be able to enroll me as soon as possible so I can make sure my place in NYLF Medicine is reserved. Every contribution is valuable.

","Short Summary Hello, my name is Mia Chin. I am currently a junior in high school and I need your help!

column1: Recently, I received a nomination to attend NYLF Medicine.
I am struggling to find a way to pay for this amazing summer intensive program.

Ever since I can remember I have always dreamed of a career in medicine. Medicine combines a love for sciences and humanitarianism. I hope to one day give back to the global community. I aspire to travel to 3rd world countries in the future to help those in need. It is a rigorous path of persistence, diligence, proficiency, and above all else cooperation.
That is why I am asking you to help me attend National Youth Leadership Forum Medicine.

NYLF Medicine : is a 9 day program in which selected high school students are able to get first-hand experience and knowledge concerning the medical field. It is held in 10 cities across the U.S., each chosen for their world-class medical universities, hospitals, facilities and research centers. Attendees get to experience hands-on medical and health care activities, true-to-life medical simulations and unique and stimulating role-playing exercises with peers and medical experts, as to explore and match their interests and passions for a future in medicine and health care.

Through this opportunity I can become acquainted with the inner-workings of the medical profession. I believe in the power of cooperation and that every effort can make a huge difference. My greatest dream is to one day help others at there most vulnerable times.

You can help me make this dream a reality!      What We Need & What You Get  Tuition for this program is 2,700 USD. Not including food expenses, insurance or travel expenses. I want to do my best to be able to afford this amazing opportunity and not burden my family with this costly expense.  Even if the goal of 2,000 USD is not reached all the money still will go toward the program's expenses. (In the unfortunate circumstance that I will not be able to attend, the donated expenses will go toward a college fund.)
Perks!

If you donate 10, 20, 30, 50, or 100 USD you can receive hand made art! I will personally make a 3-D book letter or inspirational quote art depending on what amount you donate. I will put great care into these art works as a way to show my thanks.
Everyone who donates to my cause has my utmost gratitude and a personal thank you.

To receive other perks for donating to my cause you can go to my other fundraising account instead where you can buy from an assortment of 1500+ items and I will receive 40% profit! --->  http://www.efundraising.com/miasnylf
The Impact

This program will have a huge impact of my life. This is not a materialistic gain. Being able to go to this program will help me better decide what path in life I wish to take and strengthen my focus and motivation in the medical career. Through this opportunity I can give back to the world community with the knowledge I will have gained.
I will probably never receive another opportunity like this in my high school career. I want to do my best to capitalize on the opportunities that life gives me.

I take my studies very seriously in school, I take various AP and honors courses and maintain straight A's on my report card. I am also a member of the National Honor Society, and I have made honor roll every quarter since sixth grade. I can assure you that I will get every thing possible out of this educational experience.
I will be forever grateful for every contribution that is made (through donation or through exposure), and you can be certain that you have positively impacted my life. :)

I do not want to forfeit this opportunity, and I desperately want to go.    My family needs to be able to enroll me as soon as possible so I can make sure my place in NYLF Medicine is reserved. Every contribution is valuable.
I need your help because I cannot do this alone.
Other Ways You Can Help
If you cannot donate any money to help the cause that is completely understandable and I still want to thank you for taking your time to read this!    There are still ways you can help -->
Use Indiegogo share tools (on the left-hand side of this webpage). Or share this link through email or social media to family and friends!   Thank you so much for your time!!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

Just 2 weeks ago a few friends started an appeal and the above picture is the result, so far!

We have had such a MASSIVE response to our initial appeal to collect ADULTS AND CHILDREN'S CLOTHES AND SHOES, that we have now encountered a problem. Local companies have been kind enough to donate vans to help us transport all the donations from where we are based in NORFOLK to the shipping container in MANCHESTER but we need fuel for these vans and this is why WE NEED YOUR HELP!

We would like to ask for JUST £1 DONATION. 

We feel that this has been such a successful appeal because it has involved the whole community. Hundreds of people, coming together to give a little something that they do not need. We would like this philosophy to continue into our fund raising. When people give away a little something that they will not miss they think it doesn't count - BUT THIS IS NOT TRUE! When many people come together, when we all give a little to the same thing, we realise how strong we all are. We realise how much our little something really does count and we realise that we can achieve great things when we all act together!
column5:
>We called ourselves FromNRwithlove because we hoped to spread love and care from the Norfolk community.

We were created organically, after an initial idea by Ella King to start collecting children's shoes to send to displaced refugees in Syria, suffering a bitter Winter. 
Robyn Caston and India Hewitt became involved, and after some initial research into all the ways in which we could help, fromNRwithlove was born. 

Our Appeal

column1: <div style=""font-weight: bold
column2: >We are a group of friends who simply want to make a positive impact on a terrible situation. We have no funding, all our work is entirely voluntary.

column1: <div>

In Syria there are 12,2 million people in need, 50% of them are children.  The ongoing freezing weather conditions there have caused fatalities and left hundreds of displaced families without shelter.

The conditions in the camps is diabolical. There have been multiple cases of frost bite amongst children and adults alike. The violent winds have shredded tents and personal belongings lie strewn across the ground, buried under ice and snow or stuck in freezing mud. Children walk through snow and ice without shoes, families do everything they can to keep warm with inadequate clothing. Latest reports from Syria say deaths due to this plight are inevitable.

Achievements so far...
Although the appeal began just sourcing children's shoes, the response from the local community has been overwhelming. Our campaign has gained some momentum and now we have now been collecting a range of necessities which are in desperate need. We now ask for used (clean) clothes and shoes, as well as other essentials such as blankets and pharmacueticals for both adults and children. 

Our appeal has taken off at such a rate that we now have a whole container to fill which will be shipped to Syria. Donations will be being driven by us and some lovely volunteers on the 9th of February, from our Warehouse in Norwich to the container in Manchester. 

Although at the moment we are concentrating on our Syria appeal, we hope that this is just the beginning for FromNRwithlove. We hope to continue to spread the genorosity and love from our quiet corner of the UK as far and wide as possible!

Any funds we can raise via crowd funding will go toward petrol costs to collect donations from those too far to make our drop off points, and to fuel the vans (which have been donated by local businesses) for the drive to Manchester. 

For more info about our appeal, please see our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/fromnrwithlove 

Thank you!

We now ask for used (clean) clothes and shoes, as well as other essentials such as blankets and pharmacueticals for both adults and children. Our appeal has taken off at such a rate that we now have a whole container to fill which will be shipped to Syria. Donations will be being driven by us and some lovely volunteers on the 9th of February, from our Warehouse in Norwich to the container in Manchester. Although at the moment we are concentrating on our Syria appeal, we hope that this is just the beginning for FromNRwithlove. We hope to continue to spread the genorosity and love from our quiet corner of the UK as far and wide as possible!Any funds we can raise via crowd funding will go toward petrol costs to collect donations from those too far to make our drop off points, and to fuel the vans (which have been donated by local businesses) for the drive to Manchester. For more info about our appeal, please see our Facebook page https://www.facebook.com/fromnrwithlove Thank you!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Norfolk, United Kingdom",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/syrian-refugee-aid/pica

Short Summary

My  name is Randy aka ""Ricochet Randy"" The Tombstone Storyteller, I have lived in the Tombstone area for almost 12 years.My compassion is the history of this great region. From the Native Americans to current day.
The storytelling will be FREE to all!

• This project is important to me because of the compassion I have for it. I want the visitors to enjoy their stay in Tombstone and tell others about  it.
  • The magnitude of this project has already been seen by others as the tourist ask more about our local history. I have received letters from visitors thanking me for the good time they had because of the stories I told. I never make-up things.  If I don't know I get a email address and I tell them I will try to get the answer and email them.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?
My
Goal
It
is my goal to bring the rich history of Tombstone and Cochise County
to life through storytelling.  I have a location to construct a
twenty-two foot tepee (cover &amp
column2: linr) to be used as a indoor

column1: theater, It will have a medicine wheel in the center and people will
sit in a circle around it. The tepee will be filled wath artifacts to
help tell the stories.
The
stories to be told will inclued but not limited to:
The
Apache Wars
The
Story Of Tombstone
The
Story Of Geronimo
Miner's
Stories
There
will never be a fee to anyone to come hear the Stories !
I
will be the storyteller and I will not receive a pay.
I
will opporate five days a week
Closed
Tuesdays &amp
I
will form a non-profit org. and will file for a 501 c 3 before the
end of 2015
Any
funds over the needed amount will inhance the project to greater
boundaries.
I
need to raise $6,500.00 to get the project off the ground
so
any gift will be greatly appreciated
What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • The $6,500.00 I need to get started cover the Tepee, seating, artifacts insurance, marketing and the cost to create a non-profit organization . The organization will then raise funds to keep the project on going.
  • If the total goal is not reached the funding will be used on a smaller scale to do the same thing.

column1: • The only gain I will receive is selling my hand crafts.
• When this project is compleate I will send everyone a video.
<div>

The Impact

First of all I am NOT a Historian, I am a Storyteller, I get my stories from people like historians and from information found in old documents, legends. I convey the stories to the interested public with feeling

When the visitors come to Tombstone the only thing they know is about that famous 30 second gunfight, but tombstone has so much more history to offer, the mining of silver is what made Tombstone a town. The bloodiest cabin in Arizona has a major part of how the town got it's name. And the Native Americans who lived here before the town, famous grave sites of people who made the history.  There is so much about this area and when I tell people they sit and want to hear more.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you can't help with a gift get my word out! email friends , post it on facebook,

And that's all there is to it.

http://www.spacecamp.com/space
Caitlin aka Science Girl
column2: >Knowing what career you want, before the age of two is pretty remarkable. It has always been science and astrophysics for me...

>I'm now 13 years old and I'm booked to go to Space Camp, at the US Space and Rocket Centre, Huntsville, Alabama, for a week's intensive astronaut training in Summer 2015. I couldn't be more excited - it is a lifelong dream for me and a huge stepping stone for my future. #NASA, I hope!
>I live and breathe science - at school, at home, everywhere, hopefully inspiring
column3: > my younger sister and brother and many of my friends to consider STEM careers in the future. I'm an Industrial Cadet with my school and Airbus (planes) in North Wales. I have been a member of the Sea Cadets for nearly four years, learning seamanship and I'll be transferring
column4: > this Spring to the Royal Marines Cadets where I'll start military fieldcraft and small arms training. Have a look on the gallery page (see the menu above). Mum is putting on a series of images, including one of my attempt

column1: Funding Plea:

I need help with travelling expenses from my home in North Wales to the United States. The total cost of the trip is expected to be in the region of £4000. I'd like to raise £2000 to soften the financial blow for my mother, Corinne, who is a school science technician and photographer. She is hugely encouraging in helping me work towards an exciting STEM career. She is a STEM ambassador who believes in me totally. 

  • My mother has already paid for my course at the Huntsville, Alabama, Space and Rocket Centre in the United States. Our single-mum family could really use help in raising funds to help pay for flights - I'm too young to travel alone, given the distance and flight changes involved. 
  • I have other fundraising ideas to additionally help me to achieve my goal. I'll keep this page updated with those as the campaign progresses.
  • If we don't raise the entire amount, we'll still be extremely grateful for any help towards this epic experience for me.

The Impact Of Your Help

When I make my application to my chosen university in a few years, I'll have to justify why I should gain a place - I reckon that this course, along with other achievements, will help prove my motivation and dedication.

  • Our future depends on Science and Technology - and needs young, driven people like me!
  • You'd be helping someone who has been enthralled by science and space since about the time she was learning to walk, to make seriously giant steps towards a seriously awesome and inspirational career.

• My school has a fabulous and supportive science department - my teachers are helping extensively with fundraising ideas and other support. I know that when I have been on my course and I'm able to show and tell my trip, I'll inspire  current and future pupils.

    • What I Can Do In Return

    Whilst I'm away, I'll be making a written and photographic diary of my course. I'd be delighted to come along to your company and talk about my experience. For individual contributors, I'll post my images and stories for you to see!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please, please, please pass this link on to any people or organisations who could help or who have an interest in helping a young person work towards a STEM career - or let me know about them so I can ask myself!

    • A note and link on Facebook and other social media.
    • Using the links on these pages helps, too!

    Thanks so, so much! 

    Caitlin Fudge

I'm now 13 years old and I'm booked to go to Space Camp, at the US Space and Rocket Centre, Huntsville, Alabama, for a week's intensive astronaut training in Summer 2015. I couldn't be more excited - it is a lifelong dream for me and a huge stepping stone for my future. #NASA, I hope!

I live and breathe science - at school, at home, everywhere, hopefully inspiring my younger sister and brother and many of my friends to consider STEM careers in the future. I'm an Industrial Cadet with my school and Airbus (planes) in North Wales. I have been a member of the Sea Cadets for nearly four years, learning seamanship and I'll be transferring this Spring to the Royal Marines Cadets where I'll start military fieldcraft and small arms training. Have a look on the gallery page (see the menu above). Mum is putting on a series of images, including one of my attempt to fly a plane, aged two....

Support The Firing Line!

If you're passionate about shooting sports, firearms, gun rights and have enjoyed listening to interviews with some of the most well-known personalities in and around the firearms culture, donate whatever you feel is right to help me keep the show on the air!

column2: >I'm Seth, aka Rangemaster Bruce the voice of
column7: >. A native of Colorado, I spent 10.5 years in the Air Force, the last 7 as a firearms instructor in the Combat Arms Training &amp
column8: Maintenance career field. My experience as an instructor has helped make TFL an exciting project to pursue.

column2:
>It's an opportunity to share the personalities of top-tier competitors with the listening audience as well as the knowledge of those involved in fighting for gun rights.

What I need:

$300/month - Producer fee. I really can't emphasize how important it is to have a competent producer running the soundboard and arranging guests when I can't get away from my day job to do so.

column1: $545/month - Air time. This is pretty self-explanatory. My air costs money and my goal at this point is to raise enough money to fund TFL through January 2016.
Any funds raised will go directly to funding TFL regardless of whether I meet my goal of funding the 2015 show series.

Impact

By donating to my campaign, you'll help me keep TFL on the air, providing a voice for those in favor of gun rights while also recognizing the responsibilities of gun ownership beyond simple law obedience.
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
I understand if you support my goal and TFL but are not in a position to donate funds. I've been there personally and I appreciate your support regardless. But you can still help.

Whether you can donate or not, please share the campaign to fund TFL on any social media platforms you may use, send it to friends and family if they would support it and by all means, share it in any firearms-related groups to which you may belong!

","Support The Firing Line! If you're passionate about shooting sports, firearms, gun rights and have enjoyed listening to interviews with some of the most well-known personalities in and around the firearms culture, donate whatever you feel is right to help me keep the show on the air!

I'm Seth, aka Rangemaster Bruce the voice of The Firing Line on Newstalk 1310 KFKA. A native of Colorado, I spent 10.5 years in the Air Force, the last 7 as a firearms instructor in the Combat Arms Training & Maintenance career field. My experience as an instructor has helped make TFL an exciting project to pursue.

It's an opportunity to share the personalities of top-tier competitors with the listening audience as well as the knowledge of those involved in fighting for gun rights.   What I need: $300/month - Producer fee. I really can't emphasize how important it is to have a competent producer running the soundboard and arranging guests when I can't get away from my day job to do so.
$545/month - Air time. This is pretty self-explanatory. My air costs money and my goal at this point is to raise enough money to fund TFL through January 2016.
Any funds raised will go directly to funding TFL regardless of whether I meet my goal of funding the 2015 show series.

Impact By donating to my campaign, you'll help me keep TFL on the air, providing a voice for those in favor of gun rights while also recognizing the responsibilities of gun ownership beyond simple law obedience.
Other Ways You Can Help
I understand if you support my goal and TFL but are not in a position to donate funds. I've been there personally and I appreciate your support regardless. But you can still help.

Whether you can donate or not, please share the campaign to fund TFL on any social media platforms you may use, send it to friends and family if they would support it and by all means, share it in any firearms-related groups to which you may belong!",0.0,0,"1 Campaign

column2: >What We're Doing - Power of Hope BAY AREA

column1: <div><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<span style=""font-size: medium
column5: >We believe in the power of art and community to unlock creativity and transformation in young people.  Power of Hope camps have served thousands of young people over the past 25 years, providing deeply empowering experiences for teenagers in need of connection and expression.  Join us in this next adventure!

column1: This summer, July 2015, we will be hosting our very first Power of Hope BAY AREA Camp.
<div><ul>

• Bringing over 40 youth and 20 adults from the Bay Area together for an 8-day arts-empowerment camp featuring dance, theater, music, visual art, writing and nature learning to explore the self, connection, and global action.
• Young people will have the chance to connect with their inner lives, each other, fabulous mentors, the natural world and the greater world through a week of facilitated community building.
• Hosted in beautiful Bolinas, CA by Commonweal, with stunning views of the ocean, hiking paths, and meditative spots to support a powerful connection with nature.
• PYE is also establishing itself as a community partner in the Bay Area, working with local groups and individuals, offering trainings, and building connective work for years to come!
• We need YOU to help us achieve our goal the END OF MARCH to make camp possible for 2015!!!
<div>
Who We Are
<ul>
<li>

PYE (Partners for Youth Empowerment) is excited to bring its years of experience to the Bay Area to start a brand new Teen Summer Camp, based on its Power of Hope Camps that have been running in Washington State and Canada for the past 25 years!  Check us out at www.pyeglobal.org and www.powerofhope.org

• We are teaming up with local Bay Area organizations to develop a unique and empowering experience for young people. For over 25 years, Destiny Arts Center (www.destinyarts.org) has provided a home away from home for thousands of young people throughout the East Bay, through dance, martial arts, theater and its Violence Prevention Curriculum.  Our lead partner, Commonweal, (www.commonweal.org) is located in beautiful West Marin in Bolinas and with their focuses on health and healing, art and education, and environment and justice, they are an ideal companion on this journey
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >We know that with your help, we can create a lasting experience for Bay Area youth, who will go on to become change makers in their communities!
column4: What You Get In order to make this camp a reality, we need your help to raise $40,000!

column1: <ul>

• This money goes to sponsoring all of the youth who cannot afford attending camp on their own and hiring an amazing team of dedicated artists, facilitators and camp managers to make this a lasting experience for all!  Your donations will extend for years, whether it's helping to buy supplies or impacting the life of a young person.

• We also need to purchase tents, cooking equipment for our delicious meals, and coordinate transportation from the city to Bolinas.
  • Our partners and community have collaborated to bring all kinds of exciting PERKS, from classes at beautiful Destiny Arts Center to Arts-Facilitation Trainings, to a dreamy escape to Bolinas!  Our small way of saying THANK YOU for your HUGE support!  
  • If our fundraising goal is not met, Power of Hope Bay Area will be set back to 2016.  So please, donate now to get the ball rolling!
<ul>
<strong><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >At our signature 8-day camps, we bring youth together in a 2:1 ratio with a staff of artists, naturalists, self-care specialists, community activists and other adults working for positive change in the world.

column1: <span style=""font-weight: bold
column3: >As a result of our programs, young people:

column1: <span style=""letter-spacing: 0px

column2: >• Connect with their sense of purpose
column4: >• Learn ways to become active in their communities
column5: >• Speak out about issues that matter to them

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Not able to donate?  Help us spread the word!

  • Let people know about this Indiegogo Campaign!  Spread the word on Social Media, but don't forget that an individual email, message or conversation is always the best!
Want to see more?  Check out this fabulous video from one of our Power of Hope Canada camps, made by facilitator Gani Naylor!
<div>
<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fplayer.vimeo.com%2Fvideo%2F71360552&amp
","What We're Doing - Power of Hope BAY AREA

We believe in the power of art and community to unlock creativity and transformation in young people.  Power of Hope camps have served thousands of young people over the past 25 years, providing deeply empowering experiences for teenagers in need of connection and expression.  Join us in this next adventure!
This summer, July 2015, we will be hosting our very first Power of Hope BAY AREA Camp.

Bringing over 40 youth and 20 adults from the Bay Area together for an 8-day arts-empowerment camp featuring dance, theater, music, visual art, writing and nature learning to explore the self, connection, and global action.
Young people will have the chance to connect with their inner lives, each other, fabulous mentors, the natural world and the greater world through a week of facilitated community building.
Hosted in beautiful Bolinas, CA by Commonweal, with stunning views of the ocean, hiking paths, and meditative spots to support a powerful connection with nature.
PYE is also establishing itself as a community partner in the Bay Area, working with local groups and individuals, offering trainings, and building connective work for years to come!
We need YOU to help us achieve our goal the END OF MARCH to make camp possible for 2015!!!
Who We Are

PYE (Partners for Youth Empowerment) is excited to bring its years of experience to the Bay Area to start a brand new Teen Summer Camp, based on its Power of Hope Camps that have been running in Washington State and Canada for the past 25 years!  Check us out at www.pyeglobal.org and www.powerofhope.org

We are teaming up with local Bay Area organizations to develop a unique and empowering experience for young people. For over 25 years, Destiny Arts Center (www.destinyarts.org) has provided a home away from home for thousands of young people throughout the East Bay, through dance, martial arts, theater and its Violence Prevention Curriculum.  Our lead partner, Commonweal, (www.commonweal.org) is located in beautiful West Marin in Bolinas and with their focuses on health and healing, art and education, and environment and justice, they are an ideal companion on this journey

We know that with your help, we can create a lasting experience for Bay Area youth, who will go on to become change makers in their communities!   What We Need & What You Get In order to make this camp a reality, we need your help to raise $40,000!

This money goes to sponsoring all of the youth who cannot afford attending camp on their own and hiring an amazing team of dedicated artists, facilitators and camp managers to make this a lasting experience for all!  Your donations will extend for years, whether it's helping to buy supplies or impacting the life of a young person.

We also need to purchase tents, cooking equipment for our delicious meals, and coordinate transportation from the city to Bolinas. Our partners and community have collaborated to bring all kinds of exciting PERKS, from classes at beautiful Destiny Arts Center to Arts-Facilitation Trainings, to a dreamy escape to Bolinas!  Our small way of saying THANK YOU for your HUGE support!   If our fundraising goal is not met, Power of Hope Bay Area will be set back to 2016.  So please, donate now to get the ball rolling!
Impact - Power of Hope Camps

At our signature 8-day camps, we bring youth together in a 2:1 ratio with a staff of artists, naturalists, self-care specialists, community activists and other adults working for positive change in the world.
As a result of our programs, young people:
• Discover and expand their creativity
• Connect with their sense of purpose• Develop their leadership skills• Learn ways to become active in their communities• Speak out about issues that matter to them

Other Ways You Can Help Not able to donate?  Help us spread the word!  Let people know about this Indiegogo Campaign!  Spread the word on Social Media, but don't forget that an individual email, message or conversation is always the best!
Want to see more?  Check out this fabulous video from one of our Power of Hope Canada camps, made by facilitator Gani Naylor!",1.0,1,"2 Campaigns
|","Oakland, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/power-of-hope-bay-area-summer-camp-2015/pica

Short Summary

<div>My name is Von Jackson and I am dedicating my birthday to charity! Now as you say ""Oh that's a wonderful gesture"" I want you to understand why.  I am originally from Jackson, MS and now reside in Memphis, TN.  As I began to think about my approaching birthday in April, I asked myself ""Why am I thankful to have reached this age?""  In my brief time on Earth, I've come to believe one thing: All people are governed by one simple principle to love one another.  I could just as easily spend this birthday just as any other, celebrating and fellowshipping with my loved ones, but how would I really be loving mankind in that?  Most would agree that this is a lost world we live but the question is, what have we lost?  I believe we have lost our compassion for one another.  So, in the spirited words of Mahatma Ghandi, I desire to ""be the change I wish to see in this world."" After seeing their mission to help educate the growing minds of tomorrow<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: > I chose the Learn to Be Foundation
column3: >.  While I do believe feeding the homeless and protecting the downtrodden is very important, I chose this foundation because I believe education is the solution to the problems of tomorrow.  They provide free online tutoring to students in a personal way. The Learn to Be Foundation is a way to put mankind back on a more stable path toward tomorrow.  With all of this in mind...will you join me?

column1:
What We Need

I am hoping to raise $25,000.  I wanted to pick a number that I felt was attainable.  I am donating the first $25.  If I can get 999 more people to match my effort, we can reach that $25,000.  Each $25 donation pays for 1 month of service with Learn To Be.  It is my belief that this will inspire others to say that they too can make a difference if they believe in a purpose and set their mind to a goal.
The money would be used to fund:
<ul>

• Improving student's Virtual Classroom: They're constantly making strides to improve their technology in order to make an even more seamless transition from the in-person tutoring session to the online tutoring session.

• Enhancing Interactions: They want to make sure that not only can students receive help instantly, but that it makes a transformative impact in their learning. They want to find new ways to help students learn to help facilitate the online tutoring session.

• Growing Their Tutor Base: They're starting a movement of like-minded individuals interested in providing individualized attention to students, and your support will help them recruit amazing people from around the world.

• Exploring New Opportunities: They know that education goes far beyond solving a math problem or correcting an essay and they're exploring how they can use their platform to incorporate technology and engineering to help further students' knowledge.
Founded in January 2008 by Stephen Chen and Neeraj Kapoor, to date they have:
<ul>
• Hosted 29,995 tutoring sessions
• Dedicated 15,309 hours of tutoring
• Started 15 satellite college chapters to further their cause across America

Learn To Be provides tutoring through a customized online classroom environment that has been open-sourced by BigBlueButton. Similar services include Tutor.com, which provides free tutoring to military families, and TutorChatLive, a non-profit founded by students from the Wharton School of the University of Pennsylvania.

The tutors apply via an online form on the Foundation's website, and after a certification process and background check, are allowed to enter the community to pick up sessions. The Foundation and its University Chapters approach low-performing schools and schools in generally underserved areas, where students can gain access to the Learn To Be tutoring platform at a school computer lab or on a library computer. Students can request sessions in math, sciences, and language arts between 9am and 9pm, Pacific Time.
column3: >  The service is completely free and is supported by the Foundation which operates solely on donations from the community.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

If you're still reading this I hope you will decide to join me.  If you are unable to donate money in the next 30 days then I ask that you will spread the world.  As of 2014, there are 318.9 Million people in America.  It only takes $25 from 999 more people to raise the goal of $25,000.  Spreading the word is just as helpful as a donation!

God Bless those that see these words and find good in them.

column4: >We are a group of students from the Law &amp
column5: Paralegal Studies Club in City Tech, and we really need your help to raise a $1,000 to help City Tech's legal students visit the U.S. Supreme Court in Washington D.C. and witness a hearing in our country's highest court.

column1: Petitioner: The Law and Paralegal Studies Club (""the club"") at  New York City College of Technology.
<li>
Procedural History: The Law &
column2: Paralegal Studies Club (""the club"") has made their trip to Washington D.C. an annual tradition since 2008.

column1: <li>
Issue: Due to the club's limited funding, the total cost of the trip is expensive, an each student would have to pay $200--an amount that many of our students simply do not have.
<li>

Analysis: Legal students are required to read and analyze U.S. Supreme Court cases on a regular basis, but the majority of our students might never get to witness one of these cases in real life. We believe that our students will be encouraged to continue their legal goals through this trip--the same way artists get inspired in the Louvre. Our students are very excited about the trip, they all have worked very hard in their legal classes and deserve an opportunity to learn how our court system works...

column4: >We have created a budget for our trip, and the cost amounts to nearly $8,000 for 20 students. City Tech, a public CUNY college, granted the club $3,600. If we were to charge $200 per student, we would only have a $500 deficit
column5: however, we are aware that due to the low wages and high cost of living in New York City, the trip will be a financial burden for many of our students. As a club, we are trying different fund-raising methods to alleviate the cost of the trip for the students. Our club members are currently participating in various fundraising activities to help reduce the cost of the trip, such as food sales and bake sales (we are known for our empandas!)
column6:
however, our food-sales do not produce a lot of money. We need your help:

By generously donating to our Washington D.C. campaign, you will help:

column1: • Reduce the cost of the trip from $200 to $100 per student
• help pay their travel expenses and accommodations for three days and two nights (Amtrak alone is $3,200!)
• Pay two group dinners for our students

column2: >We want all our friends and family to know that all funds will be use to pay travel and accommodations--our priority--even if we do not reach the $1,000 goal. If we do reach our goal, the proceeds from our food sales will pay two group dinners for our students.
column5:
/>

We want to assure you that the club is working hard to raise money for the trip, and not just solely relying on the work of others. We had food sales and bake sales every other week, and we have one more to go on March 31st. Check out some our successful food sales and bake sales.
column7:

column9:

column3:
