www.magicbreakfast.com
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)

Over half a million children in the UK arrive at school hungry, according to research published in the Journal of Nutrition. A hungry child cannot concentrate and can be disruptive in class, causing them and their classmates to miss out on valuable teaching time in core morning lessons. One school business manager in Coventry told us recently that many of their pupils were living in extreme poverty. She said children came to school with just one chocolate bar in their lunch box to last them the whole day. Magic Breakfast is passionate about making sure no child starts their school day too hungry to learn. The charity delivers free, nutritious breakfasts to schools in England where over 35% of pupils are eligible for Free School Meals. Schools are then helped to find funds themselves in order that the breakfast provision is sustainable. Magic Breakfast’s goal is for the problem of hunger as a barrier to education to be solved for good by 2020.
The Impact
A better start in life. A better educational experience. A better future.
<div>
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
2001- Founder Carmel
McConnell started delivering breakfast to five schools in Tower Hamlets after
speaking to teachers saying they were bringing in food for hungry pupils
2003- Magic Breakfast set up
2005-Delivering breakfast to 16 London primary schools with a small waiting
list
2009- Partnership with
Quaker Tropicana meant we could expand our support to 200 schools and a new
logistics system with Igloo Logistics allowed us to deliver outside of London
2015- We are supporting 440 schools across England, delivering 2 million meals with 312 schools still on our waiting list.
We need your support to reach out to the 2,000 schools that still need our help.
Please get involved on some of our fundraising events!
Email: Rosie@magicbreakfast.com
http://www.magicbreakfast.com/media-centre/news-and-events

column6: >(Thanks for the donors. Children,
column12: >women and families of Gaza are praying for you. Only God can reward you)
column17:
>انزل للأسفل لقراءة الموضوع باللغة العربية
Think of Gaza and the people of Gaza.
column21:
>

Think of the poor, the student and the people with special needs.

How they exposed to war, blockade and injustice. The near and the far gave up Gaza but Gaza refused but to stay steadfast, patient and Initiative. Gaza returned back again full of hope with ""Gaza Relief Youth Team"" and the great international friends of Palestine.
column22:
>We need 6000$ monthly to save life in Gaza and create a healthy entrepreneur society !
Together we will make it happen!
column23:
>Participate in a five key extensive campaign.

1- 1000$ : distribute 50 necessary Food Parcels monthly to poor families.

(Milk, Bread, Vegetables, Canned foods)

2- 1000$ : distribute 100 Rechargeable LED Lights or other awards monthly to students.

3- 1000$ : distribute 20 shares of 50$ cash monthly to poor families in hands.

4- 1000$ : relief the most poor (1-3) families monthly! (Maintaining and buying necessary things for the house)

5- 2000$ : Support one or more of the following status:
A- Support student to register his/ her semester study. (almost 300$ per semester)
B- Support a needy medical condition (almost 300$ per status)
C-  Support the best chosen innovative idea/ideas (almost 300$ per project ) to encourage small enterprises mainly in Information Technology and Women issues.

By this we can help to:
1- eliminate poverty gap.
2- motivate students to study and get the highest scores.
3- encourage creative ideas and investment.
4- achieve social solidarity.


-----------------------------------------------------------
Current Outreach Story:
21/3/2015 - Gaza Strip/ Bureij Refugee Camp

 We of the Gaza Relief Youth Team, visited six families this Sunday living in a rickety old house in a non-residential area away from schools and health care centers. More than 30 individuals of the Annabahin extended  family suffer severe poverty and share a miserable life.

column1:
The Annabahin family, like many other families in Gaza strip were affected by wars and siege. We were shocked to hear that no other humanitarian foundations have checked their poor status which we think you'll agree is shameful.

Visit our Group for Updates: https://www.facebook.com/groups/812178572169153...

Let's Give Annabahin Family and Other Poor Gazans Hope

 We have made this campaign as the first of many. Our youth humanitarian association expects to make big changes in the lives of the Annabahin family and others of similar status. We're going to visit several other families near the Annabahins in the coming few days to help as much as possible. Our goal is to lessen the impact of poverty on war torn Gaza. Much of the oppression is economic. The poorest are always hit hardest by war.

We trust in the real love of Palestine from the international family, and we hope you will share our cause in all forums and social media. We appreciate anyone who can translate our posts to different languages so that we can reach different areas all around the world.<div>
<div style=""direction: rtl

مبادرة من الفريق الشبابي لإغاثة غزة نقدم من خلالها:
1- تخصيص 1000$ يتم من خلالها توزيع 100 سلة غذائية شهرياً للأسر المحتاجة.
2- تخصيص 1000$ يتم من خلالها توزيع 100 كشاف ضوئي يمكن شحنه في ظلل الأزمة الكارثية للكهرباء والتي تؤثر بشكل أساسي على الطلبة.
3- تخصيص 1000$ يتم من خلالها توزيع 20 حصة بقيمة 50$ تسلم باليد للأسر الفقيرة.
4- تخصيص 1000$ يتم من خلالها إغاثة مركزة لواحدة حتى ثلاث عائلات حيث يتم تقديم أعمال صيانة وتوفير أهم المستلزمات الأساسية للمنزل.
5- تخصيص 2000$ لدعم واحدة أو أكثر من الحالات الآتية:
أ. دعم تسجيل فصل دراسي للطالب الجامعي وذلك بتكلفة تصل 300$.
ب. دعم لإحدى العمليات الطبية الفقيرة بقيمة 300$.
ث. دعم أفضل فكرة ابداعية يتم اختيارها بقيمة 300$ والتي تركز بشكل أساسي على موضوع تكنولوجيا المعلومات وقضايا المرأة.

column2:
>بذلك نكون قد حققنا عدة انجازات ومنها:

column1:
About us:

Gaza
Relief - in Gaza with Mohammad Haniya
The
ongoing humanitarian crisis in Gaza has brought forth tremendous compassion
from many foreigners and international peace activists. You may have been touched
by the horrific conditions many Gazans endured during ""Operation
Protective Edge"" in the summer of 2014, and its winter aftermath.
The
1.8 million people of Gaza inhabit a 360 square-kilometer strip of land on the
Mediterranean sea, bordering with Egypt to the south, and sharing a 51
kilometer border with Israeli-controlled territory to the east and north.
That's over 5,000 people per square kilometer! Every life here counts.
These
are real people, many of whom are suffering from terrible injuries, loss of
family members, loss of dwellings and loss of income due to the recent
conflict. Gaza has been hit by a series of brutal wars going back for more than
a decade. Complicating matters is the ongoing Israeli occupation and siege.
The
question remains: how can you as a foreign peace activist help?
First,
we of Gaza Relief believe that the message of need in Gaza has still not been
expressed to the world. For diplomacy's sake, we want an opportunity to explain
our region's situation to the planet. Our main mission is to gather real
stories of suffering, and communicate those to the world beyond Palestine in
the English language. Also, delivery of charity has been inefficient and
chaotic due to many factors, including complex bureaucratic restrictions imposed
by the Israeli government. While the Israeli goal is to prevent resources from
getting to the active resistance, the result has been malnutrition,
hypothermia, and a deepening sense of hopelessness. We believe we are in an
ideal position to overcome both obstacles: we can fully express the need for
outside charity from a truly Gazan perspective, and we can also efficiently
connect sources of charity to where it is needed most.
We
are a new, fully-independent Palestinian group of energetic young adults who
specialize in English communication and multimedia production. We will never
give up because we ourselves are Palestinians: our commitment to Gaza is
strong. All of us live here in Gaza. We work on the ground, right where tragic
stories have gone untold for decades. We are documenting and telling those
stories now. We snap and scan photos, record audio narratives, and capture
high-quality video. We collect these stories to convey the changing conditions
in Gaza month by month in high-quality video productions and online archives
with English and Arabic annotations for historical purposes. We provide a means
for people to express their suffering to the outside world. For many Gazans,
simply having their stories told brings hope. In the aftermath of 2014, the
biggest fear is that their agony will be lost in time. Gaza Relief is also
geared up with social media to interact with you, to help you bring these
images and sounds into focus, and deliver Gazan stories with greater clarity.
Our
work is focused on poor families, children, women, and people with special
needs. As an organization our mission is non-political, secular, and
transparent.

","(Thanks for the donors. Children, women and families of Gaza are praying for you. Only God can reward you)انزل للأسفل لقراءة الموضوع باللغة العربيةThink of Gaza and the people of Gaza.Think of the poor, the student and the people with special needs.How they exposed to war, blockade and injustice. The near and the far gave up Gaza but Gaza refused but to stay steadfast, patient and Initiative. Gaza returned back again full of hope with ""Gaza Relief Youth Team"" and the great international friends of Palestine. We need 6000$ monthly to save life in Gaza and create a healthy entrepreneur society !Together we will make it happen!Participate in a five key extensive campaign.1- 1000$ : distribute 50 necessary Food Parcels monthly to poor families.(Milk, Bread, Vegetables, Canned foods)2- 1000$ : distribute 100 Rechargeable LED Lights or other awards monthly to students.3- 1000$ : distribute 20 shares of 50$ cash monthly to poor families in hands.4- 1000$ : relief the most poor (1-3) families monthly! (Maintaining and buying necessary things for the house)5- 2000$ : Support one or more of the following status:A- Support student to register his/ her semester study. (almost 300$ per semester)B- Support a needy medical condition (almost 300$ per status)C-  Support the best chosen innovative idea/ideas (almost 300$ per project ) to encourage small enterprises mainly in Information Technology and Women issues.By this we can help to:1- eliminate poverty gap.2- motivate students to study and get the highest scores.3- encourage creative ideas and investment.4- achieve social solidarity.-----------------------------------------------------------Current Outreach Story:21/3/2015 - Gaza Strip/ Bureij Refugee Camp  We of the Gaza Relief Youth Team, visited six families this Sunday living in a rickety old house in a non-residential area away from schools and health care centers. More than 30 individuals of the Annabahin extended  family suffer severe poverty and share a miserable life.

The Annabahin family, like many other families in Gaza strip were affected by wars and siege. We were shocked to hear that no other humanitarian foundations have checked their poor status which we think you'll agree is shameful.Visit our Group for Updates: https://www.facebook.com/groups/812178572169153...Let's Give Annabahin Family and Other Poor Gazans Hope We have made this campaign as the first of many. Our youth humanitarian association expects to make big changes in the lives of the Annabahin family and others of similar status. We're going to visit several other families near the Annabahins in the coming few days to help as much as possible. Our goal is to lessen the impact of poverty on war torn Gaza. Much of the oppression is economic. The poorest are always hit hardest by war.

We trust in the real love of Palestine from the international family, and we hope you will share our cause in all forums and social media. We appreciate anyone who can translate our posts to different languages so that we can reach different areas all around the world.

مبادرة من الفريق الشبابي لإغاثة غزة نقدم من خلالها:1- تخصيص 1000$ يتم من خلالها توزيع 100 سلة غذائية شهرياً للأسر المحتاجة.2- تخصيص 1000$ يتم من خلالها توزيع 100 كشاف ضوئي يمكن شحنه في ظلل الأزمة الكارثية للكهرباء والتي تؤثر بشكل أساسي على الطلبة.3- تخصيص 1000$ يتم من خلالها توزيع 20 حصة بقيمة 50$ تسلم باليد للأسر الفقيرة.4- تخصيص 1000$ يتم من خلالها إغاثة مركزة لواحدة حتى ثلاث عائلات حيث يتم تقديم أعمال صيانة وتوفير أهم المستلزمات الأساسية للمنزل.5- تخصيص 2000$ لدعم واحدة أو أكثر من الحالات الآتية:أ. دعم تسجيل فصل دراسي للطالب الجامعي وذلك بتكلفة تصل 300$.ب. دعم لإحدى العمليات الطبية الفقيرة بقيمة 300$.ث. دعم أفضل فكرة ابداعية يتم اختيارها بقيمة 300$ والتي تركز بشكل أساسي على موضوع تكنولوجيا المعلومات وقضايا المرأة.

بذلك نكون قد حققنا عدة انجازات ومنها:1- تقليل فجوة الفقر في غزة، من خلال دعم شهري متواصل للطبقة الفقيرة.2- دعم وتحفيز الطلبة للدراسة وتحقيق أعلى العلامات من خلال توفير بيئة مناسبة وتقديم الدعم.3- دعم الأفكار الابداعية والاستثمار في المشاريع الصغيرة.4- تحقيق التكافل الاجتماعي.
About us:Gaza
Relief - in Gaza with Mohammad Haniya
The
ongoing humanitarian crisis in Gaza has brought forth tremendous compassion
from many foreigners and international peace activists. You may have been touched
by the horrific conditions many Gazans endured during ""Operation
Protective Edge"" in the summer of 2014, and its winter aftermath.
The
1.8 million people of Gaza inhabit a 360 square-kilometer strip of land on the
Mediterranean sea, bordering with Egypt to the south, and sharing a 51
kilometer border with Israeli-controlled territory to the east and north.
That's over 5,000 people per square kilometer! Every life here counts.
These
are real people, many of whom are suffering from terrible injuries, loss of
family members, loss of dwellings and loss of income due to the recent
conflict. Gaza has been hit by a series of brutal wars going back for more than
a decade. Complicating matters is the ongoing Israeli occupation and siege.
The
question remains: how can you as a foreign peace activist help?
First,
we of Gaza Relief believe that the message of need in Gaza has still not been
expressed to the world. For diplomacy's sake, we want an opportunity to explain
our region's situation to the planet. Our main mission is to gather real
stories of suffering, and communicate those to the world beyond Palestine in
the English language. Also, delivery of charity has been inefficient and
chaotic due to many factors, including complex bureaucratic restrictions imposed
by the Israeli government. While the Israeli goal is to prevent resources from
getting to the active resistance, the result has been malnutrition,
hypothermia, and a deepening sense of hopelessness. We believe we are in an
ideal position to overcome both obstacles: we can fully express the need for
outside charity from a truly Gazan perspective, and we can also efficiently
connect sources of charity to where it is needed most.
We
are a new, fully-independent Palestinian group of energetic young adults who
specialize in English communication and multimedia production. We will never
give up because we ourselves are Palestinians: our commitment to Gaza is
strong. All of us live here in Gaza. We work on the ground, right where tragic
stories have gone untold for decades. We are documenting and telling those
stories now. We snap and scan photos, record audio narratives, and capture
high-quality video. We collect these stories to convey the changing conditions
in Gaza month by month in high-quality video productions and online archives
with English and Arabic annotations for historical purposes. We provide a means
for people to express their suffering to the outside world. For many Gazans,
simply having their stories told brings hope. In the aftermath of 2014, the
biggest fear is that their agony will be lost in time. Gaza Relief is also
geared up with social media to interact with you, to help you bring these
images and sounds into focus, and deliver Gazan stories with greater clarity.
Our
work is focused on poor families, children, women, and people with special
needs. As an organization our mission is non-political, secular, and
transparent.",1.0,0,"4 Campaigns
|","Gaza, Palestine, State of",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/gaza-relief-5-keys-campaign/pica

We are trying to raise enough money to rebuild the family home where Mark grew up and where he was hoping to raise his family. Mark and his four children 11,10, and 8 year old twins were helped by the Red Cross for the first couple of nights. Now with the help from the community he has some money for his first month's rent. Food and clothes were also donated,

We're looking to raise enough money to build a new home or to at least be able to secure a home for the family for one year .

Mark started his own business which was located at the family home, that business was also destroyed. In light of all this Mark is willing to make decals or lettering for any donations .

All options for decals and lettering will be posted along with updates.

Famille d’un père mono parental perd tout dans un feu.
Le 29 avril un feu a pris dans la maison de Mark Bonspille lui et ses 4 enfants se son trouvez sans abri.

Nous essayons de collecter des fonds pour rebâtir leur maison. La maison était où Mark a grandi et où il espérait élever ses enfants. Mark et ses enfants âgés de 11ans, 10 ans, et des jumeaux de 8 ans ont reçu de l’aide de la Croix-Rouge pour les premières nuits.

Avec l’aide de la communauté il a reçu des dons pour payez le premier mois de loyer, et pour faire des achats de nourriture et de vêtements pour sa famille.
Nous cherchons à réunir assez d’argents pour rebâtir une nouvelle maison ou pour sécuriser un logement pour un an.
Mark à lancer sa propre entreprise qui était situé dans la maison, L’entreprise a aussi été détruit par le feu.
Même avec la perte de son entreprise, Mark est prêt à faire des décalcomanies et des caractères pour les dons.

Toutes options pour les décalcomanies et les caractères seront affichés avec des mises à jour.

My story 


Hi! My name is Andre Nitu and I am studying fashion design at the best art high school in Romania. My dream is to go to the best fashion college in Milan.

I am here to ask you to help me fund myself and make my dream come true.

For every donation that I receive I will give a personalised gift from me. The descriptions and details are below.



My gift for you 


For everyone who helps me with less than 10 dollars I will write a personalised thank you note.
For the ones who fund me with over 10 dollars I will create a personalised Red Carpet outfit, for both women and men. You can send me a picture of you so I can figure out what would fit you the best, or just a simple description of your ideal outfit.




Thank you !


Thank you for your help and support !

Problem:

column5: >Get advice on the available world-wide programs that will help impact your life. We partner with universities, online educational systems, organizations and programs like Outward Bound, Habitat for Humanity, Peace Corps, and hundreds of other programs so that you can design a curriculum that fits your passions.

column1: • 2-Year Program (matriculating students in September, 2018): Our 2-Year program devotes Year 1 to self-discovery. We provide an intensive action-oriented year-long program that is academically rigorous that tests students with world-based experiences. Experiences include a two month long Outward Bound mountaineering course that help students build a sense of self-reliance, a six month service in the developing world that helps build a sense of humility and compassion for those less fortunate, and a final retreat period where students explore what direction they would like to take with their professional lives.

column3:
A:

To learn more about redefinEDU, read the answers to some of the most common questions prospective students and parents have:

""I’m about to apply to college but the truth is that I have no idea what I want to study. I question if I should go. How would redefinedEDU coaching help me? 

Going to college without any direction is a huge mistake. You'll end up wracking up a huge debt and just coast through your 4 years. By joining redeifinEDU you will help DISCOVER who you are and what direction you'd like to go in.
column11:
>""How expensive is the program?""

The program is less expensive than traditional college. We keep costs below $15,000 per year, not including travel costs. Costs are almost 1/4th the cost of some colleges when you factor in room and board.


""How do you keep your program academically rigorous?""
We leverage on site coaches/instructors and the vast amount of educational content that is available online through MOOCs and other online resources. As well, students keep a journal throughout the program. Students also are expected to write a significant research-based paper at the end of each year.

""What would a typical day with redefinEDU look like?""

column1: During the 6 month service section of Year 1 of RedefinEDU, you might be woken at 6am by a Bangladeshi rooster sitting on the window
ledge of your room. You rise quickly so that you have time to bathe in the
river before 7am breakfast. At 7:45am you and your team are heading up the dirt
path to the construction site. From 8am until lunch, you help lay the joists
for five new roofs for the Bangladeshi village. Lunch is a simple bowl of
rice and veggies grown by local farmers. After lunch and a short game of soccer
played with a coconut shell with your Bangladeshi co-workers, you work to help
install the wood burning stoves in each new home. At 5pm you head back to your
room to continue reading on southeast Asian history and complete your
mandatory journal entries for the day. You eat dinner with your Bangladeshi
family. The day ends in the town square where you meet to play guitar and sing
Bangladeshi folk songs with new friends.

Problem:The current college system seems broken, with students moving uninterestedly through their four year career only to take on thousands of dollars in student loan debt. It's no wonder that student unemployment and underemployment has doubled since 2000.  A large number of our college graduates are simply not prepared for the workplace. We need a better way to prepare our students for the world ahead of them. Idea:By using the world as our classroom, we have students engage in an action-oriented and project-based curriculum where they learn about themselves, their ambitions, and how they can find their place in the world.RedefinEDU provides coaching for college age students to help them discover the world-based and experiential  alternatives to college.We are working toward matriculating students in a 2-Year program in 2018.We have two programs:

Custom Program: Get advice on the available world-wide programs that will help impact your life. We partner with universities, online educational systems, organizations and programs like Outward Bound, Habitat for Humanity, Peace Corps, and hundreds of other programs so that you can design a curriculum that fits your passions.

2-Year Program (matriculating students in September, 2018): Our 2-Year program devotes Year 1 to self-discovery. We provide an intensive action-oriented year-long program that is academically rigorous that tests students with world-based experiences. Experiences include a two month long Outward Bound mountaineering course that help students build a sense of self-reliance, a six month service in the developing world that helps build a sense of humility and compassion for those less fortunate, and a final retreat period where students explore what direction they would like to take with their professional lives.

Short Summary

We are LearnItFrom and we are a group of passionate music fans and educators that want to change the experience of learning a new instrument. Search the internet for instructional videos and you will find no shortage of amateur tutorials. Now imagine being able to learn an instrument from the artists that write and play your favorite songs.

The videos will be available as part of a pay-what-you-can subscription service and all proceeds will go to fund music education initiatives through the Learn It From Foundation. The LIFF supports local charities, such as Tommorow's Future Sound in Oakland, California, that provide students in low-income neighborhoods with access to classes, instruments, and instructors to inspire them to learn and love music.

Artists will donate their time to star in the videos, where they will not only provide instruction, but also inspiration through stories about the songs and their journey to becoming musicians. Budding musicians can finally have a reliable source to learn music and learn what makes the greats great!

Invest in LearnItFrom and you not only show your commitment to improved music education, but also show artists that there is real interest for this kind of service. Money generated will go to build the video library at LearnItFrom.com as well as towards promotion for the site. 

What We Need &
1.We need money for recording equipment and website development.

Investments will go to build the video library at LearnItFrom.com as well as towards promotion for the site. The money that we receive in funding will go to professional videographers and developers to provide you with the highest quality on-line learning experience.
2.We need support from musicians to kick off the LIF service.
Your contributions will help us show artists that there is a demand for this service. People want a reliable online source for learning new songs and instruments from the artists that they love.

By contributing to Learn It From you are not just investing in music education, but investing in a movement for change in the musical world. You are making the process of learning an instrument more exciting and also connecting fans and artists in a shared passion for learning and playing.
If we don't make it to our 10,000 dollar goal, the funds we do generate will be invested into the making videos as we look for new means of funding.

The Impact

By contributing to Learn It From you are not just investing in music education, but investing in an engine for change in the musical world. You are making the process of learning an instrument more exciting and also connecting fans and artists in a shared passion for learning and playing.
Risks &
column2:
Challenges

We don't have any artists signed on to help us create these tutorials. We are going into this with the good faith that artists will see this as an opportunity to connect with their fans and make a real impact on the musicians of the future. We will not be able to afford to pay them for their time, but will instead travel to them to work with them during their down time - on the tour bus, at home, etc. - to make these videos for their fans.

column1:
Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't afford to contribute to the cause, let your friends know! Make a lot of noise about us on social media. Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, sign up for our newsletter.
Visit us at LearnItFrom.com to learn more or email us at LearnItFrom@gmail.com with your comments and suggestions.

Artists will donate their time to star in the videos, where they will not only provide instruction, but also inspiration through stories about the songs and their journey to becoming musicians. Budding musicians can finally have a reliable source to learn music and learn what makes the greats great!

Invest in LearnItFrom and you not only show your commitment to improved music education, but also show artists that there is real interest for this kind of service. Money generated will go to build the video library at LearnItFrom.com as well as towards promotion for the site.    What We Need & What You Get
1.We need money for recording equipment and website development.

Investments will go to build the video library at LearnItFrom.com as well as towards promotion for the site. The money that we receive in funding will go to professional videographers and developers to provide you with the highest quality on-line learning experience.
2.We need support from musicians to kick off the LIF service.
Your contributions will help us show artists that there is a demand for this service. People want a reliable online source for learning new songs and instruments from the artists that they love.

By contributing to Learn It From you are not just investing in music education, but investing in a movement for change in the musical world. You are making the process of learning an instrument more exciting and also connecting fans and artists in a shared passion for learning and playing.
If we don't make it to our 10,000 dollar goal, the funds we do generate will be invested into the making videos as we look for new means of funding.

The Impact By contributing to Learn It From you are not just investing in music education, but investing in an engine for change in the musical world. You are making the process of learning an instrument more exciting and also connecting fans and artists in a shared passion for learning and playing.

Risks & Challenges We don't have any artists signed on to help us create these tutorials. We are going into this with the good faith that artists will see this as an opportunity to connect with their fans and make a real impact on the musicians of the future. We will not be able to afford to pay them for their time, but will instead travel to them to work with them during their down time - on the tour bus, at home, etc. - to make these videos for their fans.

Other Ways You Can Help Even if you can't afford to contribute to the cause, let your friends know! Make a lot of noise about us on social media. Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter, sign up for our newsletter.
Visit us at LearnItFrom.com to learn more or email us at LearnItFrom@gmail.com with your comments and suggestions.",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Oakland, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/learn-it-from/pica

We are the founders of a start-up company called uwannadu (as in “what do YOU WANNA DO with your life?”) and we are helping people find their ideal career... and prepare for it.

When our founder Chris left the Navy, this was a huge struggle for him. Then when his kids faced the same problem, and his kids' friends, and even Chris's own coworkers, he realized this was a broader crisis that needed a solution.

Imagine if every American LOVED their job. We think, if they knew ALL their career options, they could.
   

How BIG is the problem?
These are scary numbers, but we are determined to fix this. So we built uwannadu.

","Who we are:
We are the founders of a start-up company called uwannadu (as in “what do YOU WANNA DO with your life?”) and we are helping people find their ideal career... and prepare for it.

When our founder Chris left the Navy, this was a huge struggle for him. Then when his kids faced the same problem, and his kids' friends, and even Chris's own coworkers, he realized this was a broader crisis that needed a solution.
Imagine if every American LOVED their job. We think, if they knew ALL their career options, they could.   How BIG is the problem?
These are scary numbers, but we are determined to fix this. So we built uwannadu.
The way young people like to learn:
Exploration:
Fun quiz quickly matches people to careers
Careers are searchable by title or industry
Discovery:
Multimedia profiles reveal career reality
Videos serve as virtual information interviews
Action:
College profiles highlight education opportunities
Company profiles illuminate corporate culture
Uwannadu’s magic is uniquely presenting rigorous career guidance with real world information. Career choice is personal and we empower people to make better decisions.
Who needs uwannadu?
This is a big problem. So we built an even bigger solution. Feedback from students, administrators and parents as been overwhelmingly positive.
But now we need your financial support.
How your money helps:
Your support will allow us to:

We built it, people love it, but the world is more diverse than we could possibly show on our own. We need your support to create video interviews of more careers to help more students. It’s that simple.

Taking someone from interests, to careers, to colleges, to companies, and finally to jobs, is a bold innovation. Your money will help us demonstrate to colleges and companies the wide-ranging benefits of uwannadu.
Uwannadu is free and desperately needed by millions, but without your support it may not exist.
What do YOU get out of this?
Students you care about living successful lives
Maybe a better career for yourself
Happier friends and colleagues
... and check out the perks

Share, share and share our campaign on social media!
Email your friends, family and work colleagues with the link to this page!
'LIKE' our Facebook page and our posts about the campaign!
Follow us on Twitter using the hashtag #uwannadu.
Talk to people about it! Word of mouth is the most powerful form of marketing.

Overview:
A
small, civic-minded, full-service violin shop called Top Notch Violins LLC
is raising money to benefit the children of Shaw Visual and Performing
Arts Elementary School. Currently the school has 140 string instruments in a
state of disrepair, only 60 are in marginally working condition and they need a
little help. 80 instruments are completely out of service, and every year 30+
students who want to learn are turned away from being able to do so, despite
the fact that many may have the talent and dedication to learn and to perform
excellently. With your help we can hit our goal and provide all children of
Shaw VPA Elementary access to strings education.
The Team:
Top
Notch Violins LLC specializes in sales and service of violins and other bowed
instruments, such as violas, cellos, and double-basses. We serve students,
teachers, symphonic performers, and others in the St. Louis community. Our
employees, including first class luthiers, have garnered a total of 58 years
experience in this industry. We are proud of our impeccable reputation and of
serving some of the finest school districts in the St. Louis region, including
Kirkwood, Webster Groves, Clayton, Lindbergh, Pattonville, Parkway, Alton, and
many more.
Top
Notch Violins LLC has joined forces with one of the largest instrument string
manufacturers in the world and a great American family company at the forefront
of product innovation for musicians, D'Addario. D'Addario
Orchestral has pledged to provide the strings for up to all 140 instruments if
we can hit our goal. If you are motivated to give these kids a chance, please
do.  With your help we can provide more children access to strings
education.
Shaw
Visual and Performing Arts Elementary School (Carolyn Kramkowski, Director of
Instrumental Music) has an award winning program (NAMM 2013, SupportMusic
Merit Award as part of the NAMM Foundation’s Best Communities for Music
Education Program) and a high level of student and parent interest in string
instruction. Their inventory is not in shape to offer the kind of education
that the instructors and the students are capable of, as nearly two-thirds of
the instruments are badly in need of repair.
We were on TV last night! Watch the Saint Louis local
FOX2 story about our shop and the campaign!

http://fox2now.com/2015/05/01/music-store-fundraiser-for-city-schools-music-program/

UPDATE 2!

<div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fembed%2FQhMr3Te8OOw%3Ffeature%3Doembed&amp

UPDATE 3!

Recently, we had some Channel 4 coverage of our fundraiser. Follow the link to find out more about the campaign.
http://www.kmov.com/story/29008179/news-4-schools-replacing-and-repairing-broken-instruments

More about the financial goal
used in 2 ways, the first being the replacement of an estimated 80 violins,
violas, cellos and basses and at a average price of $335.20 each which equals
$26,816.00. The second way is making more cost efficient repairs and adjustments
on the remaining 60, which we estimate will cost over $8000.00. The repairs
will include strings which are more expensive for bowed strings instruments.
Many of these instruments get played over 4 hours per day and require good
maintenance to keep them in working order for kids to learn.

Stretch Goal:

With your help, if we are fortunate enough to exceed our goal, the remainder will be used to
repair and replace instruments at other Saint Louis schools and programs:
Carr-Lane Middle School and Central VPA High School as well as Most Holy
Trinity Catholic schools in St. Louis.  We would also like to sponsor
need-based scholarships for able students.
Perks
Every donation of $20 or more comes with a special guest ticket
to our campaign concert party featuringThe Auset Music Project!
The date is still TBA, and we so very much look forward to seeing you
there!  Our featured “perk” at the $100 contribution level gets your name
label, as a donor and sponsor of musical education (we love you), in a repaired
or replacement instrument for the Shaw inventory. This is limited to the actual
number of instruments put in circulation there, so act fast! Check out our

perks at other levels, and give as generously as you can.

Dear Everyone,

A devastating 7.8 magnitude earthquake has hit our country. And in light of all of you who want to extend your hands for help by donating money, I am starting this fundraising campaign to help the people directly affected by the earthquake. The next few months are going to be important.


Short Summary
<span style=""font-size: 16px
column5: >From the time the earthquake hit till the time I am starting this campaign, I have visited several affected areas in and around Kathmandu. I have also collected stories which I will be sharing. The most need I see are for the aftermath of this earthquake which is  rebuilding and helping people recover from loss of property and loved ones. The fund collected will be used to distribute supplies to the people who are directly affected over a period of time. These will range from water, food, medicines, blankets. Also to list down everything would be a difficult task right now as help offered will also be need-based and subject to requirement.

column1: Several organisations have expressed interest to collaborate in order to form an alliance which is flexible enough to focus on need based situations depending on various circumstances. Therefore, I will be taking steps to work with them in order to make sure the raised fund reaches the people.

Part of the money will be used to donate supplies to people I meet and who are directly affected by the earthquake. Updates will also be provided through the Stories Of Nepal Facebook page and the website.
What We Need
<li>
<span style=""background-color: initial
column2: >Several organisations have expressed interest to collaborate in order to form an alliance which is flexible enough to focus on need based situations depending on various circumstances. Therefore, I will be taking steps to work with them in order to make sure the raised fund reaches the people.

column1: <li><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Part of the money will be used to donate supplies to people I meet and who are directly affected by the earthquake.

column1:
Transparency

The money will be directed to a local NGOs, organizations and relief agencies who can direct the funds in the most effective way. Updates will also be provided through the Stories Of Nepal Facebook page and the website. 
*Fees and services associated with the transaction will be deducted by Paypal &
<div>
Other Ways You Can Help

Help is also needed in all hospitals. Mostly for hand on demands including managing and transporting  patients, keeping the areas clean, distributing food,water and shelter materials. Blood donation is also one the most effective and important contribution you can make. Please don't wait for someone to ask for your help or direct you. You need to go looking and start helping. Do not donate to personal accounts.
About Stories Of Nepal

Stories of Nepal is a rapidly growing global community gaining popularity in social media with an online community of 110000+ followers . Stories of Nepal shares stories of an everyday Nepali from all walks of life. These are stories of sorrow, happiness, joy, inspirations, aspiration which are shared through the Stories of Nepal website Stories of Nepal the Facebook page Stories of Nepal. The stories also address a wide range of issues. But mostly Stories of Nepal advocates equality, freedom, tolerance, compassion and humanity. In a world where mainstream media is overwhelmed with political issues and entertainment, Stories of Nepal dwells on the Human, their struggles in context of being a Nepali. Stories of Nepal is also a strong initiative to make the world realize that it is not just the landscapes of Nepal that make her, but also her beautiful tireless people.

column1: We care about our producers, and we want to help in this time of need. This campaign is for the families who work at Kumbeshwar Technical School (KTS), located in the historic district of Patan in Katmandu and was severely damaged in the earthquake.
These contributions will be going to the hands of women and their families in Nepal to help them care for their children as they take the strength to get through this tragedy.

PhD Project

Hi! I am Julie Vanegas, PhD international Student at the Valencia University (UV) in Spain. Four years ago I started my life project: being student of a PhD in chemistry. Working with nanoparticles and nano-science was my dream since I started my studies. Now I am one of the best specialists in this field of knowledge.

Since I decided to get involved in the world of science and chemistry, I always wanted to be the best researcher and to be as the great women in history that had contributed a lot to the human development and progress. I want to obtain an International PhD degree, it will be a great honor and it is one of the goals in my life. To obtain the international degree I have to go to Otawwa, Canada. Maybe you can’t imagine all the important achievements that we can reach with my PhD project. As you know, chemistry contributes a lot to medicine, agriculture, engineering, industry, technology and many other areas of human development.

My project consists in detection of organic and inorganic substances in a specific environment. For example: We can add the ethyl alcohol we drink to the nanoparticles and if it has some kind of adulterant, in this case the methanol (which makes us blind if we drink it), the nanoparticles that I’ve created will detect this specific threat and we can prevent of getting blind. There are a lot of applications of my work and I will be so glad to contribute with all my experience and knowledge also if you are not related to this investigation area. Just ask me for more information.

If you contribute with my project, you will help also my country Colombia, which is a developing country, also you will help our planet and the humanity with the importance of science and research and you will obtain recognition for being part of the community of people who wants a better world.

Imagine more benefits! if you contribute with 10€ or more, I will mention you in my final doctoral thesis and you will be remembered by me and by all the readers of my project. Who knows will be the next Nobel Prize? of course my research will have recognition and your name will be there! :)
What we need and what you obtain
I only need to pay the flight tickets and the visa fees, because the other expenses are covered by a scholarship sponsored by my country of birth.

My research is always focused in human progress in many areas such as medicine (detection of chemical structures to find diseases) and you will obtain recognition for being a contributor in this field, also if you aren’t related to chemistry, you can be part of a meaningful project like mine!
The impact

I want to go to Canada to keep contributing with scientific research. All my work consists in nanoparticles based platforms for identification of chemical and biological agents, imagine a nano-sensor, which gives substantial benefits to biomedical and environmental science.

My project is valuable because sometimes we don’t know the positive impact of research as a great contribution to the world and humanity. I’m very glad of being part of the people that helps each other, and not only scientists can help, every person can help only if they want.

I have a Master in Sustainable Chemistry (obtained in 2012), I’m always looking after our planet’s interests, don’t cause damage and help with the environment. I’m always writing papers related to my investigation and if you want to know more about my work, don’t hesitate to contact me.
Risks and challenges
One risk will be an unexpected situation, imagine I would have to return to Spain and then go back to Colombia
column2: but don’t think about it, because I know that I will accomplish our project.

column1: As a Colombian woman, I am very perseverant and resilient. I’m always awake, looking for the best opportunities and thinking to contribute (as you) every time I’m able to. In life there will be always obstacles, but I see them as new opportunities to learn and be better each day.

Indiegogo is one of my options, (a friend of mine recommended it to me and now I love it!) but I am also looking for funding in many ways: for example I’ve organized a raffle, I’ve talked to my family and in my free time (because from 8am to 8 pm, I’m always at the laboratory researching) I work giving chemistry particular classes.
Other options to contribute

If you can't contribute economically, you can help me a lot sharing my campaign in all the social networks and also telling to your family, friends or your couple about our project. Let all the people know about our meaningful plan.

Thank you so much and I will be happy to know that you're interested in my project.

Regards,

Julie Vanegas

Since I decided to get involved in the world of science and chemistry, I always wanted to be the best researcher and to be as the great women in history that had contributed a lot to the human development and progress. I want to obtain an International PhD degree, it will be a great honor and it is one of the goals in my life. To obtain the international degree I have to go to Otawwa, Canada. Maybe you can’t imagine all the important achievements that we can reach with my PhD project. As you know, chemistry contributes a lot to medicine, agriculture, engineering, industry, technology and many other areas of human development.

My project consists in detection of organic and inorganic substances in a specific environment. For example: We can add the ethyl alcohol we drink to the nanoparticles and if it has some kind of adulterant, in this case the methanol (which makes us blind if we drink it), the nanoparticles that I’ve created will detect this specific threat and we can prevent of getting blind. There are a lot of applications of my work and I will be so glad to contribute with all my experience and knowledge also if you are not related to this investigation area. Just ask me for more information.

If you contribute with my project, you will help also my country Colombia, which is a developing country, also you will help our planet and the humanity with the importance of science and research and you will obtain recognition for being part of the community of people who wants a better world.

Imagine more benefits! if you contribute with 10€ or more, I will mention you in my final doctoral thesis and you will be remembered by me and by all the readers of my project. Who knows will be the next Nobel Prize? of course my research will have recognition and your name will be there! :)
What we need and what you obtain
I only need to pay the flight tickets and the visa fees, because the other expenses are covered by a scholarship sponsored by my country of birth.

My research is always focused in human progress in many areas such as medicine (detection of chemical structures to find diseases) and you will obtain recognition for being a contributor in this field, also if you aren’t related to chemistry, you can be part of a meaningful project like mine!
The impact

I want to go to Canada to keep contributing with scientific research. All my work consists in nanoparticles based platforms for identification of chemical and biological agents, imagine a nano-sensor, which gives substantial benefits to biomedical and environmental science.

My project is valuable because sometimes we don’t know the positive impact of research as a great contribution to the world and humanity. I’m very glad of being part of the people that helps each other, and not only scientists can help, every person can help only if they want.

I have a Master in Sustainable Chemistry (obtained in 2012), I’m always looking after our planet’s interests, don’t cause damage and help with the environment. I’m always writing papers related to my investigation and if you want to know more about my work, don’t hesitate to contact me.
Risks and challenges
One risk will be an unexpected situation, imagine I would have to return to Spain and then go back to Colombia
column2: but don’t think about it, because I know that I will accomplish our project.

column1: As a Colombian woman, I am very perseverant and resilient. I’m always awake, looking for the best opportunities and thinking to contribute (as you) every time I’m able to. In life there will be always obstacles, but I see them as new opportunities to learn and be better each day.

Indiegogo is one of my options, (a friend of mine recommended it to me and now I love it!) but I am also looking for funding in many ways: for example I’ve organized a raffle, I’ve talked to my family and in my free time (because from 8am to 8 pm, I’m always at the laboratory researching) I work giving chemistry particular classes.
Other options to contribute

If you can't contribute economically, you can help me a lot sharing my campaign in all the social networks and also telling to your family, friends or your couple about our project. Let all the people know about our meaningful plan.Thank you so much and I will be happy to know that you're interested in my project.Regards,Julie Vanegas",0.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Valencia, Spain",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/phd-project--2/pica

Qu’est-ce que Les Verriers St-Denis?

(English below)
Les Verriers est un espace
multidisciplinaire situé sur la rue Saint-Denis, en plein cœur du plateau
Mont-Royal. L’endroit est idéal pour les classes de yoga, les concerts de
musique acoustique, les vernissages et expositions, les conférences, les ateliers,
et plus encore!
Espace multidisciplinaire = collaborations!
Notre but est de
créer une communauté dans laquelle les collaborations entre artistes et

professionnels sont encouragées.

Quand
les Verriers St-Denis seront-ils ouverts au public?
Bien que nous ayons encore beaucoup de travail à
faire, l’espace est déjà ouvert! Plusieurs professeurs de yoga y enseignent déjà et nous avons présenté quelques concerts. Nous avons
l’intention d’ouvrir officiellement en juin!
<h3><b>Pourquoi
un espace comme Les Verriers est-il essentiel?
Les endroits communautaires ont tendance à
disparaître, souvent pour se voir remplacés par des chaînes de magasin. La
gentrification est aussi une avenue que nous souhaitons éviter en promouvant le
maintient du patrimoine du plateau Mont-Royal, en assurant la rentabilité de
l’espace, par la création d’un réseau de professionnels des arts, de la musique
et des professions en lien avec le bien-être et la santé globale. Cet espace a
pour vocation la collaboration, la communauté, les arts, la musique, le
mouvement et l’échange.
Qui sera aux commandes des Verriers?
Ce projet est l’idée de Gaël

Huard qui eut un coup de foudre pour l’espace et lieu. Violoncelliste et professeur de yoga, elle a auparavant travaillé plusieurs années en politique et en gestion de projet avant de trouver LE projet auquel dédier son expertise accumulée. Le propriétaire,
Boris Chasin, artiste du verre et musicien amateur, a généreusement donné la
chance à ce projet de prendre forme et vie. Il fait du verre dans son atelier depuis plus de 30 ans et il nous passe le flambeau pour
créer cet espace multidisciplinaire. Merci Boris!
Pourquoi sommes-nous à la recherche de fonds?
Nous visons l’autonomie financière, grâce à la
location de l’espace par un réseau de professionnels-elles. Les fonds demandés
visent à couvrir les dépenses initiales,
par exemple :
-
L’achat de chaises de
concert, objets servant à la pratique du yoga, etc
-
Designer de site web,
graphiste – cartes de visite, logo, horaires
-
Frais administratifs,
pour l’obtention de permis
-
Rénovations de taille
Nous avons aussi besoin de votre collaboration
financière pour payer le loyer du mois de mai, alors que nous travaillons sur
la réalisation du projet jusqu’à l’ouverture officielle au mois de juin.
Pourquoi voudriez-vous contribuer?
- Parce que vous croyez au soutient des arts, de la musique et du bien-être.
- Faire partie d’un projet qui
bénéficiera à toute la communauté montréalaise.
- Pour conserver le patrimoine
de la rue St-Denis et la vigueur du quartier.
- Savoir que, grâce à votre
support, cet endroit peut continuer à fleurir.
- Vous pourrez participer et
profiter des événements différents qui prendront place aux Verriers St-Denis!
- Si vous n’êtes toujours pas
convaincu, jetez donc un coup d’œil à la liste de bénéfices située à la droite
de l’écran. C’est une aubaine!
Impliquez-vous!
Il y a différentes façons de
s’impliquer dans le projet et toutes ne sont pas financières! Si vous
avez du matériel que vous aimeriez donner, nous apprécions toute l’aide que
nous pouvons recevoir.
• Patère
• Tapis
• Chaises pliantes
• Bibliothèque ou meuble de rangement
• Accessoires de yoga
Faites passer le mot!  Partagez notre projet
avec vos amis, votre famille et collègues et allez aimer notre page sur Facebook!
Si vous êtes un professionnel
et que vous êtes intéressé-es à utiliser notre espace sur une base régulière, occasionnelle

ou circonstancielle, nous vous prions de nous contacter par email : lesverriersstdenis@gmail.com

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
What is Les Verriers St-Denis?
Les Verriers is a multidisciplinary space located on St-Denis
in the heart of the Plateau Mont-Royal. The space is ideal for yoga classes,
acoustic concerts, art exhibitions, conferences, workshops, and more!
Multidisciplinary space = collaboration!
Our goal is to create a community in which collaboration will occur
between artists and other professionals.
When will Les Verriers St-Denis be open to the public?
Although we still have work to do, the space is already open.
Several yoga instructors are teaching yoga classes and we have already hosted a
couple of concerts. We are planning to have an official launch this June!
Why do we need Les Verriers?

Communal places like this are slowly disappearing as big corporations and chains are taking over the city, making spaces for art and community such as this one slowly disappear. We want to make sure that this beautiful and historical building will not be converted into just another condo and can become a beautiful place that you and any other members of the community can enjoy for years to come.
Who will run Les Verriers?
The project was conceived by cellist and yoga teacher Gael Huard,
who fell in love with the space on first sight. Supported by a background in
politics and project management, she is finally using her expertise towards a project
that she holds close to heart. The owner of the space, Boris Chasin, glass
artist and amateur bass player, has been creating art in his workshop for more than 30 years and is very generously giving us a chance to bring this project to life. Thank you Boris!
Why do we need the money?
Eventually our goal is for the project to become self-sufficient, through a
network of professionals renting the space, but in the meantime we need funds
for some one-time initial expenses such as:
- The purchase of chairs for concerts, yoga supplies, etc
- Website and graphic designer - printing costs (business cards, sign, schedules, etc)
- Administrative fees such as city permits
- Important Renovations
Additionally, we need funds to pay rent for the month of May while
we are building up the project before the official launch in June.
Why should you contribute?
- To be a part of a project that will benefit the whole community.
- Because you believe in the arts, music and well-being
- To save this amazing space from falling into the wrong hands and
being converted into yet another chain or condo.
- To know that because of your support, this amazing space can
continue to thrive.
- You will be able to participate in the diverse activities and events hosted at Les Verriers St-Denis for years to come!
- If you need more convincing, take a look at our list of perks to
the right of the page. There are some real great deals!
There are ways to get involved with our project other than
financially. If you have any base materials you would like to donate, we would
appreciate any help we can get.
<ul>
• Coat hanger
• Carpets
• Folding chairs
• Shoe racks
• Yoga accessories
Spread the word! Please
share
our campaign with your friends, family and colleagues and like our page on
Facebook
If you are a professional and are interested in using the
space on a regular or occasional basis, please get in touch with us at lesverriersstdenis@gmail.com

column2: >The Little Scallywagz are a fun-loving children's entertainment group, who have been delighting and captivating children and audiences with their interactive live stage performances. The Little Scallywagz shows are big on imagination and are filled with education, musical excitement and laughter, putting smiles on little faces and bringing joy to little hearts.

column1: In 2015 the Little Scallywagz have developed a brand new educational &
column2: musical television program 'The Little Scallywagz Playhouse' which will bring the shows characters Luke, Stacy, Alex, Freya and their adorable Little Scallywagz friends Cha-Cha and JJ the lovable life size dolls, into the homes of families and communities throughout.

column1: The Little Scallywagz Playhouse is a happy,
learning environment that is strong on its values of inclusiveness. Children
are encouraged to participate and explore their creativity and express their
own individuality.

column2: >The Little Scallywagz Playhouse is a visually

column1: stimulating and musically fun environment. It is designed and produced for the
media-literate learner, who enjoys following along and interacting either at
home with the family, school or care group. The target range for this show is
at one to six year olds, however, children and adults of all ages can get a
sense of enjoyment out of the formatting and arrangement of this show. The show
stimulates and invites the viewer to learn, grow and be active through its
exciting music, easy to follow dances and the entertaining individual show
segments.

column2: >Up until now we have tried to do it all alone, we

column1: have managed to build our own little filming studio in a garage, created
individual little rooms out of donated items and have had to use a whole lot of
imagination and improvisation. We have relied heavily on the kindness of our
families and people in the media industry that have continued to believe in us.
(Before)

column2: >We are humbled and grateful for all their

column1: volunteered time and effort in helping us produce the first 3 episodes so far,
we now have only 12 more to go to complete our first season - just  12  more episodes till we can take it to air
and put smiles on the kiddies faces. We had never thought of doing crowdfunding before as we believed that we were just little fish in a very big pond,
but our supporters have urged us to do this in hope that you will come on this
journey with us and help us grown and come to like and love us as much as they
do.
(After)

column2: >So we are kindly asking you all to please help us

column1: complete this first season of the Little Scallywagz Playhouse. Your
contributions no matter how big or small will help us immensely with the
production, promotion and the purchase of professional equipment that we need
to allow us to provide a good quality children's program that the children will
love and enjoy.
<div style=""text-align: justify
column2: >First and foremost we need you to

column1: believe in us and to know that we will work hard to complete the season with
your help in raising $8,000 to make the Little Scallywagz Playhouse TV series
available to children around the world. Your support will help us finish the episodes
needed to complete the season, buy much needed up-to-date production equipment and
assist in editing and production costs.
column2: >The purchase of the listed below equipment will be a valuable asset in helping us produce professional and quality episodes, in a much lesser time then what we are currently able to do.

column1: •  New camera lenses
•  Kessler Dolly
•  Boom Mic
•  More Light Boxes
With any production comes many added costs. The money raised will ensure that production keeps moving forward for the completion of the season.
•  Director
•  Camera Technicians
•  Audio
•  Editing
•  Studio Assistants
The Little Scallywagz Playhouse will provide an educational and
musical experience for children and families. It will help children learn, grow
and to explore the world around them using their imaginations in a colourful, vibrant and safe environment.
The Happy Kitchen

column2: >The segment has a main focus on health and nutrition. Children

column1: can learn from the fun creative recipes how to be healthy at home and how
important it is to eat nutritious food. This helps to build interest for the
viewer that healthy eating can be a fun and informative.
Imagination Time
segment encourages role play which is important to a child's learning and
development. It focuses on a child's cognitive, imaginative, creative,
emotional and social learning. It helps children to explore, experiment and understand
the world around them and allowing them to express their
ideas and feelings in a creative and imaginative way.
Storybook Corner
The educational value of this segment stimulates language
development, promotes confidence building, sound awareness, repetition, fun
with words, curiosity, memory and problem solving exercises.
Let's Sing and Dance.

column2: >Let's sing and dance is a fun and physical segment which

column1: encourages the viewer to be active. The music of this segment is produced with
a educational value on the importance of safety, healthiness, growth,
development, imagination and creativity. It encourages children to express
emotions, refine listening skills, learn new words and concepts and helps
improve balance, coordination and rhythm.
Musical Maestro's
children to explore a range of musical instruments. They can see how different instruments
make different sounds and how they come in all different shapes and sizes. it
encourages listening, introduces different cultures and the discovery of rhythm and sound.
Little Craft Attic
Little Craft
Attic is a fun creative environment helping children to open their minds and
express themselves. This segment focuses on fine motor skills,
promotes flexibility, listening and
memory skills, coordination, building cognitive skills and cultivates creativity.
Tic Toc Bear Clock
The simple,
fun but effective segment teaches children how to tell the time. Using large
numbers and hands on a friendly smiling bear clock.

column2: >We know and understand that not everyone can contribute

column1: financially 'but' would still like to help. So here's what you can do
share this Little Scallywagz crowd funding campaign with all your friends and business
associates on facebook, twitter, instagram, linkedin, email and 'hey' even by
word of mouth too. Give us a shout out
or tag us and we will gladly return the favour to you.
From all the Little Scallywagz we thank you for taking the time to read our campaign.
Keep smiling everyone,

","The Little Scallywagz are a fun-loving children's entertainment group, who have been delighting and captivating children and audiences with their interactive live stage performances. The Little Scallywagz shows are big on imagination and are filled with education, musical excitement and laughter, putting smiles on little faces and bringing joy to little hearts.

In 2015 the Little Scallywagz have developed a brand new educational & musical television program 'The Little Scallywagz Playhouse' which will bring the shows characters Luke, Stacy, Alex, Freya and their adorable Little Scallywagz friends Cha-Cha and JJ the lovable life size dolls, into the homes of families and communities throughout.
The Little Scallywagz Playhouse is a happy,
learning environment that is strong on its values of inclusiveness. Children
are encouraged to participate and explore their creativity and express their
own individuality.
The Little Scallywagz Playhouse is a visually
stimulating and musically fun environment. It is designed and produced for the
media-literate learner, who enjoys following along and interacting either at
home with the family, school or care group. The target range for this show is
at one to six year olds, however, children and adults of all ages can get a
sense of enjoyment out of the formatting and arrangement of this show. The show
stimulates and invites the viewer to learn, grow and be active through its
exciting music, easy to follow dances and the entertaining individual show
segments.
Up until now we have tried to do it all alone, we
have managed to build our own little filming studio in a garage, created
individual little rooms out of donated items and have had to use a whole lot of
imagination and improvisation. We have relied heavily on the kindness of our
families and people in the media industry that have continued to believe in us.
(Before)
We are humbled and grateful for all their
volunteered time and effort in helping us produce the first 3 episodes so far,
we now have only 12 more to go to complete our first season - just  12  more episodes till we can take it to air
and put smiles on the kiddies faces. We had never thought of doing crowdfunding before as we believed that we were just little fish in a very big pond,
but our supporters have urged us to do this in hope that you will come on this
journey with us and help us grown and come to like and love us as much as they
do.
(After)
So we are kindly asking you all to please help us
complete this first season of the Little Scallywagz Playhouse. Your
contributions no matter how big or small will help us immensely with the
production, promotion and the purchase of professional equipment that we need
to allow us to provide a good quality children's program that the children will
love and enjoy.
First and foremost we need you to
believe in us and to know that we will work hard to complete the season with
your help in raising $8,000 to make the Little Scallywagz Playhouse TV series
available to children around the world. Your support will help us finish the episodes
needed to complete the season, buy much needed up-to-date production equipment and

assist in editing and production costs. The purchase of the listed below equipment will be a valuable asset in helping us produce  professional and quality episodes, in a much lesser time then what we are currently able to do.
New camera lenses
Kessler Dolly
Boom Mic
More Light Boxes
With any production comes many added costs. The money raised will ensure that production keeps moving forward for the completion of the season.
Director
Camera Technicians
Audio
Editing
Studio Assistants
The Little Scallywagz Playhouse will provide an educational and
musical experience for children and families. It will help children learn, grow
and to explore the world around them using their imaginations in a colourful, vibrant and safe environment.
The Happy Kitchen
The segment has a main focus on health and nutrition. Children
can learn from the fun creative recipes how to be healthy at home and how
important it is to eat nutritious food. This helps to build interest for the
viewer that healthy eating can be a fun and informative.
Imagination Time
This
segment encourages role play which is important to a child's learning and
development. It focuses on a child's cognitive, imaginative, creative,
emotional and social learning. It helps children to explore, experiment and understand
the world around them and allowing them to express their
ideas and feelings in a creative and imaginative way.
Storybook Corner
The educational value of this segment stimulates language
development, promotes confidence building, sound awareness, repetition, fun
with words, curiosity, memory and problem solving exercises.
Let's Sing and Dance.
Let's sing and dance is a fun and physical segment which
encourages the viewer to be active. The music of this segment is produced with
a educational value on the importance of safety, healthiness, growth,
development, imagination and creativity. It encourages children to express
emotions, refine listening skills, learn new words and concepts and helps
improve balance, coordination and rhythm.
Musical Maestro's
This segment encourages
children to explore a range of musical instruments. They can see how different instruments
make different sounds and how they come in all different shapes and sizes. it
encourages listening, introduces different cultures and the discovery of rhythm and sound.
Little Craft Attic
Little Craft
Attic is a fun creative environment helping children to open their minds and
express themselves. This segment focuses on fine motor skills,
promotes flexibility, listening and
memory skills, coordination, building cognitive skills and cultivates creativity.
Tic Toc Bear Clock
The simple,
fun but effective segment teaches children how to tell the time. Using large
numbers and hands on a friendly smiling bear clock.
We know and understand that not everyone can contribute
financially 'but' would still like to help. So here's what you can do
share this Little Scallywagz crowd funding campaign with all your friends and business
associates on facebook, twitter, instagram, linkedin, email and 'hey' even by
word of mouth too. Give us a shout out
or tag us and we will gladly return the favour to you.
From all the Little Scallywagz we thank you for taking the time to read our campaign.
Keep smiling everyone,",15.0,1,"1 Campaign

","CAMPus Life....

column1: Check out our Campus Life & Camp Videos to see who we are and why we are so passionate about investing in students in the Stateline area! We believe that 'Today's Students are Tomorrow's Leaders!'

One way that we encourage growth in many of our students is by removing them from the ‘comfort of their own home’ and sending them for a week to a summer camp experience specifically designed to challenge and evolve them mentally, physically, socially, and spiritually.

This July, we are taking a team of leaders and students to North Bay, Maryland  to encounter an unforgettable week of mud wars, high ropes, food fights, messy games, small group sessions, and dynamic teaching that we truly believe will have a lasting impact on each student privileged to go.
We've Got a Need...Sow a Seed!

Help us take a team students and Campus Life leaders to Northbay, Maryland this July. The cost for food & Lodging per person is $434 for the entire week. After adding transportation costs, the total cost is $480 per person.  While we're helping our team take the initiative of their own fundraising efforts, we would still love the opportunity to bless those who could not otherwise go, with a scholarship. We are committed to the belief that financial burden should never keep anyone from a a life-changing experience! Today when you invest in a Camper, they benefit from an unforgettable experience and you can receive our fun perks!
You Can Reap Fun Things to Keep

More than ever before, teenagers are exposed to all kinds of influential behaviors and beliefs that are defining them on a daily basis. YFC Camp combines healthy relationships with creative programs and exciting adventures to help teens make good choices, establish a solid foundation for life and positively impact their schools and community. YFC Camp is a great opportunity for teens to step out of their comfort zone, make lasting friendships, hear transformational teaching-all while having the time of their lives!

...But we don't want our campers to have ALL the fun! After all, YOUR investments are helping transform their lives...the least we can do is offer a fun token of thanks to you!! Check out our fun perks packages and enjoy making a contribution to a great cause!
*****For every $10 you donate, you will be entered to win a Shopping Spree at the One and Only Rockford Art Deli!!!!!**** Ex: $50=5 Entries to win!

Other Ways You Can Help Just $5 and you will have our Thanks Forever! But we understand sometimes it's hard to even spare $5...but that doesn't mean you can't make an eternal difference!  Please SHARE our cause with your Friends & Family!

Please spread the word and Follow us on Facebook, Instagram & Twitter! Pray for our teams as we plan and prepare for this fantastic adventure!   Your Prayers Are Priceless & Your Investments Are Eternal!                                                                                                  -The Campus Life Team",0.0,0,"2 Campaigns

and boarding Mmanze

meager accommodation facilities, and consequently lost learning and teaching

opportunities.

living and educational conditions that will significantly impact the economic
and social development of the entire community
(Building
adequate and durable accommodation facilities will also provide after-hours space for
hosting complementary community business services that will in turn enhance

PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION
<b>This

project will function under MACERUDET’s jurisdiction.


A  Joint Coordinating Committee (JCC) will
be established at start of project to oversee its use of funding, other inputs,

and implementation (actual physical progress).

The
JCC will remain separate from MACERUDET to ensure strict transparency and authentic

utilization of funds.

The JCC will convene as needed to discuss and resolve project management plans,

overall physical progress and any arising issues.

JCC
members will be composed of 2 representatives from MCSS teaching body, 3 MACERUDET
officers, 2 representatives from Parents Association, and two student
representatives.
We will keep all donors up-to-date on project progress and completion via Indiegogo and other relevant media channels.

founded in 1987, against a backdrop Ugandan Bush War survivors mobilizing on
a self-help basis to rehabilitate, reconstruct and develop
a devastated nation
column2: has no established paid staff and implements

column1: priority programs and activities utilizing the services of both local and international
volunteers through an integrated holistic development approach with a high
community spirit and a lot of enthusiasm.
MACERUDET has over two decades of
welfare and self-help project work experience thanks to the contribution of a<b>
small group of professionals located in Masulita, Uganda.
A considerable part our project and community development work to date has been implemented as a result of community in-kind contributions.

MACERUDET projects and programs are vitally reliant on time, skills, resources and services of local, regional and international volunteers and donors, for teaching, caring, medical, fundraising, and development assignments and assistance.
International Volunteers are shown below.
Critical
necessity at present time is to provide an operational, conducive, and safe environment
for both students and teachers in the 10,000 strong Mmanze Community, of Masulita Sub County in Wakiso District, in order to

facilitate tangible teaching and learning progress.

MACERUDET's overall, long-term objectives is to restore, from grass-roots level, the
education system of our country that has been gravely damaged and deemphasized
due to two decades of civil conflict.
We wish to directly and swiftly address
key educational challenges, in our local area and beyond, of meager primary and
secondary school participation, scarce classroom/lab space and school materials,
insufficient funding, and poor quality school management.
Our organization is
committed to breaking cycle of poverty in Uganda through developing and
managing education, and other self-help and sustainability projects, starting
at rural community level. And, with the interest and support of communities such as Indiegogo, we can do it!
We kindly request that you get the word out about our campaign and overall organizational objectives, using Indiegogo share tools and other innovative means.
Thank you very much for your consideration of our work, our organization, and our community.

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a="""">In the past eight years, the practice of yoga has irrevocably altered each facet of my life. The practice fosters a sense of self-love, which opens a space for the compassionate love of others while offering a physical medium for self expression both as teacher and student. In turn, my life and passion are dedicated to sharing the practice of yoga - as well as health/physical fitness, generally - with everyone I encounter. Witnessing the transformations and growth in others - whether students, clients or yogis - makes my heart pound
column2: it draws me out of bed in the morning.<div>

column1: From August 10-September 5, 2015, I am pursuing my 250-hr Yoga Teacher Training through Evolation Yoga.  This 4-week immersion will add depth to my understanding of yoga from philosophy, to the art of teaching, to the study of postures and how to successfully connect with students. The immersion, which will be held in the D.C.-metropolitan area, is just that: the capacity is limited to 20 students, which allows each participant to receive individualized instruction, which translates to their respective teaching styles. For more than eight years, I have been both a practitioner and teacher of the yoga practice.  I am local to Harrisonburg, VA, and teach at three studios (check them out):
