Imagine being diagnosed with a serious illness as a child. Your entire life is turned upside down. You're poked and prodded, and everything you do is out of your control. You long for a return to some sort of normalcy, and cherish even brief moments of distraction and happiness.

My program gives pediatric patients that escape.  At each hospital I've visited, I've been invited to come back.  The kids, staff members and parents have raved about the impact I've had.

You can help bring some of those wonderful times to children who are fighting the most important battles they will ever face.

One very special story about my program was recently featured in a news segment by WNCN in Raleigh, North Carolina.  You can take a look at their report here: http://wncn.com/2015/08/04/nc-teen-seeking-tran...

My programs have already reached over 1,000 pediatric patients in hospitals and at camps - bringing fun, laughter and joy to kids who are truly struggling.

They get a feeling of true accomplishment and total joy as they create their own cartoon characters, and each child receives a free packet of art supplies so they can continue drawing long after I've gone home.

These gift packages contain non-toxic, latex-free pencils, crayons, colored pencils and drawing pads so that they are safe for children with compromised immune systems and allergies they develop due to their treatments.

Although I have been freely giving my time to take this wonderful experience to as many children as possible, I cannot do it alone. The costs of transportation, lodging and gifts can mount up quickly. And that's where you come in. Any contribution of any size will not only help me continue to do this, it will also help me transition the program from an individual effort to a non-profit that will bring similar programs to facilities treating these children all over the country. Perhaps even internationally!

Art heals.  Find that hard to believe? Check out the results of this study that was released by the National Institute of Health!  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23699646

YOU Can Help This Continue And Grow!

Professional artists, cartoonists and children's book authors have been asking me how they can get involved and do similar things at hospitals in their areas. I'd love to grow this into something truly unique, a program that supplements existing art programs while it also starts new ones in locations that don't currently have anything like this going on.

Turning it into a non-profit organization will allow me to seek larger grants and raise the necessary funds to enable others to share their special talents with these young patients. I'd love to be able to help defray their costs and provide all of them with free art packets to give away.

Who am I?  My name is Steve Barr, and I'm a professional cartoonist.  I'm also the author of quite a few ""How to Draw"" books.  I've taught thousands of children how to create their own cartoons at schools and libraries over the years, but I am now concentrating most of my efforts on making these programs available to pediatric patients (and their siblings), at no cost to them, their families or the facilities that are treating them.

Why are the art supplies and visits free?

Statistically, in the United States 50% of families who have a child diagnosed with cancer end up filing for bankruptcy.  That is a big part of why the free art supplies I give out play such an important role in all of this.  They help children be able to have a great time when their parents may not be able to afford extra things as their child is treated.

All supplies are brand new, latex-free and non-toxic.

What will your money be used for?
- To purchase and assemble more free art packages for the children.
- Help defray travel costs.
- Build free libraries of art activity books in hospitals and camps - not only my own books, but those of other authors as well.
- Cover some costs of living while I continue doing these programs and start to transition this into a national non-profit that will include other cartoonists, authors, illustrators and artists.

No Rules!

I always tell the kids that cartooning is an art form that has no rules.  By that, I mean that their cartoon can look any way they want it to.  Almost every cartoonist has a unique style, and I encourage each child to experiment and change things around.  Since there are no rules, they can draw any way they want to, and they can't do it wrong!

That allows them to completely relax, realize that it's okay to ""make mistakes"" and fix them.  It also frees them from control by anyone else around them (even me!), and that's something that doesn't happen often during their treatment.  They get to just be kids again, and be themselves.  They are in charge!

Look how excited this little one was when she got her gift pack!

She couldn't wait to rip open the packages and start drawing!  This is the kind of joy and excitement you can help spread.  Take a peek at the perks I'm offering, and choose a level that is comfortable for you.  Be a part of something awesome.  (I know that word seems over-used these days, but it truly does describe what's happening with this program.)


Check Out The Perks!

At the basic levels of contributions, you can receive an autographed copy of one of my books, or one with a quick cartoon and greeting on the inside of the cover.  You can keep it, have it signed to someone you'd like to give it to, or choose to have it personalized to donate to your local school, library or hospital.

And you can get a postcard with an original sketch on it.  You can keep it, frame it, color it or send it to someone with a personalized message on it.


At the higher levels, you can even get your own custom-designed cartoon character that you can use any way you like, because you'll own that image!  It's a great way to help out, and end up with a logo for your children's sports team, business, organization or just about any other use you can think of.

At the top level, you can work with me to set up a personal visit to any area in the Continental United States you choose.  We'll work together to arrange visits to schools, libraries or hospitals that you care about and would like to bring a little magic to.


Be A Part of the MAGIC!

Help me keep bringing this incredible program to groups of pediatric patients and to individual children with bedside visits when they can't attend the group gatherings.

I've even been known to pop into isolation rooms, dressed head-to-toe in protective gear and wearing a respirator to give special attention to youngsters with extraordinary complications.

For more information and a chance to read an amazing story about one of the miraculous impacts of this program, take a peek at this link: http://www.stevebarrcartoons.com/#!art-heals/c4nt

Together, we can build this into something that lasts long after I'm gone, and brings smiles to thousands and thousands of faces.

If you can't contribute right now, you can play a role by sharing the link to this campaign and letting other folks know about it.  Thank you for helping in any way that you can.  Let's DO this!


","Imagine being diagnosed with a serious illness as a child. Your entire life is turned upside down. You're poked and prodded, and everything you do is out of your control. You long for a return to some sort of normalcy, and cherish even brief moments of distraction and happiness.My program gives pediatric patients that escape.  At each hospital I've visited, I've been invited to come back.  The kids, staff members and parents have raved about the impact I've had.You can help bring some of those wonderful times to children who are fighting the most important battles they will ever face.One very special story about my program was recently featured in a news segment by WNCN in Raleigh, North Carolina.  You can take a look at their report here: http://wncn.com/2015/08/04/nc-teen-seeking-tran...My programs have already reached over 1,000 pediatric patients in hospitals and at camps - bringing fun, laughter and joy to kids who are truly struggling.They get a feeling of true accomplishment and total joy as they create their own cartoon characters, and each child receives a free packet of art supplies so they can continue drawing long after I've gone home.These gift packages contain non-toxic, latex-free pencils, crayons, colored pencils and drawing pads so that they are safe for children with compromised immune systems and allergies they develop due to their treatments.Although I have been freely giving my time to take this wonderful experience to as many children as possible, I cannot do it alone. The costs of transportation, lodging and gifts can mount up quickly. And that's where you come in. Any contribution of any size will not only help me continue to do this, it will also help me transition the program from an individual effort to a non-profit that will bring similar programs to facilities treating these children all over the country. Perhaps even internationally!Art heals.  Find that hard to believe? Check out the results of this study that was released by the National Institute of Health!  http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/pubmed/23699646YOU Can Help This Continue And Grow!Professional artists, cartoonists and children's book authors have been asking me how they can get involved and do similar things at hospitals in their areas. I'd love to grow this into something truly unique, a program that supplements existing art programs while it also starts new ones in locations that don't currently have anything like this going on.Turning it into a non-profit organization will allow me to seek larger grants and raise the necessary funds to enable others to share their special talents with these young patients. I'd love to be able to help defray their costs and provide all of them with free art packets to give away.Who am I?  My name is Steve Barr, and I'm a professional cartoonist.  I'm also the author of quite a few ""How to Draw"" books.  I've taught thousands of children how to create their own cartoons at schools and libraries over the years, but I am now concentrating most of my efforts on making these programs available to pediatric patients (and their siblings), at no cost to them, their families or the facilities that are treating them.Why are the art supplies and visits free?Statistically, in the United States 50% of families who have a child diagnosed with cancer end up filing for bankruptcy.  That is a big part of why the free art supplies I give out play such an important role in all of this.  They help children be able to have a great time when their parents may not be able to afford extra things as their child is treated.All supplies are brand new, latex-free and non-toxic.What will your money be used for?- To purchase and assemble more free art packages for the children.- Help defray travel costs.- Build free libraries of art activity books in hospitals and camps - not only my own books, but those of other authors as well.- Cover some costs of living while I continue doing these programs and start to transition this into a national non-profit that will include other cartoonists, authors, illustrators and artists.No Rules!I always tell the kids that cartooning is an art form that has no rules.  By that, I mean that their cartoon can look any way they want it to.  Almost every cartoonist has a unique style, and I encourage each child to experiment and change things around.  Since there are no rules, they can draw any way they want to, and they can't do it wrong!That allows them to completely relax, realize that it's okay to ""make mistakes"" and fix them.  It also frees them from control by anyone else around them (even me!), and that's something that doesn't happen often during their treatment.  They get to just be kids again, and be themselves.  They are in charge!Look how excited this little one was when she got her gift pack!She couldn't wait to rip open the packages and start drawing!  This is the kind of joy and excitement you can help spread.  Take a peek at the perks I'm offering, and choose a level that is comfortable for you.  Be a part of something awesome.  (I know that word seems over-used these days, but it truly does describe what's happening with this program.)Check Out The Perks!At the basic levels of contributions, you can receive an autographed copy of one of my books, or one with a quick cartoon and greeting on the inside of the cover.  You can keep it, have it signed to someone you'd like to give it to, or choose to have it personalized to donate to your local school, library or hospital.And you can get a postcard with an original sketch on it.  You can keep it, frame it, color it or send it to someone with a personalized message on it.At the higher levels, you can even get your own custom-designed cartoon character that you can use any way you like, because you'll own that image!  It's a great way to help out, and end up with a logo for your children's sports team, business, organization or just about any other use you can think of.At the top level, you can work with me to set up a personal visit to any area in the Continental United States you choose.  We'll work together to arrange visits to schools, libraries or hospitals that you care about and would like to bring a little magic to.Be A Part of the MAGIC!Help me keep bringing this incredible program to groups of pediatric patients and to individual children with bedside visits when they can't attend the group gatherings.I've even been known to pop into isolation rooms, dressed head-to-toe in protective gear and wearing a respirator to give special attention to youngsters with extraordinary complications.For more information and a chance to read an amazing story about one of the miraculous impacts of this program, take a peek at this link: http://www.stevebarrcartoons.com/#!art-heals/c4ntTogether, we can build this into something that lasts long after I'm gone, and brings smiles to thousands and thousands of faces.If you can't contribute right now, you can play a role by sharing the link to this campaign and letting other folks know about it.  Thank you for helping in any way that you can.  Let's DO this!",10.0,0,"1 Campaign
|","Columbus, United States",https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/cartoon-fun-for-kids-in-hospitals/pica

We are raising money to pay for the cash prizes for the Chess Festival participants (Chess Marathon and School of Chess National Cup) and the accommodations for the 4 Grand Masters who will be invited to the Chess Festival (GM John Paul Gomez, GM Oliver Barbosa, GM Darwin Laylo and GM Richard Bitoon).
column3:
/>



The Chess Festival is scheduled to happen on October 24-26, 2015 at the Robinsons Cybergate in Cebu, Philippines.

The Chess Festival is part of our mission to introduce Chess as part of the curriculum in the Philippines especially in Cebu City. Currently the only school that is part of the Chess in Schools project is Marie Ernestine School.
column7:
>VISION FOR THE CHESS SCHOOL

The vision of the Cebu School of Chess is to produce more Grand Masters. It has not produced a Grand Master yet but to produce a future Grand Master. Now we have a Candidate Master by the name of Jerish Velarde. We hope to produce more responsible individuals and future leaders of our society.
column8: >THE PERKS: Signed Chess Pieces from International Master Kim Steven Yap, Candidate Master Jerish Verlarde and Chess Prodigy Alphecca Gonzalez

Dear friends,
We are in the
21-century and yet many of our
children with learning difficulties are unjustly deprived from the
basic right of education.
There is an
existing big gap in the Middle East between mainstream schools and special needs
schools. This gap is the lack of existence of schools for children with
learning difficulties.
There are children
with mild to moderate learning difficulties who do not get accepted in
mainstream schools, and yet their impairment is not severe enough for them to
be in special needs schools, resulting in them being left behind or maybe being
home schooled.  And if some do get accepted in mainstream schools, they
struggle in these schools due to physical, behavioural, communication or
educational issues.  Such mainstream schools lack the proper educational
services and the know-how in dealing with these children.
Therefore, please
allow me to introduce to you Modern Alternative Education (MAE) center.
MAE’s aim is to
provide high quality education and specialized services to fill this gap
for children and young adults aged 8- 18 years old with a variety of moderate
to mild learning difficulties (Asperger’s syndrome, high / mid functioning
autism, ADD, PDD, hyperactivity etc.) by offering a high-standard and
quality alternative education in a safe and caring environment.
MAE is to be the
first non-profit center of its kind in the region.
and support is very much needed and appreciated to make this project a reality.
column2: >Please view our Sponsorship Packages and wishlist.

column1: no less than other children.  These are innocent children who did not want
and did not choose to be the way they are, and we owe them their right of

education!
We hope from you to spread the word and share this campaign as much as possible.

Childhood obesity is a national epidemic. Nearly 1 in 3 children (ages 2-19) in the United States is overweight or obese, putting them at risk for serious health problems.  In an effort to develop smart snacking habits for our students, Madrona PK-8 &
column2: Leschi Elementary are teaming together to raise money to fund a daily Fresh Fruit &amp
column3:
Vegetable snack program.   

Instead of low nutritive snacks, our students will be given fresh produce during school each day. This snack program has been proven to help with increased concentration and better learning in the classroom.  

This program costs $52/student for the entire school year. Leschi Elementary &
column4:
Madrona PK-8 are Title One schools meaning that more than 50% of our students qualify for free or reduced meals.  The cost of this program would be a burden for many of our families.  But, with your help, all of our students can enjoy the benefits of this initiative.

Our goal is to raise $35,000 to fund nearly 126,000 servings of fresh produce during the 2015/16 school year for all 700 Leschi Elementary &
column5:
Madrona PK-8 students.  We are hosting a cocktail Happy Hour on August 27th at Green Plate Special in Seattle, WA as a fundraiser to engage our community.  We want to supplement our campaign via indiegogo with your support.


","Childhood obesity is a national epidemic. Nearly 1 in 3 children (ages 2-19) in the United States is overweight or obese, putting them at risk for serious health problems.  In an effort to develop smart snacking habits for our students, Madrona PK-8 & Leschi Elementary are teaming together to raise money to fund a daily Fresh Fruit & Vegetable snack program.   Instead of low nutritive snacks, our students will be given fresh produce during school each day. This snack program has been proven to help with increased concentration and better learning in the classroom.  This program costs $52/student for the entire school year. Leschi Elementary & Madrona PK-8 are Title One schools meaning that more than 50% of our students qualify for free or reduced meals.  The cost of this program would be a burden for many of our families.  But, with your help, all of our students can enjoy the benefits of this initiative.Our goal is to raise $35,000 to fund nearly 126,000 servings of fresh produce during the 2015/16 school year for all 700 Leschi Elementary & Madrona PK-8 students.  We are hosting a cocktail Happy Hour on August 27th at Green Plate Special in Seattle, WA as a fundraiser to engage our community.  We want to supplement our campaign via indiegogo with your support.",0.0,0,"3 Campaigns

Our Cause
Following one’s passion can be all at once the most rewarding and the
most frustrating road to travel. This can be especially difficult when one is
told that what makes them come alive is not a “solid” or “marketable” career
path. This pursuit can oftentimes come at the cost of lost friendships,
discouraging words, and slim chances of future hire. However, the world’s
greatest thinkers, creators, and innovators had to break from the pack, and
follow their passions – resulting in products, experiences, and even locales
that we love.
Our passion for many years has been music and we know first hand the
burdens associated with this pursuit. Being a minority can complicate this
situation further. In fact, according to the NEA Office of Research and Analysis,
NORC at the University of Chicago, “Access to arts education for Blacks and
Hispanics is significantly lower than for White peers, and has been steadily
declining for three decades” (Rabkin &amp
Knowing this, we intend to do all that we can to encourage these students
that have a gift and a passion for the arts specifically. We seek to ensure
that all students have the opportunity to pursue their dreams and to develop
their skills with intentionality and for professional use. The Flossye J. Bass
Foundation for the Arts will award scholarships to students of color entering a
college, conservatory, or university with the aspirations to major in music and to ultimately pursue a career in
the arts
column2: Music, Theatre, Dance, and Visual Arts.

column1: The Effect
We believe that with the Flossye J. Bass Foundation’s support, students
of color will be able to achieve what they previously thought was unimaginable.
This support will most certainly have enriching effects on the world’s artistic
community, but it will also enhance the lives of those not in the artistic
world. Skills obtained through art education are long lasting and applicable in
many arenas. Studies show that teaching creativity develops critical thinking
skills, engages students, and fosters innovation.
Additionally, according to AmericansForTheArts.org, when supporting the
arts, other long lasting and far-reaching effects include:
<ul>
• Bringing together cultures regardless of race, ethnicity, religion, and age
• Improving student academic performance
• Strengthening the economy
• Supporting tourism and export industries
• Bringing about social impact
How Your Support will be Utilized
<div>
We want to maximize our impact within the musical community, so the vast
majority of your dollars will go directly towards the scholarships and into an
account where the funds will continually grow and be distributed on an annual
basis to scholarship applicants.
The 10% that is not going towards the scholarships will be used for
branding, marketing, development, and production of goods. We will not see or benefit from any of these funds personally.
Our Personal Commitment
We have
already committed to the mentoring and participating in the growth of students
in the arts within our community. We are also living our lives in such a way
that is a testimony to the fact that making a commitment to one’s artistic
passions is possible. Of the students in which we have had the opportunity to
touch, many of them have decided to pursue careers in the arts or have
aspirations to do so. We want to further our commitment to them and to the arts
in supporting their dreams and aspirations.
the state of Ohio and will gain federal 501(c)(3) status so that we will be
able to touch as many lives and dreams as possible (your donations are
currently not tax deductible). In this effort, we plan to scale our foundation
and expand into forming a community of mentoring, professional workshops, and
showcases among other programming.
regular (non-crowdfunding) fundraisers in the future to further develop and to
raise awareness in our community and beyond. Our first event is planned for December 2015.
Who Are We?
We are three brothers from Akron, OH who have been afforded amazing
opportunities because of our gift of music. On many occasions we have been
called upon to professionally share our gifts with countless others via
singing, composition, dance, instrumental prowess, and others. Because doors
have been opened for us to share our gifts, we never want other young people of
color to have to wonder “what if.” We want to do everything within our power to
see to it that others have every opportunity to pursue their passion
professionally as our grandmother, Flossye, could have.
Here is a photo of us on a recent Akron Symphony year-in-review poster

column2: >Durrell, the eldest is in pursuit of his BA in Music Composition (The

column1: University of Akron). Emmanuel has received his BS in International Business (The
University of Akron) and MEd in Leadership and Organizational Performance
(Vanderbilt University). Jaron, the youngest has received his BA in Music (The
University of Akron), MA in Vocal Pedagogy (The Ohio State University) and is a
Doctoral Candidate in Vocal Pedagogy (Shenandoah University).
<i><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column3: >of Durrell conducting the Akron Symphony playing his original composition.

column1:
Partner With Us TODAY!

We realize that monetary donations may be hard, but there are other ways that you can partner in this effort!

  • Your partnership is not limited to the options on the right. Please feel free to give as you are led!

• Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign in your circle and in your community - Connect with us via Facebook, Twitter, and Instagram!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools as much as you like to tell everyone!

Hey!

So where do i begin.. My name is Kirsha, i'm 23 and currently work with children at an indoor rollerskating center, my aspiration in life is to gain a successful career in social care as children s welfare is very important to me. I have a 2 year old boy who is my world, there is nothing I wouldn't do for my boy but that is not always the case for lots of children across Britain. 

I feel extremely passionate for the welfare of children and everybody no matter where they came from deserves the greatest chance in life, people I have met in care are genuine and often want to better themselves and so i'm facing my fear of heights and doing a 120ft catapult bungee to raise as much money as I can so that children all over the UK can have a better quality of life and every chance they can to succeed.

The Children's Society want and help create a society in which children and young people are valued, respected and most of all happy. Their workers are committed to helping vulnerable and disadvantaged young people, including safeguarding children in care and young runaways. Most importantly they give a voice to disabled children, help young refugees to rebuild their lives and provide relief for young carers. Through their campaigns and research they seek to influence policy and perceptions to improve child protection so all young people have a better chance in life away from any damaging influences.

Your donations will help the 3.7 million children living in poverty in the UK and help towards the research carried out which investigates the issues affecting children, your donation will help continue the vital work with vulnerable children.
ONLY £5 can give a young runaway a hot meal, shower and living essentials,
column5: >I would really like to present them with around £500 and I have a month to do so.. so please, give whatever you can.

column1: If you wan to know more or don't want to donate to my event you can simply click their website the children's society.org

column7: >Last of all thanks for reading, please share share share :)

<div>
a-ACADEMY Unlocks Education For Africa

column4: >Our vision is to enable every child in Africa to receive quality education and build a better future for themselves and their communities. In order to address the sad reality that still only 1 out of 3 children receive basic education, we have developed a-ACADEMY, an education platform that uses new technology to successfully share quality education and have a real impact.

column1: Our Goals for 2016

With your support we want to complete our set of quality interactive digital education content for all primary school subjects. We want to reach 500,000 children and train 20,000 teachers by supplying schools with a fully equipped a-ACADEMY, especially in slum areas.
How the Money Is Used

Every dollar you donate is going to be directly invested in content production and its large-scale distribution to schools and teacher training. We will cover all administrative costs and we will use all our technological expertise and our experience in publishing to make it happen. Together we can make a difference!
<h1 style=""text-align: left
column2: >a-ACADEMY: Specifically Designed to Meet Educational Needs in Africa

column1: a-ACADEMY has been created to work both online and offline so it adapts to the resources of all schools. It can also work on any device available in class, big or small, old or new. With just one device available the children can already have a life-changing learning experience.

column2: >a-ACADEMY is designed to solve the challenges that both teachers and students face, such as teacher shortage, teacher absenteeism and lack of learning materials. It helps teachers to structure their classes easily following the lesson plan provided. It also enables students to work independently with the extremely user-friendly software that takes them through a unique learning journey.

column1: All the content in a-ACADEMY has been created with the children and their context in mind and is packed with illustrations, videos and audios created locally. The content fulfills the educational needs of the children and creating such tailored content awarded us the endorsement of the Ministry of Education.
a-ACADEMY Virtual Tour

<div><span><div class=""campaignStoryVideoWrapper""><iframe class=""embedly-embed"" height=""326"" src=""https://cdn.embedly.com/widgets/media.html?src=https%3A%2F%2Fplayer.vimeo.com%2Fvideo%2F148193635&amp
a-ACADEMY Fills a Crucial Gap

Governments have equipped schools across Africa, including slum schools, with computers and the necessary technology but quality and locally-relevant content is just not available! This is a huge gap that a-ACADEMY can fill. With your donation, we will develop the needed content to provide quality education to every child in Africa.
Successful Pilot, Successful Impact Study

The actual impact our efforts have had so far has been measured scientifically to make sure that the money you donate will have the real proven impact we want in children’s lives. In order to measure this impact a pilot programme was conducted followed by an accurate Randomised Controlled Study. The results show that a-ACADEMY is making a huge difference! Children who use a-ACADEMY on a regular basis have significantly improved their test scores.
The pilot programme showed the following results:
<b style=""letter-spacing: 0px
100% of the children like using a-ACADEMY and would like to have all content taught using the platform.

column3: >                                                                                                             98% of the teachers would recommend using a-ACADEMY
column4: > to their colleagues and other schools.

column1: 97% of the teachers prefer to use a-ACADEMY over the traditional methods and want to use it on a regular basis.

column2: >The results observed during the pilot programme confirmed that we are on the right track and the results of the Randomised Control Trial (RCT) even exceeded our expectations.

>The RCT approach was selected as a known methodologically solid practice where subjects are divided into groups receiving the experimental treatment and control groups who don’t. All the students in the study were tested on Science at the same time before and after the experiment.

column1: Children using a-ACADEMY performed 23% better than those who did not use a-ACADEMY.

Children using a-ACADEMY scored 25% more than those who did not use a-ACADEMY in challenging and abstract concepts, such as fertilisation in human reproduction, which according to the teachers are difficult to master.

column2: >This experiment proves the real impact a-ACADEMY is having and offers a preview of the impact it could have once completed with all the necessary content.

column1: Peer-Reviewed and Approved

The study was managed by Dr. Martina Amoth specialised in education policy, leadership and curriculum development, and carried out in collaboration with Professor Ash Hartwell from the Center for International Education at the University of Massachusetts.

column4: >Prof. A. Hartwell has lived and worked in different African countries for 25 years and has a passion for teaching and learning processes. He has worked with prestigious organisations such as USAID, UNICEF, CARE and the WORLD BANK. Like us, he believes in the power of transformation of education in individuals and society and he is currently focused on learning in post-conflict situations, education policy and planning, and alternative forms of education.

column1: <blockquote><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >“Universal access to primary education is considered as a basic human right by many. Several international declarations have called for increased access to schooling spaces for children, especially those from marginalized communities. Currently, the international establishment of a full course of primary education is also seen as a call for literacy and learning as a basic and universal human right. This changes the focus from simple provision of schooling places to the presumed results of the enterprise: quality learning.""

column1: <blockquote><span style=""letter-spacing: 0px
<b style=""font-style: normal
column2: >-Prof. A. Hartwell, Center of International Education,  University of Massachusetts

column1: <blockquote><span style=""font-weight: normal
column2: >“Since 2008 I am collaborating with the Avallain founders and our shared concern for the individual learners beyond the science is what keeps us engaged in this challenging field.”

column1: <b><blockquote>
<b style=""letter-spacing: 0px
column2: >-Prof. John Traxler, Professor of Mobile Learning, University of Wolverhampton

column3:
/>

John Traxler is Professor of Mobile Learning - probably the world’s first - and a full UK professor, and Director of the Learning Lab at the University of Wolverhampton. He is a Founding Director of the International Association for Mobile Learning, Associate Editor of the International Journal of Mobile and Blended Learning and of Interactive Learning Environments. He is on the Editorial Board of Research in Learning Technology and IT in International Development, and Executive Committee Member of the USAID mEducation Alliance. He also works with the UNRWA and UNESCO on education strategy publications.

column1: Already Working in More Than 200 Schools Reaching 10,000 Children

So far, we have financed the assembly of a team of local and international teachers, editors, education experts and software specialists. With this capable team we have developed Science content for class 6 and English for classes 3 to 8, and we are ready for more! We have also managed to get a-ACADEMY up and running in more than 200 schools and we know for a fact that more than 10,000 children are already using it successfully.
Build a Better Future

With your help we can take this project to another level. Your donation will help us develop content for new subjects and new classes that will make it possible for children to achieve their dreams to become engineers, doctors or nurses. Investing in these children’s future is also an investment in peace everywhere. Through learning and sharing basic human rights we ensure peaceful and prosper relations for everyone.

About Avallain

We are specialised in Education Technology and Digital Publishing and our main goal is to achieve a positive impact on the human development that technology-enhanced education can provide. We create solutions that optimise the use of the Internet as a tool for inclusion rather than an accelerating agent of the digital divide.
With Avallain Africa we have set up a non-profit organisation that can improve the lives of those who need it the most.

From our headquarters in Switzerland we have achieved a local presence in Europe, the USA, Kenya, Australia, Mexico and Brazil and a growing network of integrators for Avallain to offer truly global solutions.

More than 15 million learners in Primary, Secondary, Higher Education, Language Learning, Literacy and Numeracy and Professional Training have learned using our systems on anything from CD-ROMs to Learning Platforms to tablet apps.
From the experience we have gained all over the world, we committed to investing our capacity in knowledge building and transfer in developing countries.
Steve Wozniak, co-founder of Apple, in discussion with Avallain co-founder Ignatz Heinz.

column1: <h1><span style=""font-size: 36px
<div>
Are you non-profit?
column2: >Yes. Avallain Africa as a registered entity in Kenya has formally declared non-profit objectives in the official acts. Avallain in Switzerland has a clear corporate social responsibility program that keeps Avallain Africa’s efforts sustainable through direct financing and technology and IP contributions.

column1: Why are you not verified non-profit by Indiegogo?
column2: >Because we are not a USA-based 501 entity. Indiegogo currently can only verify USA-based entities. However, Avallain Africa as a registered entity in Kenya has formally declared non-profit objectives in the official acts.

column1: Why a fundraising goal of 500,000 USD?
column2: >Our team determined that a budget of $500,000 is necessary to achieve our first goals which are: developing interactive and quality locally-relevant content for all subjects, reach 500,000 children and train 20,000 teachers. We have made our budget transparent for you, please scroll up to “HOW THE MONEY IS USED”.

column1: This is really just the first step! The more we raise, the more we can do. Help us to raise 10 times as much to provide several millions of children with access to education.
Why flexible funding?
column2: >Our goal with this campaign is to develop content for all the outstanding subjects and we are determined to make it happen. Any contribution we get through this campaign will take us closer to our objective. Even if we don’t reach our $500,000, any amount we raise will be invested directly in developing as much content as the collected donations will allow and making sure it reaches the children and teachers that need it. We know the huge difference smaller amounts of content can still make and not reaching $500,000 will not stop us from making it happen.

column1: How do we know this campaign will be successful?
column2: >We have already developed highly-interactive content for the subjects Science and English and provided more than 10,000 children with access to quality and locally-relevant education. The content development processes are established, and the team can start as soon as the first contribution comes in. The effectiveness of a-ACADEMY’s educational design has been demonstrated by an RCT-based impact study. Please scroll up to “Successful Pilot, Successful Impact Study” to see it.

column1: How much money from the crowdfunding actually goes to the campaign?
column2: >With the exception of the Indiegogo/FirstGiving fees, every dollar goes directly towards the campaign, Avallain finances the rest.

column1: Can I donate from outside the USA?
column2: >Absolutely, you can donate from anywhere in the world!

a-ACADEMY Unlocks Education For Africa

Our vision is to enable every child in Africa to receive quality education and build a better future for themselves and their communities. In order to address the sad reality that still only 1 out of 3 children receive basic education, we have developed a-ACADEMY, an education platform that uses new technology to successfully share quality education and have a real impact.
Our Goals for 2016

With your support we want to complete our set of quality interactive digital education content for all primary school subjects. We want to reach 500,000 children and train 20,000 teachers by supplying schools with a fully equipped a-ACADEMY, especially in slum areas.
How the Money Is Used

Every dollar you donate is going to be directly invested in content production and its large-scale distribution to schools and teacher training. We will cover all administrative costs and we will use all our technological expertise and our experience in publishing to make it happen. Together we can make a difference!
a-ACADEMY: Specifically Designed to Meet Educational Needs in Africa

a-ACADEMY has been created to work both online and offline so it adapts to the resources of all schools. It can also work on any device available in class, big or small, old or new. With just one device available the children can already have a life-changing learning experience.

a-ACADEMY is designed to solve the challenges that both teachers and students face, such as teacher shortage, teacher absenteeism and lack of learning materials. It helps teachers to structure their classes easily following the lesson plan provided. It also enables students to work independently with the extremely user-friendly software that takes them through a unique learning journey.

All the content in a-ACADEMY has been created with the children and their context in mind and is packed with illustrations, videos and audios created locally. The content fulfills the educational needs of the children and creating such tailored content awarded us the endorsement of the Ministry of Education.
a-ACADEMY Virtual Tour
a-ACADEMY Fills a Crucial Gap

Governments have equipped schools across Africa, including slum schools, with computers and the necessary technology but quality and locally-relevant content is just not available! This is a huge gap that a-ACADEMY can fill. With your donation, we will develop the needed content to provide quality education to every child in Africa.
Successful Pilot, Successful Impact Study

The actual impact our efforts have had so far has been measured scientifically to make sure that the money you donate will have the real proven impact we want in children’s lives. In order to measure this impact a pilot programme was conducted followed by an accurate Randomised Controlled Study. The results show that a-ACADEMY is making a huge difference! Children who use a-ACADEMY on a regular basis have significantly improved their test scores.
The pilot programme showed the following results:
100% of the children like using a-ACADEMY and would like to have all content taught using the platform.
98% of the teachers would recommend using a-ACADEMY to their colleagues and other schools.
97% of the teachers prefer to use a-ACADEMY over the traditional methods and want to use it on a regular basis.
The results observed during the pilot programme confirmed that we are on the right track and the results of the Randomised Control Trial (RCT) even exceeded our expectations.

The RCT approach was selected as a known methodologically solid practice where subjects are divided into groups receiving the experimental treatment and control groups who don’t. All the students in the study were tested on Science at the same time before and after the experiment.
The RCT impact study showed the following results:
Poor and vulnerable children using a-ACADEMY in underserved schools with poor infrastructure and high teacher turnover scored 14% more than those who do not use a-ACADEMY.
Children using a-ACADEMY performed 23% better than those who did not use a-ACADEMY.

Children using a-ACADEMY scored 25% more than those who did not use a-ACADEMY in challenging and abstract concepts, such as fertilisation in human reproduction, which according to the teachers are difficult to master.
This experiment proves the real impact a-ACADEMY is having and offers a preview of the impact it could have once completed with all the necessary content.
Peer-Reviewed and Approved

The study was managed by Dr. Martina Amoth specialised in education policy, leadership and curriculum development, and carried out in collaboration with Professor Ash Hartwell from the Center for International Education at the University of Massachusetts.

Prof. A. Hartwell has lived and worked in different African countries for 25 years and has a passion for teaching and learning processes. He has worked with prestigious organisations such as USAID, UNICEF, CARE and the WORLD BANK. Like us, he believes in the power of transformation of education in individuals and society and he is currently focused on learning in post-conflict situations, education policy and planning, and alternative forms of education.

“Universal access to primary education is considered as a basic human right by many. Several international declarations have called for increased access to schooling spaces for children, especially those from marginalized communities. Currently, the international establishment of a full course of primary education is also seen as a call for literacy and learning as a basic and universal human right. This changes the focus from simple provision of schooling places to the presumed results of the enterprise: quality learning.""
-Prof. A. Hartwell, Center of International Education,  University of Massachusetts
“Since 2008 I am collaborating with the Avallain founders and our shared concern for the individual learners beyond the science is what keeps us engaged in this challenging field.”
-Prof. John Traxler, Professor of Mobile Learning, University of Wolverhampton

John Traxler is Professor of Mobile Learning - probably the world’s first - and a full UK professor, and Director of the Learning Lab at the University of Wolverhampton. He is a Founding Director of the International Association for Mobile Learning, Associate Editor of the International Journal of Mobile and Blended Learning and of Interactive Learning Environments. He is on the Editorial Board of Research in Learning Technology and IT in International Development, and Executive Committee Member of the USAID mEducation Alliance. He also works with the UNRWA and UNESCO on education strategy publications.
Already Working in More Than 200 Schools Reaching 10,000 Children

So far, we have financed the assembly of a team of local and international teachers, editors, education experts and software specialists. With this capable team we have developed Science content for class 6 and English for classes 3 to 8, and we are ready for more! We have also managed to get a-ACADEMY up and running in more than 200 schools and we know for a fact that more than 10,000 children are already using it successfully.
Build a Better Future

With your help we can take this project to another level. Your donation will help us develop content for new subjects and new classes that will make it possible for children to achieve their dreams to become engineers, doctors or nurses. Investing in these children’s future is also an investment in peace everywhere. Through learning and sharing basic human rights we ensure peaceful and prosper relations for everyone.

Executive Team Member

Trip to Nairobi - We will fly you and a guest to Nairobi, Kenya’s proud capital and Africa’s most vibrant city for a once-in-a-lifetime trip! After our local team has given you a cordial welcome and provided you with culinary local delicacies, they will accompany you for a field trip to visit a school to meet a-ACADEMY’s users. Experience the impact of a-ACADEMY and your contribution live! Travel and accommodation included (4 days).
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Are you non-profit?                                                                                                      Yes. Avallain Africa as a registered entity in Kenya has formally declared non-profit objectives in the official acts. Avallain in Switzerland has a clear corporate social responsibility program that keeps Avallain Africa’s efforts sustainable through direct financing and technology and IP contributions.

Why are you not verified non-profit by Indiegogo?                                         Because we are not a USA-based 501 entity. Indiegogo currently can only verify USA-based entities. However, Avallain Africa as a registered entity in Kenya has formally declared non-profit objectives in the official acts.

Why a fundraising goal of 500,000 USD?                                                                Our team determined that a budget of $500,000 is necessary to achieve our first goals which are: developing interactive and quality locally-relevant content for all subjects, reach 500,000 children and train 20,000 teachers. We have made our budget transparent for you, please scroll up to “HOW THE MONEY IS USED”.
This is really just the first step! The more we raise, the more we can do. Help us to raise 10 times as much to provide several millions of children with access to education.

Why flexible funding?                                                                                                   Our goal with this campaign is to develop content for all the outstanding subjects and we are determined to make it happen. Any contribution we get through this campaign will take us closer to our objective. Even if we don’t reach our $500,000, any amount we raise will be invested directly in developing as much content as the collected donations will allow and making sure it reaches the children and teachers that need it. We know the huge difference smaller amounts of content can still make and not reaching $500,000 will not stop us from making it happen.

How do we know this campaign will be successful?                                                 We have already developed highly-interactive content for the subjects Science and English and provided more than 10,000 children with access to quality and locally-relevant education. The content development processes are established, and the team can start as soon as the first contribution comes in. The effectiveness of a-ACADEMY’s educational design has been demonstrated by an RCT-based impact study. Please scroll up to “Successful Pilot, Successful Impact Study” to see it.

How much money from the crowdfunding actually goes to the campaign?   With the exception of the Indiegogo/FirstGiving fees, every dollar goes directly towards the campaign, Avallain finances the rest.
Can I donate from outside the USA?                                                            Absolutely, you can donate from anywhere in the world!
I'm living in Africa and don't have a credit card – Can I donate via M-Pesa?
Step 1: Select Lipa na M-PESA on M-PESA menu
Step 2: Select Pay Bill, then enter business no. 590858
Step 3: Enter account no. EDUCATION, then enter an amount
Step 4: Enter your M-PESA PIN, confirm and send
When will my perks be delivered?                                                                              We estimate to ship 2 weeks after receiving your donation.
If you have selected the PATRON and ADVENTURER package we will get in touch with you to schedule your adventure as soon as possible.
Is shipping included in the perks?                                                                              Yes.

I am a celebrity or public figure and would like to endorse your campaign or help in some other way. How do I get in touch with you?                                Please email Ursula Suter, our Co-Founder, at africa@avallain.com who will be thrilled to discuss this further with you.",30.0,3,"1 Campaign

0,"<div class=""routerContentStory-storyBody"" data-v-1df7bf5a=""""><div>My name is
Joby and I am a graduate of Temple University where I majored in Geography and
Urban Studies. I have always been passionate about helping less fortunate
individuals. My studies at Temple were focused on helping to alleviate the
socioeconomic problems urban communities face. I am especially interested in
serving urban youth in at risk communities by providing the responsible role
models, hobbies and guidance they require for healthy development. I work at
One Day at a Time, a nonprofit dedicated to serving low income and homeless individuals
suffering from substance addiction and HIV/AIDS in Philadelphia. Additionally,
ODAAT is working to develop programs for youth to promote antiviolence in the
city’s communities. For the last ten years, I have been riding BMX bikes in my
free time. I have watched BMX open doors for many of my friends, giving them
something to be passionate about and affording them the ability to travel,
learn about new cultures and get away from many of the negative influences they
grew up around.
Philadelphia’s
youth have long been affected by, and subsequently become involved in, the
violence going on in the neighborhoods and communities they live in. Getting
kids off the street corners and onto BMX bikes will allow them to focus their
interests, energy, and passion on an outlet that can have numerous positive
influences in their lives. We want to see youth develop into the smart,
hardworking, healthy individuals they should be. I have already received
overwhelming interest and support from the kids and parents I regularly come
into contact with when riding in some of the roughest neighborhoods of
Philadelphia. Many of these communities do not have the satisfactory resources
to ensure positive youth development. Opening up kids to a great new hobby that
they can cultivate a passion for could help to move kids away from the drug and
gun cultures ruining our city by promoting an exciting sport and new outlook on
life.
Contributors
who donate to The Philadelphia Urban Youth BMX BikeLife Program will help to
get Philadelphia’s youth involved in a constructive program promoting safer
communities. Philadelphia’s youth have long been affected by, and subsequently
become involved in, the violence going on in the neighborhoods and communities
they live in. Getting kids off the street corners and onto BMX bikes will allow
them to focus their interests, energy, and passion on an outlet that can have
numerous positive influences on their lives.
At the program’s inception, it will be similar to
a summer camp. Ultimately, I would like it to be adapted to an after school
program operating year round. As an afterschool camp, the program will be incentivized
with good performance and behavior in the class room week to week. By
establishing goals and benchmarks for youth to work towards in the class room, the
program will ideally offer participants prizes such as BMX stickers, DVDs, and
T-shirts. Those who are enrolled in the program and do not meet the behavioral
and performance requirements will not be allowed to participate until they have
addressed the issues. The top two students who exhibit the best performance or
improvement throughout the program will be able to take home their very own BMX
bike.
We have set
out to reach a $10,000 fundraising goal to support the program. The majority of
the funding, 60%-70%, would be used to supply the program and youth with BMX
bikes. Materials for ramps and other pre-fabricated obstacles, such as grind
rails and boxes, would make up the next largest percentage of the funding,
using 20%. Helmets and safety equipment would account for another 10%-15% of
the funding that is raised. Any left over funding would be used to supply the
program’s participants with T-shirts from BMX companies.
If
we do not reach our entire financial goal, we will still be using all of the funds for
the BMX program. Not meeting our goal would simply mean that we would need to
scale down the initial startup size of this program.
Making a
donation to this project will help get kids off the streets and involved in a
constructive hobby led by responsible role models. Contributions will help to provide
the program with BMX bikes, safety equipment, program shirts, ramps and
materials, and prizes for the kids. This program will also address the issue of
absent fathers in urban demographics, providing youth with responsible male
role models. Getting Philadelphia’s youth to put down the guns and pick up a
bike will have long lasting effects on our communities. Promoting anti violence
initiatives and exposing kids to a hobby they can develop a passion for will ultimately
result in safer communities.
One
challenge for this program would be acquiring the facilities, parks, and spaces
to run the program. Compared to other cities, Philadelphia is behind in terms
of the number of public skate parks where riders initially pick up the sport and
then hone their skills. But, the city’s unique architecture and urban landscape
actually make up for this shortage of official skate parks.
By using Philadelphia’s
existing built environment, which offers riders public spaces and parks that
house countless obstacles for kids to develop BMX skill sets on, we can overcome
the challenge of not having an officially designated space. Every corner of the
city offers parks and playgrounds that provide BMX riders the embankments,
ramps, rails, ledges and stairs we use to learn and perform our tricks. By using
Philadelphia’s existing public spaces, and not requiring that facilities be
built specifically for the purpose of this program, we are utilizing tools and
space the city possess to teach a new generation an exciting hobby. Using these
existing public spaces makes the program financially feasible by cutting out one
of the most significant costs, purchasing land and building a facility. After the
program has achieved satisfactory success and our communities have been made
safer, the city will see the clear benefits of building more skate parks and
BMX plazas for youth to develop their skill sets in a safe, designated space.
If you do
not have the means to contribute to the Philadelphia Urban Youth BMX BikeLife
Program, please share our fundraising campaign with your network. We need all
the help we can get in our quest to make Philadelphia’s neighborhoods safer and
give our youth a constructive hobby to become passionate about. Enough is
enough, help us to get youth to put down the guns and pick up a bike. Keep our
kids and streets safe!

column8: >Your Mission, Should You Choose to Accept It...
column10:
>Be a Champion of Compassion!

""It has been discovered that a powerful antidote exists that can counteract the hate, hurt, and negativity that plagues our global community. This highly potent antidote is called “compassion,” and it exists within you.""
column12:
>What are the Compassion Games: Survival of the Kindest?

Compassion Games: Survival of the Kindest offers fun and creative ways to ignite and catalyze compassionate action in communities around the world. The Games amplify what is already working and inspires new ways to care for ourselves, each other, and the Earth. In the Compassion Games, competition becomes coopetition as we challenge one another to strive together to make our planet a kinder, safer, and better place to live!

Compassion Games is a non-profit initiative that organizes an annual, international compassion coopetition that brings together players and teams who challenge each other to inspire compassionate action during the 11 Days of Global Unity (9/11 - 9/21). This year’s special focus was to support military families and first responders in partnership with 9/11 Day, Service for Peace, and the Corporation for National Community Service.  9/11 Day is the largest annual day of community service and engagement in the United States. The goal of this partnership is to keep alive the spirit of unity and compassion that arose in the immediate aftermath of the 9/11 attacks.

The Compassion Games also support coopetitions and acts of compassion that take place throughout the year. The next Compassion Games event will be the annual ""Back to School"" coopetition beginning on December 1st (now known as Giving Tuesday) and ending on December 11th (the day of the last Apollo moon landing). The Games infuse the power of playfulness and compassion with the fun of friendly competition, offering a unique way to address the challenges of our time by actively living into a positive vision of our future!

To date, players of the Compassion Games have served over 1 million people in 34 countries by more than 200,000 volunteer players. The Games have been played between cities, businesses, faith and interfaith organizations, schools, and even prisons. Participating teams in the Compassion Games perform acts of kindness and service, reporting on the number of volunteers, hours of service, money raised for local causes, and the number of people served, providing measurable results that can be improved upon, year after year.

What We Aim to Do With Your Support!

Compassion Games International (CGI) is striving to recruit 10,000 players - known as Agents of Compassion - and over 300 global compassion teams to disseminate the antidote to heal and revitalize our world. Together, we want to ignite a culture of kindness through the power of play and compassionate action.

Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to become a Champion of Compassion. By becoming a Champion, you can help attract and support players from around the planet to engage in acts of compassion that will serve millions of people throughout the year by playing the Compassion Games!

Play as Well as Donate!

column1:
Champions of Compassion are people who accelerate the spread of compassion around the planet. Champions recognize the fundamental importance of compassion - and “Survival of the Kindest” -  in our increasingly globalized communities, and wish to use their personal power to positively influence the development of a more compassionate world!

Champions of Compassion Do the Following:
• Donate to this crowdfunding campaign to make the Compassion Games possible, and choose from a variety of heartfelt and exciting perks!
• Play your heart out in the Compassion Games!
• Invite others to become Champion of Compassions, too!

Indie-GoGo makes it easy for you to share this campaign with others! Invite them to be a part of this movement of compassion, and to take part in building the legacy of the Compassion Games! Check out some of the share tools below!

Why Do We Need Funding?

For the past 3 years, the Compassion Games has sustained itself on grass-roots ruggedness and small philanthropic donations. From students challenging one another to bring compassion into schools, to people in prisons showing kindness to one another with unprecedented incidences of no violence, the Games have surprised the world at their ability to adapt creatively to any community who wants to embrace and play them.

We are positively thrilled with the volume of requests from communities to participate in the Games! With this campaign, we are raising $25,000 to help meet this expanding demand, as well as successfully accomplish the following:

The $25,000 raised will help cover the cost of producing, hosting, and promoting new coopetitions during MLK Day, and in December through our ""Back to School"" event. They will go towards improving the player experience overall through an improved website and reporting experience, as well as creating exciting developments like ""Mission Training Modules"" that players can use to train their compassion muscles all year-long. We will build upon this year's efforts to serve military families and first responders, and cover more of the exceptional feats of compassionate actions from players and teams around the world to honor their resilience and dedication.

These funds will support this recruitment campaign to enroll 10,000 Agents of Compassion, and providing the technical backbone support to enable thousands of people to sign up and organize teams.

Lastly, these funds will help us provide personalized coaching and support for organizers and participating players. They will also help us to ensure that we are providing resources to teams that are in need of financial support. The more funds we raise the more players we can support!

How the Compassion Games Work

Players can participate in the Compassion Games as an individual by performing acts of kindness, such as visiting someone who is sick, acknowledging the kindness of a stranger, cleaning up litter, or volunteering to support a local cause.

Players can also join or organize a Team that may include friends, families, co-workers, classmates, congregants, or our neighbors, and can organize or join service projects to give back to our communities. Service projects can strengthen what is already taking place or lead to new projects, such as distributing clothing to the homeless, planting a community garden (and donating the food!), or helping a neighbor with home repairs.

After the acts of compassion and service projects have been completed, teams and individuals report and reflect on their activities and outcomes on a Compassion Report Map to measure impact and inspire others to get involved. Through these Compassion Reports, we are able to measure and benchmark the collective impact that our actions have on our world, allowing us to challenge ourselves to be more compassionate than ever before as we build our capacity to bring compassion to life, year after year!

Stories About the Impact of the Compassion Games

The Compassion Games have inspired innovative and meaningful ways to engage communities. For example, Metro Detroit used the Games to identify many of the places in Detroit that they cherish and love. The goal was to heighten appreciation of their physical environment, their sense of social cohesion, and their experience of safety and peace within their neighborhoods as a regenerative response to racial violence. Mayor Greg Fischer from Louisville organized Give-A-Day during the Mayor’s Week of Service where 50,778 meals were packed by volunteers for Kids Against Hunger, 6 abandoned houses were renovated/new homes were built and 12,418 volunteers helped to clean up Louisville. In North Thurston County, Washington State, 50 schools participated by forming a currency, called “Coins of Compassion”, given to anyone who committed an act of kindness, whether that be a student, teacher, or administrator. In a women’s correctional facility in California, over 10,000 acts of kindness were reported and there was an unprecedented 11 days without violence.

Read the “Love the Hell Out of Metro Detroit” story here.
Read the story about Mayor Greg Fischer and Give-a-Day here.
Read the Coins of Compassion in Schools story here.
Read how the Games were played in a Women’s Correctional Facility here.
<span style=""color: rgb(0, 0, 0)
An Antidote to the ""Hunger Games"" of Our Time

In 2008, Seattle hosted a five day, free public event called the Seeds of Compassion with His Holiness the Dalai Lama, Archbishop Desmond Tutu, and many other luminaries. Remarkably, it turned out to be the largest event in the history of Washington State. 2008 is also the year author and religious scholar Karen Armstrong won the TED Prize, of which winners are given one wish to change the world. Karen wished for a ""Charter for Compassion"" for our time, a Charter that would globally ratify the Golden Rule across cultures, religions, and secular traditions. In 2009, the Charter for Compassion was unveiled. In 2010, Seattle became the first city in the world to affirm the Charter for Compassion and embarked upon a ten-year campaign to transform itself into a compassionate city. (To date, over 350 communities around the world have also affirmed the Charter for Compassion.)

Outside of Seattle, one city and its Mayor were particularly outstanding in taking on this challenge: the city of Louisville, Kentucky and its Mayor, Greg Fischer. The Mayor of Louisville boldly (and playfully) claimed that his city was ""the most compassionate city in the world, and would be so until proven otherwise."" The city of Seattle responded with a resounding ""What?! Game on!"" and the Compassion Games: Survival of the Kindest were born. (Note: Nobody can lose the Compassion Games, and as the more people play, the more people win!)

In 2012 there were two teams in the Compassion Games, Seattle and Louisville. In 2013, two teams grew to nineteen, and in 2014, there were 159 teams from around the world who participated in the Compassion Games who collectively served over 1 million people with more than 100,000 volunteers.

We are still calculating the tremendous results from the 2015 Compassion Games, but the early stats are in!
<li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Over 190 teams played in this year’s 2015 Compassion Games.

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Over 1,000 new individuals ""Agents"" signed up to play.

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Over 300 events were posted to the calendar that were part of the Games.

column1: <li>
<span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >Over 4,000 Secret Agents of Compassion received daily missions each morning of the Games.

column1: <li><span style=""color: rgb(106, 106, 106)
column5: >The Compassion Games’ Facebook page grew from 2,500 Likes to 15,000+!

column1: How Can Compassion and Play Change the World?

Why Does This All Matter?

Compassion is the antidote to the fear, disconnection, and isolation of our time. Scientific research abounds in revealing the intrinsic human necessity for compassion to flourish in our personal, professional, and civic lives. As a profound source of power within each of us, playing with compassion inspires us to connect authentically with one another, rejuvenating our spirits as we actively live into a positive vision of our world, together.

The Charter for Compassion finishes with the following Call-to-Action:

“We urgently need to make compassion a clear, luminous and dynamic force in our polarized world. Rooted in a principled determination to transcend selfishness, compassion can break down political, dogmatic, ideological and religious boundaries. Born of our deep interdependence, compassion is essential to human relationships and to a fulfilled humanity. It is the path to enlightenment, and indispensable to the creation of a just economy and a peaceful global community.”

Help support the Compassion Games to bring this vision to reality. Game on!

column4:
>

Jon Ramer: Founder and “First First Follower” of Compassion Games International, Ramer was moved by the events of Sept. 11, 2001 to focus his entrepreneurial energies on non-profit community organizing. In 2008, Ramer was an organizational participant in The Seeds of Compassion, an event aligned with a visit to Seattle by H.H. Dalai Lama. As Executive Director of the Compassionate Action Network, Ramer conceived and implemented the International Campaign for Compassionate Cities. He is the co-author, with Phil Lane, Jr., of “Deep Social Networks and the Digital Fourth Way.”  You can learn more about Jon here.

column1: Chief Phil Lane, Jr.: Chairman of Compassion Games International, Lane is an internationally recognized Indigenous leader and a traditionally recognized Hereditary Chief and Elder. He is the founder and chairman of the Four World’s International Institute (FWII), which works to build partnerships with all nations and peoples. He is an enrolled member of the Ihanktonwan Dakota and Chickasaw Nations, and is a citizen of both Canada and the United States.

Sande Hart: Sande Hart is the International Head Coach of the Compassion Games, a Chief Compassion Officer of Compassionate California, a Charter for Compassion Charter Partner. Sande is also Founding President of S.A.R.A.H. Spiritual and Religious Alliance for Hope (S.A.R.A.H.), a women’s interfaith community building organization with the goal of empower women and community, end religiously motivated violence, and to promote a culture of peace, Author of Make A Difference 101-Community Service
column2: A Practical Step-by-Step Guide for Kids, Past Chair of the United Religions Initiative North America region, Community Builder, Relationship Weaver, and Workshop Facilitator.

column1: Phyllis Shulman: Phyllis has comprehensive experience initiating, developing, leading and implementing innovative policies, programs and projects on a wide range of issues including sustainability, climate change and adaptation, emergency preparedness and response, economic development, food systems, and transportation.  She thrives on applying systems approaches to complex issues. In her role as a Senior Advisor for a Seattle City Councilmember she developed new initiatives including a Resilient City Strategy, food system action plan, and neighborhood planning. Phyllis’ broad background includes community organizing, organizational development, and conflict resolution and she has worked in the non-profit, business, government and education sectors. She is currently working as an independent consultant in local and regional food systems, community resilience and compassionate action.

Joey Crotty: The youngest of the Compassion Games team by at least a century, Joey utilizes his talents as a hopeless storyteller and writer, creative developer, rogue designer and cultural philosopher to elevate the evolutionary capacity of consciousness and compassion in the world. Joey is an undergraduate researcher and co-founder of the Consciousness Club at the University of Washington – Bothell. He is a major organizer toward the creation of the Center for Education and Research in Consciousness (CERC), the first center of its kind at a public university. Joey enjoys spontaneous song-making, belly laughter, all of nature, and learning from the wisdom of little ones to get out there and play like his life depended on it.

Dr. Lesa Walker:  As a physician, for over 30 years Lesa has worked extensively in the field of public health and preventive medicine with a focus on designing public health service systems for children and youth with disabilities at the state and national levels. For 24+ years she was the Medical Director of the Children with Special Health Care Needs (CSHCN) Services Program and served as the Title V CSHCN Director at the Texas Department of State Health Services. Currently, she continues working part-time as a medical consultant, however her energy has shifted to a direct focus on compassion. She serves as an Education Program Associate of the Charter for Compassion International and as a member of the Leadership Team of the Compassion Games International. Lesa made a shift in her work life to allow her to devote more creative energy to engaging people in the practice “3D” Compassion (caring for others, self, and the Earth).

Sommer Joy Albertsen: Sommer Joy Albertsen is an Energy Brilliance Healer, Nia Brown Belt Teacher, and Compassion Games International Unicorn. She is passionate about equitable social justice for all. Sommer has been a presenter in many different conference settings, including wellness, medical, healing arts, and innovative social entrepreneurship gatherings. She makes a positive impact in partnership with diverse communities such as women's &
column2: girls leaders, environmentalists, people with disabilities, senior citizens, and Indigenous Peoples. She talks and walks the path of sacred space and unconditional love. Sommer has traveled to many places on Earth, turning the volume on high for authentic joy and embodiment of the Gandhi way: ""Be the change you want to see in the world.""

column1: Andy Smallman: Andy Smallman is the founding director of Puget Sound Community School, an independent school in Seattle for students in grades 6-12. With his wife, Melinda Shaw, and a dedicated group of parents, he started the school in 1994 to create a model for a style of education that helps students build on their strengths and nurtures their intrinsic motivation. Since the founding of PSCS, Andy has facilitated classes on the subject of kindness, the purpose of which is to help people connect to their true nature and increase peace in the world.
